loans.name: Gazihan

texts.ru:
Gazihan Gajaliev was born and continues to live in the Agsu region. He was born in 1958. he is married and has 4 children. His whole family is involved in one business – raising livestock. They have been in this business for 10 years. Gazihan has plans to grow his family business with the help of this loan. Gazihan applied for a loan to Normicro, Agsu branch.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Гаджалыев Газыхан родился и проживает в Ахсуниском районе. 1958 года рождения. Семейный. Имеет четверых детей. Вся семья занимается одним бизнесом,скотоводством. Десять лет не прошло даром. Но в этом остановливатся он не собирается. Нужен кредит чтобы расширятся. Газыхан обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.

loans.use: To increase the guantity of animals

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate P. sells second-hand clothing. She is married and has three children. Her husband drives a commercial vehicle and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She is helping her husband with the family expenses. She wishes to increase her income but doesn't have enough capital.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Sabina Guicoy

texts.es:
Sabina has been raising, feeding and selling pigs since she was 15 years old. She is now 53 years old. She is single but has a 30 year old son, who she successfully raised by herself thanks to her business.

She buys pigs from different neighbors and friends when they are two months old, she raises and feeds them, and when they are 6 months old she sells them in the local market or larger meat market. Nevertheless, many people look for her to purchase her pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Sabina se ha dedicado a la crianza, engorde y venta de marranos desde cuando ella tenia 15 años. Ella tiene ahora 53 años. Ella es soltera, pero tiene un hijo de 30 años de edad, el cual ella sola saco adelante gracias a su negocio.

Ella compra los marranos con diferentes vecinos y amigos cuando tienen 2 meses de tamaño, los cuida y alimenta, para cuando llegan a los 6 meses, los vende en el mercado de la localidad o ferias; sin embargo, muchas personas la buscan para comprarle sus marranos.

loans.use: Sell pigs.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
For several years Concepción C. has operated a small business making food and bread, which she makes in her house and later sells in the neighborhood.

Concepción is 48 years old and is raising three children and providing for their development and education. She has turned to Ceprodel for a loan which she will use to purchase the ingredients necessary for making her delicious dishes and breads. She hopes with confidence that her loan application will be approved so she can continue supporting her humble family.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La dama Concepción C. se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de elaboración de manjares o pan los que son elaborados en su propia casa de habitación para luego comercializarlos en su sector de habitación.

Ella es una dama de 48 años y con tres hijos en el deber de mantener y proporcionarles las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo y educación. Hoy en día se ha acercado a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima para elaborar los deliciosos manjares y panes. Espera confiadamente que su crédito le sea otorgado y así continuar manteniendo su humilde familia.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia has four children. She started her business four years ago to cover the additional expenses of her growing children. At that time she began by selling cosmetics to family and neighbors, and now she has an established network of customers. She is contributing even more to her family's income.

Silvia requests a loan for $600 to be paid back in 6 months to purchase merchandise and fill pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Silvia tiene cuatro hijos, inicio su negocio hace 4 años, porque necesitaba aumentar los ingresos familiares cuando sus hijos empezaron a crecer, y aumentaron sus gastos. Inicio vendiendo cosméticos con su familia y vecinos y de ahí se animo a seguir vendiendo y ahora ya tiene su cartera de clientes, obteniendo mejores ingresos para su familia.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir algunos pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Mrs. Reth E. sells firewood in the village of Sre Sa Village iin Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Huon Yorng, gathers firewood for his wife to sell. They have six children, four of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or enroll in school. Mrs. Reth E.'s family now lives in an old house and in poor conditions. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Reth is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Reth E. had previously obtained a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she has paid the loan back in full.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis habita en un barrio Anexo Villa Libertad, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 15 años de edad, que estudian uno en primaria y el otro en secundaria. El trabajo de don José es la soldadura y también es albañil con trece años de experiencia, cuando inició comenzó con su papa y otros amigos pero ahora hace su trabajo independiente.  La solicitud de préstamo es para comprar un soldador de segunda mano para poder hacer sus trabajos y no tener que alquilarlo, y poder ir teniendo sus propias herramientas de trabajo. Sus planes son obtener mejores herramientas para facilitar el trabajo y brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes y también poder ayudar a sus hijos en la superación de sus estudios.
texts.en:
José Luis lives in the Anexo Villa Libertad neighborhood. He is married and has two children of six and fifteen years of age. His wife tends to their home while his children attend primary and secondary school, respectively. He works as a welder and also has thirteen years of experience as a bricklayer. Initially, he worked with his father and a few friends, but he now works independently. He hopes the loan will enable him to buy a second-hand welder so as to eliminate the cost of renting it. His plans are to obtain better tools that both make his work less cumbersome and enable him to serve his clients better. In this way he hopes to help his children succeed in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a welder

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru: Зоиров Эмомали житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 44 года ,женат ,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Эмомали  занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов. Он покупает  на оптовом рынке товар и реализует его в розницу .На доход  от  торговли  он содержит семью.Так как дети клиента еще учатся в  средней школе. На полученный кредит Эмомали  планирует  закупить товар.Погасит кредит в течении 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Emomali Z. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 44 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary education. Emomali is in the business of buying and selling of construction materials. He buys wholesale on the market and then sells it retail. He uses the profits to support his family because his children are still going to school. Emomali plans to use the loan to buy more materials. He plans to pay off the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Zikran M.rafiq Group

texts.en:
Zikran baji is the wife of M. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She has lived in this city for the past 30 years. Zikran baji is the mother of three sons; the older two are in the wood selling business and the youngest is still in school. Zikran baji's husband has been selling wood for the past 15 years. Zikran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

She successfully repaid her prior two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her family business. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sajida baji, Sakina baji, Husna baji and Razia baji are each requesting loans to buy wood for resale. Shakooran baji is requesting a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Zahida baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy more wood for resale.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: El Señor Héctor Manuel Batz de 34 años de edad,  Casado de oficios Comerciante, “Confección de playeras” cuenta con un taller de 4 Maquinas,  habita conjuntamente con su Esposa y sus hijos, cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad, desde su juventud se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los Préstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la Confección de Playeras para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejor condición de vida a su familia. Tales como los estudios de sus hijos y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Héctor Manuel Batz is 34 years old and is a merchant who makes woven shoes. He has a workshop with 4 machines and lives with his wife and children. They have three employees. Since his youth, he has worked in crafts; thanks to the loans he was able to take his family forward. In his home in Paraje Chichaclan of Cantón Paquí in town and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala he is a very well-known person. He asked for a loan from Asociación Asdir so that he can purchase the raw materials for the production of woven shoes to provide for and to be able to meet the demand of his clients. In this way, he will be able to improve his family’s life by earning more money and provided for his children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (To increase capital)

loans.name: Frescia Doris

texts.es:
La señorita Frescia Doris tiene 25 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero debido a la falta de recursos económicos es que no continua estudiando, pero piensa auto sostenerse. Es soltera y trabaja en el taller de la señora Selena Castro en las galerías Don Carlos en el stand 293 frente al mercado mayorista de Trujillo.
El primer crédito fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, el cual lo invirtió en telas para confeccionar polos y venderlos.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, volverá a comprar telas para confeccionar polos deportivos.
Frescia sueña con tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Frescia Doris is 25 years old and belongs to the Grupo Solidario Azucenas in Villa Hermosa. She lives in the Huanchaco district in the Trujillo province in Libertad, Peru. She completed secondary school but due to a lack of financial resources she did not continue, but she wants to support herself. She is single and works in Selena Castro's workshop in the Don Carlos gallery, at stand number 293 in front of the wholesale market in Trujillo. Her first loan was paid in 4 payments and she used it to buy material to make sports jerseys and sell them. With this second loan, which she will also pay in 4 payments, she will once again buy material to make sports jerseys. Frescia dreams of having her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to make athletic jerseys to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Carmen P. R. es casada y ella se dedica a la venta de artículos nuevos negocio en el cual ya lleva 5 años en operación y es atendido por ella, su esposo trabaja en la construcción de calles y pavimentación.
La señora Maria Del Carmen está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más artículos y surtir más su negocio para así poder obtener más ingresos los cuales ayudarán para solventar los gastos que puedan ocurrir en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Del Carmen P. R. is married and has been selling all kinds of new items for 5 years. Her husband builds and paves roads for a living.

Ms. Maria Del Carmen is requesting this loan in order to purchase more products and restock her business so that she can obtain more profits, thus helping her cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Irma Ciriaca

texts.es:
Durante veintitrés años Irma se dedico a atender en su puesto de condimentos y especerías en el mercado de su localidad. No le iba mal en su negocio, sin embargo creyó necesario mudarse a su casa y emprender uno nuevo  ya que quería dedicarle mas tiempo a su única hija de dieciséis años.

Es así que hace un año dejó su puesto del mercado, que ahora lo alquila a una tercera persona, y diariamente, como ambulante, vende desayunos y jugos en la esquina de su casa.

Irma es una persona muy alegre que vela por el bienestar de su pequeña familia. Por ahora esta renovando sus electrodomésticos poco a poco ya que dentro de un periodo de tiempo piensa construir en la esquina de su casa una juguería.
texts.en:
For 23 years Irma manned her condiments and spices stall in her local market. Business was not bad but she felt nevertheless that she had to move her business to her home and open a new one as she wanted to spend more time with her only daughter of 16. And so a year ago she left her stall in the market, which she now rents to a someone else, and every day she sell breakfasts and toys at the street corner by her house. Irma is a very happy person who watches out for the wellbeing of her little family. She is now fixing her home appliances little by little as in a short while she is thinking of building a stall at the corner of her home from which to sell juices.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new stall to sell juices

loans.name: Sos

texts.en: Sos M. is 28 years old and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She has a grocery store, making around US$ 10 in revenue each day, while her husband earns US$ 5 per day growing and selling yams. This couple has two children and both of them are in school. Sos M. is asking for a loan so that she can add to her grocery inventory to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: increased inventory

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah E. is married and has one child. She has not received schooling through formal education. Since 2007 Hannah has sold red oil and palm kennel oil at the Elmina first port. She is married and her husband’s occupation is that of a porter.

Hannah uses her income to help support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Hannah will use the loan to purchase additional stock which will enable her to increase her sales of red oil and palm kennel oil to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to reinvest to promote the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Purchase additional red oil and palm kennel oil for resale.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La señora Alba Luz tiene 42 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de 8 y 16 años de edad, su esposo es maestro de obra, reside en el barrio La Fuente del pali 1 c al sur. Ella es docente de primaria, y sus planes es poder estar en mejores condiciones para ofrecer a su familia. Este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic del cual se ha beneficiado para hacer las mejoras a su casa. Con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su cuarto y comprar madera para el piso, da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo bienestar que ha sido para su familia. Sus mejores deseos es poder ayudar a sus hijos que sean hombres profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba Luz is a 42-year-old married mother of two sons, aged 8 and 16 years old. Her husband is a master carpenter, and they live in the La Fuente neighborhood. She teaches at the elementary school and her plans are to improve her family's living conditions. This is her second loan with Afodenic having previously used a loan to make improvements on her house. With this loan she will buy construction materials to make improvements to her room and wood for the flooring. She is grateful to the institution for its support of her family's improved living conditions. Her ultimate dream is to help her sons to grow up to become men with careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to complete home improvements

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie E. is a pig grower. She is 51 years old and has 7 children. She always dreamed of having a bigger farm. She wanted to make her business grow to support her children who are starting their own families.

She is a former employee of a radio station in Mindanao. She quit her job because she married her husband, Moises E.. Now she is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. Presently she has 3 pigs which she is raising for fattening. She started her business in 2001 and until now was able to sustain her piggery.

CEVI helps her grow her business even more. She receives not just loans, but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla T. est conducteur de taxi moto à Kpalime, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale. Il est dévoué dans cette activité. Komla exerce cette fonction depuis trois ans mais la moto qu’il conduit ne l’appartenait pas. Avec ce crédit, KOmla désire acquérir sa propre moto afin de mieux gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Komla T. is a moto taxi drive in Kpalime, a city located about 120 km from Lomé, the capital. He is dedicated in this work. He has been working in this capacity for three years, but the moto he’s driving didn’t belong to him. With this loan, Komla would like to acquire his own moto in order to earn a better living.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa R. D. Leca tiene 62 años, vive en el distrito D. la Esperanza, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, no tiene hijos que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Teresa se dedica a la venta D. productos D. pan llevar, el negocio se inicio hace 25 años, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco comunal Bellavista  II, lo invirtió en la compra D. insumos (arroz, azúcar, fideo, galletas).
El crédito D. 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos ((arroz, azúcar, fideo, galletas) y una vitrina.
Teresa tiene como sueño tener su propio un minimarket  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Teresa R. D. Leca is 62 years old, and she lives in the La Esperanza district in the Trujillo region, in La Libertad, Peru.

She completed primary school, and she has no children that are still dependent on her.

Teresa runs a conveniece store, a business she started 25 years ago, and she runs it from her home.

Her first loan of 300 soles from the Bellavista II community bank (Kiva Field Partner) was invested in the purchase of items such as rice, sugar, pasta, and cookies.

This loan of 300 soles will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, cookies, and a display case.

Teresa's dream is to have her own minimarket and to grow as a business owner.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items such as rice, sugar, pasta, cookies, and a display case.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Хамробоева  1960 года рождения, замужем  имеет 4 детей.  Имеет среднее образование.  С мужем имеют магазин  и торгуют бытовой техникой.  Муж ездит за товаром и подготавливает различные документации необходимых для бизнеса. А она сама сидит за прилавком и торгует техникой- телевизор, DVD,  соковыжималки , микроволновой и еще много разной техникой.  Кредит потребовался для оплаты аренды помещения и привоза небольшого товара.
texts.en:
Mahbuba H. was born in 1960. She is married and has four children. She has achieved a secondary education. She and her husband have a store which sells household appliances. Her husband travels to get goods and to obtain various documents necessary for the business. But she alone sits in the stall and sells household goods: televisions, DVD, juicemakers, microwaves as well as a large variety of appliances. The loan is needed to pay rent for the facility and transportation of small goods.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase electronic appliances

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хосият Махмудова  торгует на рынке «Бадахшан».  Ассортимент ее товара это фрукты и овощи, которые каждое утро она покупает у поставщиков. В торговле ей помогает старший сын Азамат. В этом году он закончил школу и теперь готовиться поступать в Университет. Азамат мечтает стать программистом.
Второму сыну Хосият 12 лет, он учится в школе. К сожалению, дети растут без отца. Хосият развелась с мужем 5 лет назад. И с тех самых пор, она занялась микропредпринимательской деятельностью. Для закупа фруктов и овощей ей необходима сумма в размере 800 сомони. С этой целью она подала заявку на КИВА, и ждет материальной поддержки.
texts.en:
Hosiyat M. sells fruits and vegetables at the Badahshan market. She buys the products every morning from suppliers. Her oldest son, Azamat, helps her with the sales. He finished school this year and is now getting ready to go to the University. Azmat dreams about becoming a computer programmer. Hosiyat’s second son is 12 years old; he goes to school. Unfortunately, the children are growing up without a father. Hosiyat divorced her husband 5 years ago. Since then, she became involved in an entrepreneurship. She needs a sum of 800 somoni in order to buy fruits and vegetables. She put in the request to Kiva for this purpose and is waiting for financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juana Alberta

texts.es:
la señora Juana Alberta F. C. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Saul Martinez,  tienen un hijo pequeño, Saul trabaja en la pesca y Juana produce y vende rosquillas y tambien vende pescado que su esposo trae del mar. Juana necesita el crédito para comprar mas productos y asi tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtengan poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 
ella tiene muchos deseos de superarse, tambien piensa mucho en su hijo, ya que para ella es lo mas importante en su vida, quiere que sea una persona de bien y tambien profesianal.
texts.en:
Juana Alberta F. C. is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband Saul Martinez, with whom she has a young son. Saul works as a fisherman and Juana makes and sells pastries and also sells the fish her husband brings in from the sea. She is requesting the loan to purchase more production so she can increase her production. With the increase in profits, she can help her husband with household expenses. She has a strong desire to move up in life, and also thinks a lot about her son, who is the most important thing in her life. She wants him to be a good and successful person.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase curd, cheese, flour, fireword, lard, salt and plastic bags for her pastry business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, con quienes vive junto a su esposo en su casa, la cual esta en plena construcción. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar por las diversas necesidades que tenía dentro de su hogar, de esta forma logra independizarse y obtener experiencia en la actividad de la costura, la cual desempeña desde hace 15 años. Fruto de su trabajo son las máquinas de costura que pudo comprar, las cuales le facilitan el trabajo. Patricia trabaja en su casa durante todo el día, según la cantidad de pedidos que reciba de las fábricas y dentro de sus múltiples actividades también trata de elaborar prendas propias para venderlas a sus vecinos y parientes. Ahora Patricia se está proyectando para vender sus propios diseños en los mercados de su localidad, por tal motivo está tratando de mejorar su taller de costura para convertirlo en el futuro en una micro empresa familiar donde sus hijos tengan un apoyo económico - laboral. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, ella nos comenta que lo que más le gusta del trabajo con su banco comunal es que todas sus compañeras son puntuales en sus pagos, y esto fomenta el progreso del grupo. Los 1300 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de materiales textiles que requiere para la entrega de sus últimos pedidos.
texts.en:
Patricia is married and has 3 young children. Her home is currently under construction. She began working from a young age in order to meet the various needs of her household, find a way to achieve her independence, and gain experience as a seamstress. Patricia started her business 15 years ago. As a result of her hard work, she was able to buy sewing machines to help make her job easier.

Patricia works from home all day, fulfilling the orders she receives from factories and also designing her own clothing that she sells to neighbors and relatives. She now plans to develop her own clothing line to market to stores in the area. In order to do this, she plans to expand her sewing workshop by converting it in the future into a family microbusiness that provides her children employment and financial support.

This will be Patricia’s 12th loan with MFP. She says she likes working with her Communal Bank because all of the members make their payments on time, which helps the group get ahead. Her loan of 1300 soles will be used to purchase textile materials needed to fulfill her latest orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase textile materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 57 años de edad, estado civil soltera sin hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Chojña Nati 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de vacunos que  luego de mejorarlos los venderá en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the “Manuela de Hoy II” Community Bank, which is located in the community of Camicachi of the district of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 57 years old, single, with no children and has completed primary school. She lives in the community of Chojña Nati. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 2 years, with an initial loan of 500 new soles for the purchase of young cattle. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 300 new soles for the purchase of cattle. After improving their condition, she will sell then in regional markets. Her wish is to continue working. She likes saving and meeting people at the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cattle

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
B. Aisha, 49, is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She received a loan previously that she used so well and now needs another. She is a businesswoman with a restaurant that she has owned for a long time.

Aisha is a widow with five children aged 13 to 30 years and she also takes care of six dependents. She is grateful that at least she does not have to pay fees for her primary-school-going children but pays for those in higher institutions.

Aisha’s business is doing well because of the way she handles her customers and this has even won her more customers. She still has a dream of building her own house that can accommodate her restaurant. She needs a loan to help buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Jonaldine

texts.en:
Jonaldine B. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Jonaldine is single. Jonaldine owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fish. Jonaldine has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Jonaldine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonaldine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell.

Jonaldine is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jonaldine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont tous des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Mancourani II, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur sixième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. 
Elles font de la vente de condiments alimentaires, de pagnes wax et de chaussures. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 cartons de condiments alimentaires, 50 paires de chaussures  et  5 pièces de pagnes wax.  
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et vendent à Sikasso ville: à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles espèrent avoir des prêts plus importants pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  faire de l’épargne pour préparer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Sabougnouma are all married women who average 40 years of age and 3 children each.  They live for the most part in monogamous families in Mancourani II, a district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of Mali).  They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their sixth solidarity loan.  All the previous loans have been repaid without any difficulties at all. The group members sell condiments, shoes, and Wax  pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  With their new loan, they intend to buy 20 boxes of condiments, 50 pairs of shoes, and 5 bolts of Wax pagnes.  The merchandise is gotten at the big market of Sikasso City and is sold in Sikasso, in homes, at the marketplaces, and door-to-door in the districts.  Sales are made in cash and often on credit to customers composed of men and women.  The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 19,500 francs CFA.  A portion of the profits will be put into savings for family needs.  And the other portion will be re-invested into the businesses.  The women hope to have larger loans to satisfy their customers further and to save more money to provide a future for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Djiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguissèmè est composé de huit femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles polygames élargies avec en moyenne 42 ans, 5 enfants et habitant le quartier Service Kin (Diamarabougou) de Markala (4ème Région administrative  de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et d’appartenance à même  association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier.  Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les draps de lit, les pagnes wax, la couture,  du poisson, la fabrication des boissons non alcoolisées, du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois,  des céréales etc.
Après quatre prêts solidaires, tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur cinquième  qui sera  utilisé pour acheter, 21 pièces de pagnes wax, 50 pièces de popeline, 5 rouleaux de files à broder, 20 sacs de riz, 8 sacs de haricot, 30 kg de gingembre, 5 seaux de citron, 2 sacs de sucre, 5 paquets d’essences aromatisées, 20  chargements de charrettes en bois de bois et 30 sacs de charbon de bois. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  en pagnes wax et en tissus une fois par mois à Bamako et  quelques rares fois  au grand marché de Ségou, en céréales à Boussin, Dougabougou et Katièna, en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à Markala, en ingrédients pour la préparation de jus locaux sur place à la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou Markala, en bois de chauffe et en charbon de bois à Sarakala. 
La vente se fait sur place à domicile ou en ambulant  au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles  espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 60.000 FCFA qui servira à satisfaire certaines charges de la famille (savon, prix de condiments et habillement), à payer les fournitures scolaires des enfants et à rembourser les intérêts du prêt. 
Elles ont pour ambitions d’assurer l’éducation de leurs enfants, l’achat des matériels agricoles et de machines à coudre.
texts.en:
Group Djiguisseme is made up of eight married women in mostly big polygamous extended families who average 42 years of age, five children and live in the Service Kin( Diamarabougou) neighborhood of Markala ( fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They knew each other through neighborhood relationship and membership in the same traditionnal women's association of the neighborhood. This women's group trade in various items such as bed sheets, wax fabrics, dressmaking, fish, making of non alcoholic drinks, firewood, cereals etc. After four group loans, all repaid correctly, they are on their fifth loan which will be used to buy 21 pieces of wax fabrics, 50 pieces of poplin, 5 rolls of embroidery floss, 20 bags of rice, 8 bags of beans, 30kg of ginger, 5 buckets of lemon, 2 bags of sugar, 5 packets of flavoured species, 20 loads of wooden carts of wood, and 30 bags of charcoal. They get their supplies of wax cloth and materials once a month in Bamako and a few times in the big Segou market, cereals in Boussin, Dougabougou and Ketiena, fish by River Niger in Markala, ingredients for the preparation of local juice right in the weekly market of Diamarabougou Markala, firewood and charcoal at Sarakala. They sell right at home or by door-to-door for cash or for credit to a clientele made of women and men. They hope to make an average monthly profit of 60 000FCFA which will be used to meet some expenses of their families ( soap, buying of ingredients and clothes), to pay for children's school supplies and to repay the interest of the loan. Their aim is to ensure the education of their children, the purchase of agricultural equipment and sewing machines.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.en:
The "Mujeres Progresistas" (Progressive Women) group was formed in the city of JA Saldivar in July 2009 through the initiative of Ms. Basilisa A., who had participated in the program for Female Entrepreneurship before. She contacted her local entrepreneurship and microfinance counselor, and discussed continuing her work with Fundacion Paraguaya. She gathered 15 women, all of whom work comfortably together today and support each other in solidarity with their shared goals.  
The group's members use their loans to invest in their individual activities, such as selling food, haberdashery, goods, herbs, garlic, cleaning products, mandioca (cassava), cushions, fruits, etc. 
A particularly inspirational woman in this committee is Doña Felicita Pavon. Her story exemplifies the hard work that women in Paraguay put into their businesses and how female entrepreneurship makes a big difference in their lives and the lives of their families. Doña Felicita Pavon sells groceries to help her husband with family expenses. She has three children, all of school-age. Her husband has temporary jobs, but no stable, fixed employment or salary. 
Doña Felicita bakes small pies, makes sandwiches, patties and pastries to sell to her neighbors and workers who live and work in her community. Doña Felicita finds it very difficult to sustain and grow a business when she has such a high turn over rate - which is why the loan she receives from the Fundacion is so helpful. She can continually invest more into her business and let it grow and increase her profits. She also finds the help she receives from the Fundacion in terms of training and preparation, very helpful. The challenges faced by a poor family are very unique and need special attention. 
All committee members help each other to reach their common goals to better their livelihoods and achieve prosperity - the same goals as the Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
la sra. Sandra L. tiene 34 años de edad, tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual tiene 1 año de haberla iniciado, en estos momentos necesita un credito para poder surtir mas su negocio ya que ahora lo tiene un poco vacio. a tenido problemas durante todo este año pero piensa que con este credito su negocio va a crecer y va a salir adelante.
es casada y vive con su familia, este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos.
su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, asi atiende a sus clientes durante todo el dia y no descuida a sus hijos.
su meta a corto plazo es poder tener una pulperia bien surtida y grande.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra L. is 34 years old and has a small general store which she opened 1 year ago. She needs a loan right now so she can stock up as the store is a little empty. She has had problems this year but she thinks that with this credit she can grow and move ahead. She is married and lives with her family. This business is her only source of income and is situated in her home. Because of this she can attend to her clients all day and doesn’t have to leave her children. Her goal in the short term is to have a general store that is big and well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soaps, candles, matches, lard, oil, margarine, beans, rice, tortillas, bread, sodas, pills, instant soaps, salt and condiments

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en: For the last six years, Milkah has been running the Sharp Minds Junior Academy in a conducive place for learning. She has ten employees. Her business challenges are high rent and inadequate space for sports. She is using this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add more tables and chairs. In the future, she wants to run a bigger school. Milkah is married and has three children. She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and tables for a school

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana B. de 47 años, vive en una casa de cemento con agua y luz como servicio básicos su vivienda esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, esta divorciada tiene 3 hijos uno de 22 años, 19 años y 17 años dos estudian en un colegio fiscal.

Ana comenzó criando pollos y chanchos para venderlos por su sector pero como no le fue muy bien decidió retirarte de eso y comenzar la actividad de comerciante. Ahora ana vende perfumes, cosas para la cocina, ropa entre otras cosas. Una de las mayores dificultades es la cobranza que hace a sus clientes ya que no quieren cancelar.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y más utensilios para el hogar y así tener más variedad en lo que vende. En el futuro quiere tener un gabinete de belleza y hay vender también todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Ana B. is 47. She lives in a cement house that has basic services like running water and electricity. Her house is located in the Perimetral sector of Guayaquil. She is divorced, and has three children. The children are 22, 19, and 17; and they go to a public school. Ana started raising chickens and pigs to sell in her sector. But, that did not go well for her. She decided to stop doing it, and she became a businesswoman. She now sells perfumes, things for the kitchen, and clothes, among other things. One of the biggest difficulties is collecting from her customers who do not want to pay. She will use the loan to buy clothes and household utensils. That way she will have a greater variety to sell. In the future she wants to have a beauty shop and also sell all of her products

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Utensils for the home and clothes

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra Maria es una pequeña comerciante del sector de El Almendro, vende cosmeticos, ropa zapatos y encargos que le hacen sus clientes, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien asume los gastos del hogar, ademas poseen un negocio familiar que atiende su marido, es un taller de mecanica en esta misma zona, de donde obtienen ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.  Sandra esta solicitando su 1er credito esperando ser beneficiada con el fondo kiva para realizar mejoras a su vivienda, construyendo un dormitorio y de esta manera mejorr la calidad de vida de su familia; es muy reconocida en su comunidad como una mujer trabajadora, de buena conducta, siempre luchando por su trabajo para salir adelante en la educacion de sus hijos, su mayor sueño es que su familia viva en una casa con las condiciones basicas.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is a small merchant in the El Almendro sector; she sells cosmetics, clothes and shoes, as well as filling orders from her customers. Her husband supports her work efforts and he provides for household expenses. Besides, they own a family business that her husband runs: a machine shop, in the same area, that produces additional family income. Sandra is asking for her first loan, hoping to be supported by Kiva, to do some home improvements. She wants to build a bedroom in order to improve the quality of life for her family. She is very well-known in her community as hard-working, well-behaved, always striving to get ahead and to provide education for her children. Her greatest wish is that her family have the basic needs met in their house to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Adiara

texts.fr:
Madame  Adiara Berthé a  54 ans et réside avec son époux et leurs six enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est initiée aux activités de teinture et de vente d’habits qu’elle a appris auprès d’une camarade il y a plus de vingt ans. Après  avoir teint les bazins, elle coud quelques pièces en chemises masculines qu’elle revend. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des voyageurs et des routiers) pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Vu le positionnement de sa boutique située à la gare routière de Sikasso, son activité marche bien et la clientèle est très satisfaite.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis  de six ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 10ème prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé.                                                                                             Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 15 pièces de bazins blancs, 15 boîtes de teintures de couleurs différentes, 15 paquets de soude caustique et quelques pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako ensuite elle les revend dans sa boutique située au cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 350 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiara Berthé is 54 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Sanoubougou I, a working-class neighborhood in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Given her social environment, she did not have the opportunity to further her education, and more than 20 years ago learned from a friend the rudiments of dying and selling clothes. After dying the Bazin cloth, she assembles several pieces to make men’s shirts for sale. She is much in demand by her customers (for the most part travelers and truck drivers) for the quality of her products. Because her shop is well located at the Sikasso bus station, her business is flourishing and her customers are very satisfied. She decided six years ago to join the Doro Yiriwaso MFI, to better satisfy an increasing number of customers with high expectations. After participating in a few group loans with a neighborhood women’s loan group, she is now up to ten individual loans, all of which have been fully reimbursed. With this loan she intends to buy: 15 pieces of white bazin fabric, 15 containers of dye in various colors, 15 packages of caustic soda, and a few pieces of ‘pagne wax’ cloth. She gets her supplies from Bamako, then resells them in her shop located in the center of the Sikasso bus station. She expects this loan will help bring her monthly earnings up to 350,000 FCFA, which she will use to increase her stock of supplies, contribute to family expenses, repay her loan and invest the remainder in her business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bazin fabric, pagnes cloth, caustic soda and dyes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur runs a grocery store. He’s a 21-year-old young boy who has passed intermediate school. 

He will use this loan to purchase supplies and a vertical refrigerator, and to improve his shop. His income will rise as a result of this loan. He has a good reputation in the district and has a lots of ambitions and goals in his life.

loans.use: To buy supplies and a vertical refrigerator

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Kolaban,  toutes mariées,  ont en moyenne 35 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à N’Tjifina sous préfecture de Fana,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Les femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des condiments, de baignés, de la friture de farine de blé et de haricot.
Les femmes du groupe Kolaban sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 1 sac de farine de blé, 2 sacs de 100Kg de la graine de haricot et des condiments.
L’approvisionnent se fait sur place et au marché de Nangola. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Fana ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22.500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kolaban group, who are all married, average 35 years of age, have an average of two children and all live in extended traditional families in N'Tjifina, in the sub-prefecture of Fana in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other through relatives and have a business buying and selling condiments and fritters made from wheat flour and beans. The women of the Kolaban group are on their first group loan which will be used to buy one bag of wheat flour, two 100kg bags of bean seeds and condiments. They get their supplies locally and at the market in Nangola. They sell their products at the market in Fana town and at surrounding fairs, for cash, on a retail basis, and on credit, to a customer base made up of women and men. They envisage making an average monthly profit of 22,500 FCFA each, which will be used for expenses relating to health, food and schooling; the rest will be reinvested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments, wheat flour and beans

loans.name: Bitty

texts.fr: Madame Bitty D. est une femme mariée de 53 ans. Elle vit dans la localité de Baye Laye plus précisément dans le quartier de Wakhinane. Elle est membre de l’institution U-IMCEC caisse  de Baye laye depuis avril 2008. Elle y a déjà bénéficié de 2 prêts antérieurs.  C’est une veuve qui gere9 enfants sous son toit  et dont l’âge varie entre 16 et 30 ans. Madame D. s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner  chez elle le matin. Parfois elle pratique la vente d’articles de femmes comme les boucles d’oreille et autres. Elle capitalise une expérience de 15 ans dans le petit commerce.  Rester oisive  ne constitue pas une option pour elle. Et c’est la raison pour laquelle elle s’est orientée vers le commerce ce qui au moins pourra l’aider à résoudre certains problèmes  financiers. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de niébé, spaghetti  pour renforcer son niveau d’activité  dans la vente de petit déjeuner. Car le moment le plus important de son activité c’est le matin, moment d’affluence et heure d’école. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle  et d’accroitre ses ressources pour mieux supporter la charge de ses enfants orphelins.
texts.en:
Mrs Bitty D. is a married woman aged 53 years. She lives in the Baye Laye area, specifically in the Wakhinane neighborhood. She is a member of the institution U-IMCEC (bank of Baye Laye) since April 2008. She has already benefitted from two loans. She is a widow who is responsible for nine children between the ages of 16 and 30 years old. Mrs D. is involved in the sale of breakfast foods in the morning. From time to time, she is also involved in the sale of female accessory items such as earrings and others. She has approximately 15 years of small business experience. Staying idle is not an option for her, which is the reason why she is interested in business which at least helps her address several economic problems. In consequence, she is asking for a 100,000 frs loan in order to purchase niébé (black eyed peas, in america) and spaghetti to support her sales of breakfast foods. At the moment, her the most important financial activity is undertaken in the morning, during busy times, as well as school hours. This allows her to satisfy the requests from her clients and improve her resources in order to better support the needs of her orphaned children.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to reinforce her stock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Ali has owned a barber shop for eight years. He also offers beauty products for men, like gel, hair cleaning products, and more. 

He decided to start his business because he wanted to have an independent workplace. He is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and his clients feel comfortable going to his shop because he offers a lot of services. When cleaning the hair, he does head massages. 

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Ali first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties because he already had faithful customers from his previous job. 

He requested a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase beauty products for his shop. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Josecito De Cumbe( Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Josecito de Cumbe esta formado por mujeres luchadoras, alegres y carismáticas que buscan día a día la manera de salir adelante con sus familias,  viven en la parroquia  del mismo nombre de su banco comunal  ubicada al sur del cantón Cuenca. Cumbe tiene una extensión de 71,4 km²; representa el 2,3 por ciento del territorio cantonal está localizado a una distancia de 24 km desde la ciudad de Cuenca, conectada por la vía asfaltada Cuenca-Loja. Entre sus actividades sobresale la agricultura  que la realizan la gente mayor o mujeres pues el resto de la  población diariamente salen  a Cuenca donde realizan diferentes actividades económicas como: obreros de fábricas, elaboración de artesanías, empleados en actividades de comercio, servicios y principalmente como trabajadores de la construcción.

La señora Teresa G. con 41 años vive en la parroquia  Cumbe con su esposo que trabaja en la construcción y sus seis hijos que oscilan entre los 20 y 3 años, sus tres primeros hijos cursan la educación secundaria y los otros dos la primaria en instituciones de la localidad, mientras que el más pequeño pasa con ella todo el tiempo, la vivienda que habitan es prestado por un hermano hasta que puedan  tener su casa propia para tranquilidad de toda la familia.

Teresa se dedica a la cría cuyes y  pollos que son de pronto crecimiento tanto para la venta como para el consumo en su hogar, es nuestra socia  hace dos ciclos y con su  nuevo crédito comprará más crías de  pollos, cuyes  y alimento para su crianza.

María Sarbelia  C.  tiene 51 años de edad y es una socia  muy alegre y carismática del grupo, este es su  segundo crédito que lo va a invertir en la compra  crías de pollos y alimento para incrementar su criadero de animales actividad a la que  se dedica hace mucho tiempo, también tiene una vaca lechera y su producción la vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia  vive en la parroquia  Cumbe con su esposo y cuatro de los cinco hijos que concibió pues la tercera hija se caso y vive independiente, dos de sus hijos  trabajan y ayudan  económicamente con los gastos de  la  casa y los estudios de la ultima hija que estudia en un colegio de la localidad,  mientras que la  segunda hija no trabaja pero le  ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar.

Su meta es incrementar más animales a su corral.
texts.en:
The Josecito de Cumbe Communal Bank is comprised of tenacious, happy, and charismatic women. Day to day they look for the way to get ahead with their families. They live in the parish with the same name as their communal bank. It is located to the south of the Cuenca canton. Cumbe has an area of 71.4 square kilometers and represents 2.3 percent of the territory of the canton. It is 24 kilometers from the city of Cuenca, and it is connected by the asphalt road, Cuenca-Loja. Among its activities, farming stands out. Older people and women farm, and the rest of the population goes to Cuenca everyday to do different economic activities like working in factories, making handicrafts, or being employees in commerce. Some provide services, primarily as construction workers. Teresa G. is 41 years old. She lives in the Cumbe parish with her husband, a construction worker, and their six children. The children’s ages range from 20 to 3 years old. Her first three children are in high school. The other two are in elementary school in the area. The youngest is with her all the time. The house where they live is lent to them by a brother. This is until they are able to have their own home, which will give the entire family tranquility. Teresa raises guinea pigs and chickens, and they grow rapidly. They are for sale as much as for household consumption. She has had two cycles. With her new loan she will buy more chickens, guinea pigs, and food for them. María Sarbelia C., age 51, is a very happy and charismatic member of the group. This is her second loan. She will buy baby chickens and food to enlarge her animal farm. She has been doing this for a long time. She also has a dairy cow, and she sells her production in her community. She lives in the Cumbe parish with her husband and four of their five children. The third daughter got married and lives independently. Two of her children work and help economically with the household expenses. They also help with the educational expenses of her last daughter, who goes to the local school. Her second daughter does not work, but she helps with the household chores. Her goal is to have more animals in her farmyard.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby chickens, guinea pigs, and food to enlarge her animal farm

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Esperanza Martínez D. Z., resiD. en El Municipio D. Nueva Guadalupe del Departamento D. San Miguel, ella es casada vive con su esposo  y sus dos hijas D. 18 y 14 años respectivamente, el trabaja D. albañil y Esperanza tiene venta D. frutas, verduras y productos D. primera necesidad.
El negocio D.  venta D. frutas inicialmente era D. su madre quien se lo heredo, y actualmente ella  venD. sus productos en la casa D. evitación y regularmente para realizar más ventas D. lunes a viernes sale por las calles D. la zona D. nueva Guadalupe a ofrecer (tomates, repollo, manzanas, uvas, aguacate y otros), ella es una persona muy trabajadora, amable y responsable que gracias a su negocio, pueD. apoyar a sus hijas para que continúen con los estudios y solventar gastos del hogar.
Esperanza necesita el préstamo para comprar Frutas y verduras (zanahorias, cebollas, naranjas, manzanas, uvas, tomates) y ofrecer diferentes productos a sus cliente, sus aspiraciones son que con su esfuerzo y este dinero pueda mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, que sus hijas terminen sus estudios, y algún día tener otro negocio D. venta D. frutas y verduras en El mercado.
texts.en:
Esperanza Martínez D. Z. lives in the municipality of Nueva Guadalupe in the Salvadoran "departamento" of San Miguel. She is married and lives with her husband and their two daughters, 18- and 14-years old, respectively. Esperanza's husband is a construction worker and Esperanza has a business selling fruits, vegetables and other everyday products. She learned the business from her mother and now sells her products at the "casa D. evitacion y regularmente" where her sales are higher. From Mondays to Fridays she works as a street vendor, selling her products (tomatoes, cabbage, apples, grapes, avocados, etc.) around Nueva Guadalupe. Esperanza is a hard-working woman, friendly and responsible, who--thanks to the business--can pay household bills and support her daughters so that they can continue with their schooling. Esperanza needs the loan to buy fruits and vegetables (carrots, onions, oranges, apples, grapes, tomatoes) so that she can offer a range of products to her customers. Her greatest hopes are that her efforts and this money can help improve her family's quality of life; that her daughters finish their studies; and that she can one day have a fruit and vegetable business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Dalila Judit

texts.es: La solicitante es casada, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando y le ayudan en su pequeño negocio que tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes.El Destino del credito es para compra de mercaderia
texts.en:
The loan applicant is married, and has two children who are studying and who help her with her small business selling groceries from her house. The purpose of this loan is to purchase goods.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna, tiene 25 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en la casa del señor Paulino. Su actividad económica principal de Giovanna es la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, papas, cebollas, etc. Ella también administra la tienda de abarrotes de su mama Fidelia. Giovanna participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 25 years old, and the single mother of one child. She belongs to the “New Vision of Rumichaca” cooperative bank. Member reunions take place every thirty days at the home of Mr. Paulino. Giovanna’s primary economic activity is the sale of vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, onions, etc. She also tends to her mother Fidelia’s grocery store. Giovanna participates in the cooperative bank, and things go well for her because she is a very responsible and punctual person with regard to making her payments. She needs the loan in order to purchase more vegetables. This member is very grateful for the opportunities provided via this medium, and likewise commits to making her scheduled payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok M., 61 years old and is a villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice and she is also farmer who works very hard to support her four children. The farm's soil is now infertile and there is not enough water to irrigate the crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine and gasoline to water plants and the rest of the loan she wants use to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sok M. is widow with four children: one is Khmer cake seller; one is a vehicle driver while the other two are farmers who support their mother farming.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine and gasoline to water plants and the rest of the loan she wants use to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Erkujek

texts.en: Erkujek B. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, in western Mongolia, in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. His two elder children are students, the youngest one goes to a local middle school and his wife helps him with his business. Erkujek operates a machinery spare parts trading business and owns a private shop in his home where he sells his products. He began his business in 2000 with a small wooden shop and after years of successful business operation, Erkujek managed to enlarge the shop and expand his services. Since running the business successfully, their business revenues and working capital have obviously increased, so that Erkujek could afford his children's tuition fees. During the summertime, he engages in a taxi service while his wife Nina is responsible for their machinery parts sales business. Erkujek is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan to increase his business working capital and to purchase used cars in order to dismantle and resell their spare parts.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of her  goods to sell

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur MOUSSA T. est marié à une femmes et est père de 3 enfants. Il est né à LOULOUNI le 04/07/1978 dans la dite sous préfecture, 3eme région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).  Il vit à Loulouni dans une famille monogame.
Il fait de la menuiserie métallique avec la confection et réparation (de portes, fenêtres, chaises...) depuis maintenant 8 ans.  Il fait ses prestations avec assez de réussite compte tenu de son expérience à la matière.
Il est à sa première collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et  compte l’utiliser pour acheter, des matériaux de premières nécessités pour le bon déroulement de ses activités.
Il confectionne les portes, fenêtres...sur commande et ses prestations (réparations) au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il espère  pouvoir économiser  mensuellement 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer la location de l’atelier en plus des apprentis et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa T. is married and he is the father of 3 children. He was born in Loulouni, Sikasso (third administrative region in Mali) on 4-07-1978. He lives in Loulouni in a monogamous family. He has worked as a joiner for the past 8 years, making and repairing metallic items such as doors, windows, and chairs. His business is quite successful given his experience in the field. This will be the first time he has approached Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan. He hopes to use it to purchase essential materials for his business. He makes doors and windows, taking orders for new items, and he carries out repairs. His finalizes his transactions in cash only and he caters to a clientele made up of men and women. He hopes to earn 40.000 francs every month and it will be used to pay his store's lease, to hire on more apprentices, and a part will be put away in savings.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase working materials.

loans.name: Mrs. Lach Kong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who live in Rumchek village in TaK. province. Mrs. Lach K., 55, is the village bank president selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Lach K. is a farmer who owns a 0.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She also sells Khmer noodles and desserts in the local village. Although Mrs. Lach K. works hard, she earns little money. To improve her family's living standards, she is seeking a loan to start a new business by buying some piglets for breeding. Mrs. Lach K. is a widow with two children: one is a rock breaker and the other is employed in a printing house.

loans.use: to buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with a grown son. He is a businessman from Berdyansk. Sergey sells heat radiators and other auto accessories in the local car market in his home town. As more and more Ukrainians buy vehicles, Sergey’s business is flourishing. Merchandise he offers for sale is in high demand and always sells well among car owners.

Sergey has been in the business for 8 years. Presently, he has 25,000 Grivnyas of turnover capital. Sergey is seeking a loan of 2,500 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise. He believes the loan will help him purchase additional merchandise wholesale. Availability of assorted inventory and reasonable prices will help many of his clients obtain the items they need and help Sergey maintain his leading position in the market and continue to expand his business.

Note: this is a short-term express loan.

loans.use: To increase assorted auto accessory merchandise

loans.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es: Johana tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de seis años de edad. Tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con financiamientos. Siempre se ha caracterizado, por ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella ofrece una gran variedad de productos como sabanas, toallas, cosméticos, calzado entre otros con las ganancias obtenidas del negocio y con los préstamos obtenidos ha logrado comprar vitrinas, estantes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima pues recientemente tiene ciertos pedidos.
texts.en:
Johanna is 38 years old, is single, and has a six-year-old son.  For eight years she has sold general merchandise, so this is not her first experience with financing.  She has always been known for good customer service.

Johanna sells a wide variety of products like sheets, towels, cosmetics, and shoes, among other items.  With the earnings from her business and the loans she has obtained, she has been able to buy showcases and shelves.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise since she has had some orders placed recently.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nji

texts.en: Nji R. was born in 1965. He is married and they are blessed with two children all below the age of 15 years old. He lives in the Atouafona quarter of Akunlum Mankon, Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. In his early life, R. suffered the problem of inadequate schooling and the ability to afford good and quality education. He faces the challenges of providing the basic needs for his family, including the inability to meet up with the basic necessities of his family like clothing, feeding, transportation and educating himself and his children. He also faces difficulties in raising capital to start up a small business. With this loan he is going to buy seedlings, pay rent on his piece of land and insecticides. He believes the business will succeed because the previous loan he took was repaid by the income raised from an old farm of his, so therefore he concludes that he is sure the business will succeed. He is certain that this business will succeed because the products he produces are highly demanded in the market. The loan will help his community because they will be able to afford all food ingredients at low or no cost like tomatoes and green spices which adds flavor to soup. R. will plough back his profit into his business and use part to care for his family. He also will use the proceeds to pay his children’s school fees and cater to the family. He prefers GHAPE because of the training he frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets, feed and to build a fence.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Natividad; ella tiene 28 años de edad, separada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pinturas como acuarelas,temperas entre otros ella lo vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes. La socia es una mujer muy emprendedora siendo este el único medio para salir adelante.
 
La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más pinturas para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Natividad is a member of the Communal Bank “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 28 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children. Natividad divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling paints, such as watercolors and tempera, as a street vendor. She works every day in the mornings and in the afternoons. Natividad is an enterprising woman since this is her only means of getting ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy more paints for her business.

Natividad is grateful to everyone who helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase paints to sell

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor, de 66 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa María de 60 años y sus 4 hijos que son mayores de edad; juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Cada día este empeñoso hombre se despierta muy temprano para empezar con la atención en su tienda que esta ubicada al lado de su casa. Con el transcurrir del tiempo ha logrado surtir mejor su negocio con variados productos comestibles y de primera necesidad, y tiene muy buenas ganancias con las ventas diarias, pues por la zona donde vive no tiene competencia cerca. Además su tienda esta abierta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche, en ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan en la atención hacía los clientes. Lo que no le gusta del negocio es que para surtirlo de mercadería debe ir a comprar los productos hasta la ciudad, lo que le quita tiempo y es una labor bastante  esforzada. Como es un hombre muy trabajador para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y construirlo de material noble, pues en la actualidad es de madera. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Néstor tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda de comestibles y ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Néstor, 66 years of age, lives in his own home along with his wife María, 60, and their four children who are adults. Together they work to get ahead. 

Every day this enterprising man wakes up very early to begin attending customers in his shop which is located beside his house. With the passage of time he has been able to better stock his business with a variety of grocery products and other staples. He makes very good earnings because in the area where he lives he has no nearby competition. Furthermore his store is open from 7 in the morning until very late at night. Sometimes his children help him with customer service. One thing he doesn't like about his business is that in order to buy and stock his store with merchandise he must travel to the city which takes time and is quite an effort. 

As he is quite a hardworking man, in the future he plans to improve his facilities and build them out of more solid materials such as concrete blocks, since currently the store's building is made of wood. This is his third loan with MFP and he promises to repay promptly, since he doesn't want to get in trouble with the people who made this support possible and which will allow him to keep working in search of progress. 

Néstor plans to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to better stock his store with groceries and to offer his customers the best. In this way he hopes to keep on moving ahead.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to better set up his shop

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Teresa es de una comunidad que se llama "Llano las rosas", municipio de San Jose del rincon, doña Teresa tiene 55 años de edas, y cumplio 38 años de casada viviendo con su esposo, tubo 7 hijos, 6 de sus hijos ya son casados y tienen una vida aparte, la mas chica de sus hijas tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive con ellos pero no depende de doña Teresa porqué trabaja y cubre sus propios gastos, tambíen cuando puede le ayuda a doña Teresa con algo en su casa puede ser para la comida o otra cosa que se nesecite. Doña Teresa tiene casa propia y un negocio que es una tienda de abarrotes.
El prestamo que solicita lo piensa invertir en su negocio de la mejor manera; lo primero que quiere hacer es comprar un molino para nixtamal, y después comprar mercancía como; huevo, chiles en lata, refrescos, galletas, sabritas, golosinas, en fin todo el producto que hace falta y vende una tienda de abarrotes, tambíen quire comprar unos pollos y guajolotes para criar, en todo esto quire invertir el prestamo que le van a dar.

Para doña Teresa es dificil cuando le llegan los gastos de la luz y del agua, porqué a veces le llegan caros y no tiene como pagar, en ocaciones le ayuda su hija pero no es siempre, cuando no recibe ayuda tiene ocupar dinero de su tienda para pagar y para volver a invertir ya no tiene, si doña Teresa no paga es peor porqué le cortan la luz, para volver a poner la luz sale mucho más caro. Lo mismo sucede con el agua.
