Una meta de doña Teresa es comprar una becerra lechera, de está manera ya no compra la leche y ella misma la pude ordeñar, porqué la leche se la venden muy cara y no le alcanza para los 3 que viven en su casa.

Para doña Teresa es muy importante ahorar las ganancias para la vejez, ella piensa que años mas tarde no va a ver nadie quien vea por ellos y les den el dinero que nesecitan para cualquier enfermedad, por eso quiere hacer sus ahorros pronto.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa is from a community called "Llano las rosas", or the Plain of the Roses, in the town of San Jose del Rincon. She is 55 years old, and has been married to her husband for 38 years. She has 7 children, 6 of whom are now married and living independently. Her youngest daughter is 24 years old and single, and still lives with them. However, she works, so she is no longer dependent on Teresa and her husband for her expenses, and she also helps Doña Teresa when she can with whatever is needed, such as food or other necessities in the home. Doña Teresa owns the house, and she also has a  grocery store.

The loan she is seeking will be invested in her business in the best way possible: the first thing she wants to do is to buy a cornmeal milling machine, and then buy merchandise such as eggs, canned chiles, cookies, chips, and sweets - everything she needs that a grocery store should sell. She also wants to buy some chickens and turkeys to raise, and she needs the loan to do all of this.

It is difficult for Doña Teresa when the electricity and water bills come in, because sometimes they can be so expensive that she doesn't know how she will pay. On occasions her daughter helps her out, but not always, and when she can't Doña Teresa has to use money from the store, which she then can't re-invest. However, if she didn't pay it would be worse, because they would cut the electricity and then having it reconnected would be much more expensive. The same thing happens with the water. 

One of Doña Teresa's goals is to buy a young milk cow, and thus no longer have to buy milk. Milk is very expensive to buy and there is never enough for the three of them in the house. 

For Doña Teresa it is very important to save her earnings for her old age. She thinks that in years to come there may be no-one to look after her and her husband and give them the money they need to treat any ailment that might befall them. For that reason she wants to save her money.

loans.use: Doña Teresa is going to use the loan to buy merchandise for a grocery store. The products she sells and needs at present are: eggs, soup, canned chiles, fruit and vegetables, soft drinks, napkins, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Srien's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who live in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province.  The group leader is Mrs. Srien R., a 27-year-old married woman. The members of this group hope to increase their income and improve their family's living with this loan. 

Mrs. Srien R. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she also sells groceries and breeds pigs to support her family. She does not have enough money to support her pig breeding business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food. 

Her husband, Mr. Mark Leang Hay, is a laborer who also supports his wife businesses.   This couple has three children: one is attending the local school, while the other two are still too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Household repairs

loans.name: Danixa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Danixa; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, ella tiene carros que llevan materiales de construcción a la persona que compra, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pagar el combustible de los carros que realizan el servicio de llevar los materiales de construcción.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Entrepreneurs of San Cristobal". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Danixa. She is 36 years old, married common-law, and the mother of 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business, selling construction materials. She has trucks that deliver construction materials to the purchaser. She wants to expand her construction materials business. She requests a loan to pay for the fuel for the delivery trucks. 

She is happy to have this loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: To buy fuel the delivery trucks.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza T. lives in the Kisasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of orphans. 

Eseza deals in second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Eseza sells her products at the market. Eseza has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

The main business challenge for Eseza is transportation.  Eseza lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Perla Azucena

texts.es: La señora Perla V. es el Segundo crédito que CEPRODEL  le otorga para pagos de aranceles escolares , compra de todos los materiales escolares para preparar a sus tres hijos que comienzan en este mes sus estudios .Es importante en el desarrollo intelectual de sus hijos de ser con los prestamos no se logra comprar lo necesario
texts.en: This will be the second loan Mrs. Perla V. has received from CEPRODEL to pay school fees and purchase all the necessary school supplies for her three children who are starting school this month. Her children's intellectual development is very important to her and without this loan she would be unable to pay for all their necessities.

loans.use: Pay school fees and purchase school supplies for children

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita C. is from the village of Del Pilar,Cabatuan,Isabela. She is 52 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Perlita's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
Con poco capital pero con el firme propósito de sacar adelante su negocio, Juan Camilo Ortiz R. de 20 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, una legumbrería que aunque es la única en el sector un muro le impide su visibilidad lo que actualmente es una dificultad para darse a conocer e incrementar sus ventas. 

Actualmente, este joven emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para hacer un aviso publicitario que le permita mejorar su visibilidad y para comprar más legumbres ya que cuenta con poco surtido.
texts.en: With little capital, but with a firm commitment to his business’ success, Juan Camilo Ortiz R., age 20, decided to begin his own business, a vegetable store.  Although it is the only one in his area, a wall interferes with his shop’s visibility so that currently it is difficult for people to find and for sales to increase.  At this stage, this young entrepreneur needs a loan in order to make a sign that will increase his visibility and in order to purchase more vegetables since his stock is small.

loans.use: to make a sign and purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Zoraida Alejandra

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Zoraida Alejandra le esta haciendo falta elaborar la barda alrededor de la casa y colocar las protecciones en las puestas y ventanas. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara las mejoras. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica como empleada de producción, quien se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos será su esposo el señor Juan Ángel quien trabaja en una fábrica.  
Desean que sus hijos tengan un patrimonio seguro y en buenas condiciones, ya que pasan el mayor tiempo en la casa.
texts.en:
At the home of Zoraida Alejandra, the things that need to be done are to install a fence around the house and install guards on the windows and doors.  She is asking for this loan to purchase the materials and pay a person to do the improvements.  

She plans to pay back the loan with the income she earns working at a factory as a production employee.  The person in charge of the household and school expenses is her husband Juan Ángel who works in a factory.  

They want their children to have a secure future in good conditions since they spend most of their time at home.

loans.use: to build a fence and put guards on the windows and doors.

loans.name: Roland

texts.es:
Roland tiene 38 años, vive en su propia casa con su madre, su hermana , su sobrina  y su hija de 9 años.

Desde hace 12 años abrió su tienda instalado en su propia casa en donde ofrece  productos de pan llevar, cada día el se levanta muy temprano para  atender su establecimiento y cada 2 semanas se va temprano para comprar su mercadería de acuerdo de la cantidad de productos que tiene, su madre y su hermana le ayudan en la atención de su tienda cuando sale a trabajar como docente, además de que le agrada tener un ingreso independiente al de su sueldo como docente y le ayuda a afrontar las múltiples necesidades de su hogar. Tiene en mente continuar trabajando de esta manera y mejorar en cantidad de mercadería en su tienda. 

Es su crédito número 25 que tiene con MFP, se siente muy contento de su larga trayectoria dentro de su banco comunal y estima como verdaderos amigos a cada uno de sus integrantes y continuara siendo muy activo y puntual en sus pagos. 

El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en:
Roland is 38 years old and lives in a house he owns with his mother, sister, niece and 9-year-old daughter.

He opened a store in his house 12 years ago, where he sells bread products. He gets up early every day to tend to his business and every two weeks, he goes early to buy his merchandise depending on the quantity of products he has. His mother and sister help him tend to the business when he goes to work as a teacher. He likes having earnings aside from his salary as a teacher and it helps him to address the various needs of his household. Roland plans to continue working in this business and acquire more merchandise for his store.

This is his 25th loan with MFP and he is happy with his long history with the communal bank. He values each of his fellow group members as true friends and will continue to be very active and punctual in his payments.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of more groceries for his store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for his store.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly, de 29 años, es una mujer my sencilla y amable, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Joel de 34 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Magaly a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para poder brindarle a su familia las comodidades necesarias, actualmente esta en el negocio de la confección y distribución de ropa de niños y los distribuye a los principales mercados de la ciudad de Pucallpa. A ella le gusta mucho trabajar en la confección y crear ropa de modelos novedosos, aunque siempre le es difícil armar las prendas parte por parte, en espera de que le queden muy bien. Lleva ya 9 años realizando esta actividad y desea tener en el futuro su puesto de ventas, donde pueda vender ella misma sus confecciones y así mejorar sus ingresos y darle una vida más digna a su familia. Es el primer crédito con MFP y tiene mucha confianza en que podrá pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy tranquila y disfruta de trabajar en equipo con el resto de sus socias. Con los dos ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más telas para fabricar más ropa y distribuir a más lugares.
texts.en:
Magaly, age 29, is a humble and friendly woman. She lives in a rented house with her husband Joel, age 34, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Throughout her life, she has worked hard to provide her family the necessary comforts. Magaly currently has a business producing and distributing children’s clothing to the main markets in the city of Pucallpa. She enjoys sewing and creating new designs of clothing, but she always finds it difficult to assemble the clothes piece by piece in hopes that they fit well. Magaly has been sewing for nine years and wants to have her own vending post in the future where she can produce her creations. She hopes that this will improve her income and provide her family with a more dignified life.

This is her first loan with MFP. She has great confidence in being able to submit all of her payments on time. In her Communal Bank, Magaly feels at peace and enjoys working with her other team members. With the loan of 800 PEN that she requested, she will buy additional fabrics so that she can produce more clothing and distribute to more places.

loans.use: Purchase more fabrics.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer, tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo.  Vive en la casa de sus padres la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú cerca a la ciudad de Eten, en donde cuenta con los servicios básicos.  
Wilmer  cuenta con un puesto de ventas en la plataforma Manuel Pardo del mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en donde se dedica a la venta de verduras en variedad, productos de consumo diario. 

Su puesto es permanente, y cuenta con experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en su sector, además cuenta con una unidad vehicular para el servicio de trasporte público.  

Wilmer está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles  para poder hacer el cambio de placa, empadronamiento, reparación y mantenimiento, del vehiculo, lo que le permitirá trabajar sin problemas.

Wilmer es un hombre trabajador y es reconocido en su comunidadenemo la vconocen como una persona responsable y empeñosa, que lucha por darles un mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer, tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo.  Vive en la casa de sus padres la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú cerca a la ciudad de Eten, en donde cuenta con los servicios básicos.  
Wilmer  cuenta con un puesto de ventas en la plataforma Manuel Pardo del mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en donde se dedica a la venta de verduras en variedad, productos de consumo diario. 

Su puesto es permanente, y cuenta con experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en su sector, además cuenta con una unidad vehicular para el servicio de trasporte público.  

Wilmer está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles  para poder hacer el cambio de placa, empadronamiento, reparación y mantenimiento, del vehiculo, lo que le permitirá trabajar sin problemas.

Wilmer es un hombre trabajador y es reconocido en su comunidadenemo la vconocen como una persona responsable y empeñosa, que lucha por darles un mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Poder hacer el , empadronamiento, y mantenimiento, del vehiculo.

loans.name: Fernandino

texts.en:
Fernando, 32 years old and  single, lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City where he rents a motorcycle in order to provide transportation services, earning  approximately PHP 5,000 per month.

A member of PMPC for two years, Fernando is requesting a loan to purchase his own motorcycle in order to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lisseth Noemy

texts.es:
Lisseth, tiene 19 años de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 5 años de edad, viven con su suegra, ella se dedica a vender pupusas, tiene un año de experiencia, trabaja todos los días de la semana en la preparación de las pupusas.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, chicharrón, quesillo y gas, este préstamo le ayudara grandemente a tener mayor disponibilidad de productos y cubrir la demanda de los clientes, generando mayores ventas y ganancias para su hogar.
Su propósito es que su hijo inicie sus estudios, con el negocio pues seguir creciendo y ganando más ingresos para en el futuro poder construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Lisseth is 19 years old and lives with her husband and 5 year-old child.  They live with her mother-in-law.  Lisseth has a business selling pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish) and she has 1 year of experience in this line of work.  She works every day of the week making her pupusas.

Now she needs a loan to buy corn, pork, cheese and gas.  This loan will be a big help to her, because with it she will have more products available for sale and so can meet the demand of her customers, thereby generating greater sales and earnings for her household.

Her goals are to have her child start his education, to continue growing her business, and to earn more income so that in the future she can build her own home.

loans.use: to buy corn, pork, cheese and gas to make her pupusas

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 23 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in the village of Pire, 100 km from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal. Their main work involves commerce in farm products and cassava root. The group members are experienced in this domain and have a good customer base. The workday starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends around 8:00 at night. 

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they are going to resell at the market. The revenues derived from the sale of cassava will enable them to bolster their business but also to satisfy the needs of their children (payment of school and medical fees and maintaining the house).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 51 years old, married to Mary, and blessed with five children aged 20, 17, 15, 8 and 6 years. He has been farming for 20 years and makes a monthly income of 25,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.
Jackson is applying for his second loan from Kiva partner, KADET. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and watering pipes. He will use the anticipated profit from his business to boost his farming business. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level and build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and watering pipes.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children, two girls and two boys. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six months, she has operated a business selling charcoal from her home to neighbors and passersby. Rehema’s major business challenge is the high cost of transporting charcoal from rural areas to her location. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Rehema is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly es una mujer de 60 años que tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 32 a 43 años y se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 8 años, para apoyar la gestión de bienestar de su hogar, que hasta ese momento se encontraba a cargo de su cónyuge quien se dedica al oficio de albañil, actividad estacionaria con la que muchas veces queda cesante y se requería seguir adelante con un generador de ingresos constante como el que representa su venta de mercancías variada con la que hoy se siente satisfecha y desea hacer crecer. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado en el ligero crecimiento de su capital de trabajo y con la cual quiere seguir creciendo. Con este financiamiento Nelly comprará en mayor volumen mercancías, cervezas, gaseosas, ropa de cama etc. En mayor volumen, con el fin de ganar descuentos y generar mayores utilidades para su negocio, con las que pueda hacer mejoras habitacionales que es uno de sus mayores desafíos.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 60-year-old woman who has six children between the ages of 32 and 43.  She has managed a business for eight years in order to support the welfare of her household.  At the moment Nelly is the sole breadwinner because her husband, who is a bricklayer by traD., is on furlough because his job has frequent stops.  However, she is able to move her family forward by generating a steady income through the sale of various goods.  Today Nelly feels satisfied and has the desire to grow.  This Kiva loan is her second occurrence of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped her by providing slight increases in her operating capital which she has used to continue growing.  

With this loan Nelly will buy large volumes of merchandise, beer, sodas, bedding, and other products.  By purchasing in bulk, she will be able to obtain discounts and generate bigger profits from her business.  This will allow her to make home improvements, which is one of her greatest challenges.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, beer, sodas, bedding, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells salted fish and palm oil at Kukwa market near Abura. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. She, as part of her responsibilities, assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy salted fish. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy salted fish

loans.name: Riad

texts.en:
Riad is a 44-year-old married man, living with his wife and four children in Tripoli. Riad opened a barber shop 15 years ago, and he's working hard to improve his business. This is Riad's first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua, and it's because he wants to buy new products necessary for his business such as gel, shampoo, hair creams, and many other useful things requested by his customers. Riad is a very kind and honest man. He works hard to provide the best customer care. 

This is his first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua. His business is a major support for his family, which is why he has to put much effort on improving it. Riad hopes to keep on improving his business and attracting new customers. His sense of humor is well known to his customers; it's the most important characteristic of his personality. He also plans to expand his business to meet all his customers needs, through adding beauty therapy and many other new services.

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and blessed with three children who are still in school.  For the last three years, she has been managing a retail shop and selling cereals to earn a living.  She is also employed as a teacher.  Joyce has employed two people to help her  manage her business.  In the next 5 years, she wants to establish a wholesale business. 

Joyce is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat and beans to resell. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: buy sugar, cooking fat and beans

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with six children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for five years.  She started with 600,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings. Her hardship is theft at the boarder of the Republic of Congo. Her vision is a wholesale business plus educating her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Carlos, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos: Joshel, Billy, Jesenia y Lizbeth; a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de San pedro de saño. La actividad económica de Rosa, es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas; los cuales enseba para luego venderlos a mayor precio. Además comparte s tiempo con el tejido de prendas a base de lana, como chompas, chalinas, gorros y demás prendas de vestir a base de lana importada, de alpaca y nacional. Le gusta mucho su labor, cuenta que ya tiene clientes fijos, los cuales compran las hermosas prendas de Rosa. Ahora ella, desea mejorar sus tejidos, con diseños nuevos, pues quiere abrir una tienda donde todos puedan comprar. Sabe que lo logrará, ya que su esposo corre con los gastos del hogar, pues trabaja como albañil en la construcción de casas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San pedro” y este es el undécimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Rosa de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para mejorar la construcción de su casa y en madejas de lana para sus tejidos.
texts.en:
35-year-old Rosa is a hard-working woman who lives with Carlos, her husband of 17 years.  The couple have four children: Joshel, Billy, Jesenia and Lizbeth, who they care for in their own home, in the small village of San Pedro de Saño.  Rosa's business is raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She fattens her animals so that she can sell them later at a higher price.  She also knits clothes from yarn such as sweaters, scarves, caps and other garments.  She uses imported yarn, alpaca yarn and Peruvian yarn.  She really enjoys her work.  She tells us that she has regular customers who buy her beautiful garments.  She would like to improve her knitting and introduce new designs as she would like to open a store where everybody can buy her products.  She knows that she will achieve this as her husband takes care of the household expenses.  He works as a builder, building houses.

Rosa belongs to the San Pedro community bank and this is her 11th loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue reaching her goals.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time.  Rosa enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  With your support, Rosa will invest the money she has requested in buying materials with which to improve her house and also skeins of yarn for her knitting.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her house and also skeins of yarn

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 35 years old and married with two children, ages 6 years and 12 years. He runs a retail shop in Lumley in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. His children are currently attending school. He also takes care of three relatives.

Ibrahim has been in this business for eight years and sells milk, cocoa, bags of rice, soap, batteries and padlocks at his shop. He also earns income from renting out a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is price fluctuation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more bags of rice. Ibrahim says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children. In the future, he would like to import goods from abroad.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El  señor   Jesús   es  una  persona  que  se  dedica   al  comercio, actualmente   tiene    su negocio  de   artesanías    en  el mercado de la localidad, el requiere  de  nuestra  ayuda  ya  que  desea  realizar  la compra  de mercancía   ya que  nos comenta  que   en  esta  temporada  la  demanda  de  sus  clientes incrementa  satisfactoriamente,  ve  en  el  crédito  la  oportunidad  de hacer  crecer  su     negocio , permitiéndole  brindar  a  sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio que   lo  a  caracterizado, además  que  esto le permitirá   obtener  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Jesús is a businessman. Currently he has a crafts shop in the neighborhood market, and he is asking for help because he wants to buy merchandise because he tells us that in this season the requests of his clients increases suitably. The money from this loan is an opportunity to expand his business, permitting him to give to his customers the excellent service that he is known for and this will increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Sandro Francisco

texts.es:
Sandro Francisco tiene 42 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 17, 13, 7 y dos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

Sandro se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 15 años, Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para la siembra comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea con el apoyo del crédito podrá adquirir los productos a un buen precio.
El sueño es poder tener una casa no se le ha presentado hasta ahora ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
 Con la ayuda del CREDITO ANTERIOR ha podido sembrar maíz, la producción ha aumentado, la realación de la  familia ha mejorado, los ingresos han aumentado para el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en:
Sandro Francisco is 42 years old, is married, and has 4 children.  He lives with his wife and children (ages 17, 13, 7, and 2) in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos province.

The JERUSALEN rural loan group is based in the precinct of El Caimito, which is part of Puerto Pechiche parish in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.  The members of this group make a living from short-cycle farming; they grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

For 15 years Sandro has made a living from farming; he grows corn and rice, which he sells in Ventanas.  He is asking for a loan so that he can purchase seeds, fertilizer, and urea, and with help from the loan he will be able to purchase these products at a good price.  

Sandro’s dream is to have a house.  Up until now he has not had any financial problems.  In his free time he enjoys sports. 

With help from a previous loan Sandro was able to plant corn.  As a result his production has increased, his family’s relations have improved, and his income has increased, and with it his family’s well-being has also improved.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and urea.

loans.name: Santa Elvira

texts.es: La señora Santa Elvira de 40 años es Divorciada y vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 10 años, tiene dos hijos menores de edad que aun dependen económicamente de ella, Elvira obtiene ingresos de dos medios uno recibiendo una comisión por venta de boletos de autobús para viajar a distintos lugares de México y el otro y principal ingreso para ella y su familia es como distribuidora independiente de productos alternativos para  el cuidado de la salud; desde hace un año ella tiene un club de nutrición en su domicilio en el cual ella prepara los productos que el vende como desayunos y se los entrega a sus clientes desde las 7 de la mañana ellos pasan a su domicilio antes de irse a sus trabajos; La señora Santa requiere el apoyo para compra de mas productos para su club de nutrición y asi poder incrementar sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo apoyar a las familias de la localidad a mejoras sus condiciones de salud.
texts.en:
Santa Elvira, is 40, divorced, and has been living in subsidized housing for ten years. She has two minor children, who still depend on her financially. 

Elvira obtains income by two means. One is through receiving commission on the sale of bus tickets for travelling to different places in Mexico. The  other, and principal income for her and her family, is from being an independent distributor of alternative health care products. 

She has had a nutrition club in her home for a year. This is where she prepares the products she sells as breakfasts, and distributes to her customers. From seven in the morning, they drop by her home before going to work. 

Santa needs the support, in order to buy more products for her nutrition club. In this way she will be able to increase her income, and at the same time help the families in her neighborhood to improve their health.

loans.use: To buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: Lizeth Alicia

texts.es: La señora Lizeth tiene 18 años de edad tiene un hijo de 7 meses ella vive en casa de sus papas en la zona de villa obrajes,  ella vive con el papa de su hijo el señor Sandro quien se dedica al servicio de transporte en la una línea de taxi trufis, la  señora Lizeth tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio donde ofrece variedad de productos, la Sra.  Lizeth aprovecha el espacio para ofrecer también carne de pollo los días sábados y domingo debido a que es lleno y se vende. El préstamo es para aumentar su capital con la compra de mercadería como refrescos, galletas, roscas navideñas, debido a las fiestas de fin de año que se aproxima y ella tiene mucha venta de los productos que ofrece en su tienda de barrio, la Sra. Lizeth se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Lizeth is 18 years old, and has a seven-month-old son.  She lives in her parent's house in the Villa Obrajes area.  She lives with her son's dad, Señor Sandro, who works in transportation for a taxi line.  

Señora Lizeth has a neighborhood store in her home where she offers a variety of products for sale.  Señora Lizeth takes advantage of her space to also offer chicken for sale on Saturdays and Sundays, when she has lots of customers.

The loan is to increase her capital with the purchase of merchandise such as sodas, cookies, and typical Christmas cakes called "roscas navideñas", as the year-end holidays are drawing near and she has good sales of the products in her neighborhood store.

Señora Lizeth is grateful to the Institution for the support being provided.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sodas, cookies and traditional Christmas cakes called "roscas navideñas"

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es:
Ruth Mery tiene 37 años de edad vive en Nazca, Perú. La ciudad es famosa por la legendaria Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos, inmenso e inexplicable geroglíficos  grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado  la calma a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la región. Ruth es conviviente, su pareja trabaja en una empresa como obrero, juntos tienen 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden entre 12, 5 y 2 años, sus hijos de 12 y 5 años ya van a la escuela el mayor se encuentra cursando el primer año de secundaria y el segundo de ellos se encuentra cursando educación inicial, el menor de todos aun no va al colegio pero Ruth nos dice que le saca canas verdes por lo travieso que es, pero a los tres los ama muchísimo y es su motor para salir adelante cada día a pesar de los contratiempos que pueda tener.

Ruth es muy luchadora y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación tiene 2 negocios, el primero consiste en la venta de verduras  y abarrotes en el mercado de su ciudad y el segundo consiste en la venta de bebidas como gaseosas, refrescos (este negocio lo realiza en la casa de su madre), ella le dedica a su negocio en el mercado alrededor de 4 horas diarias y en el negocio en casa su madre alrededor de 5 horas, Ruth se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio por la dedicación que le da y porque siempre trata a los clientes de manera amable porque ella dice que se trata a los demás como quieres que te traten a ti, en un día puede ganar hasta S/. 30 y en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/.60.

Ruth está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que debido al apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería (abarrotes) y así tendrá más variedad en su negocio, tendrá mas ingresos y con ello podrá también seguir ahorrando para más adelante cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia para seguridad de su familia”
texts.en:
Ruth Mery is 37 years old and lives in Nazca, Peru. The city is famous for its legendary Nazca Lines, a series of ancient, immense, and inexplicable hieroglyphs engraved in the desert that surrounds the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture that inhabited the region between 300 and 899 AD. Thus, the city attracts a considerable quantity of tourists. But Nazca is also known for its hard-working people who have preserved their calm despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region. Ruth lives with her companion and the two work hard in their enterprises.  Together they have 3 children whose ages are 12, 5, and 2 years. Their 12- and 5-year-olds already attend school. The eldest is in the 1st year of secondary school, and the younger is in the 1st year of primary school. The smallest one doesn't attend school as yet but, Ruth tells us he's very active. She loves the three very much and they motivate her every day to get ahead, despite any set backs that may occur.

Ruth is very determined and with much effort and dedication, she operates 2 businesses. The first is selling vegetables and groceries in the city market, and the second is selling drinks such as sodas and soft drinks in her mother's house. Ruth spends about 4 hours a day at her store in the market, and about  5 hours a day at the business in her mother's house. She works hard to get ahead and she believes she is doing well, due to her dedication and because she treats her customers in a kindly manner. She says she always treats others just as she wants them to treat her. In a day, she may earn up to 30 new sols and on a good day she can earn up to 60 new sols.

Ruth is very grateful to Kiva investors, since due to their offers of help, she can buy more groceries to sell, and thus, she will have more variety in her store, and more income. With this, she can continue saving towards her future grand dream: To have her own house for her family's security.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries) for her store in the city market.

loans.name: Erika Janeth

texts.es: La señora Erika de 28 años  es madre de 4 hijos de 9,8,5 y 2 años , con el apoyo de su esposo inicio su negocio de venta de accesorios y bolsas para dama que ofrece en pagos  para poder ajustar a la economía de sus clientas, en este momento requiere de un préstamo para comprar más mercancía ya que en la temporada de Navidad fue muy requerida por lo que se quedo con poco producto. A  Erika le gusta atender su negocio ya que le permite realizar las tareas cotidianas de ama de casa y atención de sus pequeños
texts.en:
Ms. Erika, 28, is the mother of four children who are 9, 8, 5 and 2 years old. With the support of her husband she began her business selling accessories and ladies' handbags which she offers on credit in order to accommodate her customer's financial situations. At this time she needs a loan to purchase more merchandise since during the Christmas season she sold a lot and so ended up without much product. 

Erika likes running her business since it allows her to carry out the daily activities of managing a household and caring for her little ones.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and handbags for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a 31-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with three children. The oldest child is seven years old while the youngest child is four years old. Her husband is a construction worker while Gina is engaged in hog raising business. She has been doing this business for three years. Gina and her husband work together to provide the needs of their children and give them better lives. With this, Gina is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed as well. In this way, she was able to improve her sales and augment her profit. In the future, she wants to expand this business for their sustainability and for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.en:
English Translation:

My Name has been Alba Luzt, I am retailer with a grocery store, located in my house  for several years.  I have many great customers. 

Thanks to this business I can contribute with the family expenses and the important thing is that I take care of my family.  My children work with to me in their free time. 

I need to provide but my business since during Christmas time the volume of sale is greater.

ORIGINAL SPANISH:
Mi Nombre es Alba Luz, soy comerciante cuento con una pulperia, ubicada en mi casa de habitación desde hace  varios años, tengo buena clientela.
Gracias a este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos familiares y lo mas importante es que atiendo a mi familia y mis hijos me colaboran en su tiempo libre;  necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que en epoca de navidad el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: Compra de Pollo, Jabon, azucar, Arroz, Manteca, Frijoles,harina, lacteos y Embutidos

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz has had his own auto repair business since 2005.
Before he did not have the necessary equipment and it was a problem for him. 
Then he decided to borrow $600 and he bought welding apparatus.
He has a lot of clients and he must buy spare parts for his work.
He has been able to support his family with this business.
He can not effectively meet the demands of his clients because he doesn't have the necessary spare parts. 
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy spare parts in order to be able to offer a better services to his clients and attract more clients.
Mubariz is 36 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village. He is married and has a child.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Mukhabbat

texts.en: Mukhabbat A. has three children, and her eldest daughter and son help her. Two of her sons study at universities. One of them will be an economist and the other would like to be a taxman. Her husband is in Russia. There are also two pensioners, parents of her husband, who live with them. When Mukhabat began her business it was only a small table, but now she has three tables. Mukhabat has a lot of constant clients because the assortment of her materials is very big. Now, as it is the beginning of the summer season, she would like to renew the assortment of her goods.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue diversifying her product line

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23 year old young man living in Bourj Barajneh, in the suburbs of Beirut.
He opened a wholesale charcoal business two years ago and has been constantly expanding his business since then. This is the first time Ahmad approaches Majmoua to request a loan. He needs an amount of USD $1,200 to purchase a new stock of charcoal.

loans.use: Buy charcoal stock

loans.name: Sayaad Mohammad

texts.en: Sayaad Mohammad lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children. He has a retail shop and he has run this business since 2002. Now he wants to increase his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like baskets, powders, shampoos and other necessities for his shop to attract more clients and make a good income to help his family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like baskets, powders, shampoos

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a nurse/midwife managing his own private facility in Vihiga in the western part of Kenya. He is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Kakamega. His wife who is also a trained nurse and works at Kakamega Provincial General Hospital.

Paul trained as a nurse/midwife in 1990 and has since operated his own private clinic at Stend Kisa in Vihiga. He offers a wide range of clinical services including general curative, family planning, maternal and child health services, and also runs a pharmacy and a laboratory. Paul attributes his success to hard work, perseverance and the good reputation he has built with the locals. He requires US $1200 to enable him to purchase an additional stock of drugs and to integrate other services.

loans.use: Purchase stock of drugs and integrate other services.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna J. O. sells palm and groundnut oil. She is 46 years old, married with 3 children. She has been a LAPO member for five years, and she is asking for the loan of $275 to buy more gallons of oil to sell. She has been in the business since 1996.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil for sale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The old business of selling clothing only generated losses for Nancy while she was part of it. A lack of consultation and competition made it difficult. However, she has learned a lot since then and now. For a year and a half she has kept busy with her little food stand in her neighborhood market. Her day starts very early and she starts with the most necessary tasks for breakfast and lunch. Only being 28 years old in addition to working everyday she is responsible for taking care of her children. Now, with the awaited birth of her other child, she has many expectations in the growth of her business. She would love to be able to diversify the products on her shelves to be able to better attend to her costomers.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

El antiguo negocio de venta de ropa solo le generaba pérdidas a Nancy el tiempo que estuvo en él. Ya sea por la falta de asesoría o por la gran competencia a la cual se enfrentaba. Sin embargo, ella dice haber aprendido mucho de ello y ahora, desde hace año y medio, se ocupa de atender su pequeño puesto de comida en un mercado de su barrio. Su jornada empieza muy temprano, ya que debe preparar ella sola lo necesario para los desayunos y almuerzos que vende. Con tan solo 28 años ella, además de trabajar todos los dias, se encarga de cuidar a sus dos hijos. Ahora, con el pronto nacimiento de su otro hijo, tiene muchas más expectativas en el crecimiento de su negocio. A ella le gustaría poder surtir de diversos productos el estante de su tienda para atender mejor a su clientela.

loans.use: Spur her business with more products and to better  the condition of her stand.

loans.name: Bamidele

texts.en:
Bamidele U. is married with 2 children. She is 38 years old. She is rom Oyo State, Nigeria. She resides in Benin City.

Bamidele sells drinks and provisions to earn a living in Benin. She has been in business since 2004. She needs the loan of $550 to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
Reine M. is 32 years old and has been residing in the SURULERE district for 10 years already. She is married and the mother of three children, one of whom she supports. A very serious individual when it comes to business, she buys sacks of corn wholesale and sells them retail. Parallel to this business, she has rented a store, where she sells various household items, such as sacks of rice, various canned goods, pasta, and common consumables. Because of her young age, she is a fairly energetic individual and dedicated to the success of her business. With an unfailing strictness in repayments, she comes to request her fourth loan at Alidé in order to respond better to the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

M. Reine a 32 ans et réside dans le quartier SURULERE il y a 10 ans déjà. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants dont l'un est à sa charge. Très sérieuse dans les affaires, elle achète des sacs maïs auprès des grossistes qu'elle revend au détail. Parallèlement à cette activité, elle a loué un magasin où elle revend divers produits de ménage à savoir: sacs de riz, diverses boîtes de conserves, des pattes alimentaires et biens de consommation courante. Son jeune âge fait d'elle une femme assez dynamiques et dévouée à la réussite de son activité. D'une rigueur sans faille dans le remboursement, elle vient solliciter son 04 ème prêt à Alidé pour mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy five 25-kg sacks of rice and five of corn

loans.name: Wendy Amarilis

texts.en:
Wendy Amarilis, an ambitious entrepreneur and a proud single mother of a school-age boy, is doing her best to provide a better lifestyle for her family through hard work.

She recently got a degree in Basic Education and wants to become a primary school teacher soon. Meanwhile, Wendy is selling her fashionable earrings, bracelets, shoes, and bedspreads to people in her community. Wendy has taken out two loans with our organization, and she repaid them on time. Wendy plans to use her new loan to increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase custom jewelry, shoes, and other items

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is an insistent, hardworking woman who always fights to protect the unity of her family within her home and this desire has cultivated in her the strength of implementing a brick factory and now that 12 years have passed of this intense labor she has seen the fruits of her labor, bit by bit with strength she has been able to acquire a vehicle that serves her to transport her products to other locations for purchase and requests of large quantities and her desire is to better her workshop conditions to continue her work. .

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es una mujer muy empeñosa y trabajadora que siempre lucha por conservar la unidad familiar dentro de su hogar y ese deseo ha cultivado en ella las fuerzas para implementar junto a su familia una fábrica de ladrillos y ahora que han transcurrido 12 años de esa intensa labor ha visto muchos frutos, poco a poco con esfuerzo han podido adquirir un vehículo que les sirve para transportar su producto hasta los lugares de compra y pedidos en grandes cantidades y su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de fabricaciones para seguir colaborando con el cumplimiento de los sueños de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: to inject capital into her business to better the conditions of her workshop

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi P., 56 years old, joined TYM in 2007. With her first loan, she bought foodstuff to breed pigs and chicken. Her daily income from selling chicken eggs is about 40 thousands NVD. Her husband passed away so she had to work harder to raise her child. He has found a job with income of about 1.5 million VND monthly, and is helping her with breeding pigs and raising chicken. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 9 million VND to improve her pig-pen and to buy more chickens. Her family income is about 2 million VND monthly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Phấn năm nay 56 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007. Vòng vốn đầu chị sử dụng để chăn nuôi lợn, gà đẻ. Hàng ngày chị đều có nguồn thu ổn định 40.000 từ việc bán trứng gà Chồng chị không may mất sớm chị đã phải cố gắng nhiều hơn trong công việc để nuôi con khôn lớn. Đến nay con của chị đã trưởng thành có công việc ổn định thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng . Hàng tháng con của chị đều hỗ trợ thêm cho chị để chị có thêm vốn làm ăn và chi tiêu trong gia đình Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn, gà về nuôi Thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Ni Ketut Nurhaeni

texts.id:
Hardships and increasing burdens in her life make Ni Ketut Nuraheni work tirelessly. Ni Ketut Nuraheni has 3 children. Her oldest one is married. Her second one, I Made Winarta, is now in college. Her third one, Ni Nyoman Yudiantari is in high school. Ni Ketut Nuraheni's husband is an elementary school teacher, who uses his salary to support their two children's educational needs.

Besides becoming a homemaker, Ni Ketut Nuraheni also raises a sow with 6 piglets. The $538 loan that she is requesting will be used to buy pig food for these 6 piglets. Being nurtured well by Ni Ketut Nuraheni, the piglets are growing bigger and needing a lot of food. Ni Ketut Nuraheni feeds greens as alternate food for the piglets. Otherwise, she usually feeds them with combinations of rice padi chaff, concentrate and tofu dregs. In 6 months, these piglets will be ready for sale for $753.73. With $538 cost for pig food, her net profit will be $215.35.

Translated by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Kehidupan yang sangat keras dan kebutuhan hidup yang semakin berat, membuat Ni Ketut Nuraheni terus berusaha tanpa mengenal lelah. Ni Ketut Nuraheni memiliki 3 orang anak. Anak yang pertama sudah menikah, anak yang kedua bernama I Made Winarta saat ini kuliah diperguruan tinggi dan anak yang nomor tiga bernama Ni Nyoman Yudiantari, SMU. Suami Ni Ketut Nuraheni seorang guru SD yang penghasilannya dipakai untuk membiayai pendidikan kedua anaknya. Disamping sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga, juga memiliki usaha memelihara induk babi yang saat ini sudah beranak 6 ekor. Modal yang didapat dari DINARI Rp.5.000.000,- dipakai untuk modal pakan keenam babinya karena semua anak babi ini akan dipelihara. Dengan perawatan dan juga ketelatenannya sekarang anak babinya sudah besar dan memerlukan pakan yang banyak. Ni Ketut Nurhaeni juga rajin memberikan pakan hijauan yang berupa dedaunan sebagai makanan selingan. Adapun campuran pakan yang diberi : dedak padi, konsentrat dan ampas tahu. Umur 6 bulan keenam babinya sudah siap untuk dijual . Total penghasilan kotor yang diterimanya Rp.7.000.000,-. Biaya pakan selama 6 bulan Rp. 5.000.000,- Keuntungan bersihnya Rp. 2.000.000,-

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Consuelo De Los Ange

texts.es: La Sra. Consuelo trabaja en Enacal como analista de inventario y activo fijo, con 10 años de servicio, tiene 36 años de edad y está casada con el Sr. José David Montiel conductor de la misma institución, tienen una niña de 3 años.Su horario de trabajo es de 7:30am a 8:00pm de lunes a sábado, está solicitando su 7mo. crédito para mejora de su vivienda (contrucción de un cuarto), ya que su casa solo tiene un dormitorio y su niña está creciendo y quiere darle mayores condiciones y privacidad. Con sus créditos anteriores ha realizado algunas mejoras en su vivienda y ha comprado sus electrodomésticos, ha sido una cliente que ha pagado sus créditos antes de la fecha establecida porque quiere mantener siempre su buen record créditicio.
texts.en:
Consuelo has worked for 10 years in Enacal as an inventory and fixed asset analyst. She is 36 years old and is married to Jose David Montiel, who is the manager of the institution. They have a 3 year-old daughter. Consuelo's work schedule is from 7:30am to 8:00pm, Monday through Friday. She is requesting her seventh loan for the purpose of improving her house (construction of a room), because her house only has one bedroom and her daughter is growing and she wants to give her better conditions and more privacy. With her previous loans she has completed some improvements to her house and has bought household appliances. She has been a client who has paid her loans back before the due date because she wants to always maintain her good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contrucción de un cuarto

loans.name: Mansa

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1968 à Todomé dans la région des plateaux, dame N. Mansa est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité commerciale la vente des articles de quincaillerie dans son quartier à Lomé. Elle a choisit faire ce commerce car elle a constaté que Agoè est un grand quartier en construction et que les articles de plomberie sont très vite achetés. Effectivement elle vend bien mais seulement sont stock est limité.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 9 robinets et lavabos ainsi que 4 super tank afin de satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante des clients et de tirer de revenu.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1968, in Todomé in the Plateaux Region, Mrs. Mansa N. is married and the mother of 3 children. Her business consists in selling hardware items in her neighborhood in Lomé. She chose this business after noticing that the Agoé neighborhood is in construction, so that plumbery items sell very fast. Indeed, she sells very well but she has a limited stock. She's seeking this first loan to buy 9 taps and sinks, as well as 4 tanks, to meet ever-increasing customer demands and turn a profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell plumbery items

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun L. was born in 1949 and now lives in Moen Tomrang village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. L. Chhorn, are farmers. Mr. L. Chhorn also is a vice president of the village. They own a plot of land to cultivate rice. The income does not produce enough money to support their lives. Thus, Mrs. Sun L. requests a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Señora Juana B. de 54 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Domésticos, “Elaboración de canastas Plásticas” cuenta con un pequeño Taller,  habita conjuntamente con su Esposo y sus hijos, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los Préstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chosamiel del Cantón Juchanep del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la Elaboración de canastas Plásticas para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Juana B. is a 54-year-old married homemaker. She has a small workshop to weave plastic baskets and lives with her husband and children whom she also counts on as employees. Since childhood, she has done crafts. She is thankful for the loan so that she can lead her family forward. She is well-known, and her residence is in the Paraje Chosamiel del Cantón Juchanep in the city and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. She has come to ask Asociación Asdir for financing the purchase of raw materials for basket weaving to facilitate and meet the demand of her customers, and thus have the opportunity to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for basket weaving

loans.name: Sinonn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinonn N. is a 38-year-old and lives in Samnak Thboung village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest her rice. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy two piglets to start a pig-breeding business.

Mrs. Sinonn N. hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for her family. Her husband, Mr. Kum Keng, is a worker who gets hired by the villagers to cut wood for pay. Mrs. Sinonn N. has seven children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school. The remaining three are too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest their rice and buy two piglets to start a pig-breeding business

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La señora Rosalba G. A. está separada de su esposo, vive con su Mamá, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente ella labora como operaria de producción en una maquiladora, ella cuenta con pensión alimenticia por parte se su ex-esposo y con ese ingreso que recibe mantiene a sus hijos.
La señora Rosalba G. esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar las colegiaturas y los exámenes de sus hijos para que ellos puedan seguir con sus estudios y puedan llegar a ser profesionistas en el futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalba G. A. is separated from her husband. She lives with her mother and she has 3 children. At the moment she is working as a production operator at an assembly plant. She receives maintenance from her ex-husband and together with her salary she supports her children. Mrs. Rosalba G. is requesting a loan in order to pay her children's tuition and exams so they can continue their studies and become prefessionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay tuition and academic exams.

loans.name: Mayra Rosa

texts.es: Mayra Rosa M. A. tiene 49 años, está casada, y tiene dos hijos. Doña Mayra empezó con un pequeño horno produciendo pan, pero las cantidades de producción era muy pequeñas.  Hace más de cinco años que tiene de poseer su negocio, y por eso, ella le proporcionaba ganancias para invertir en este negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Mayra son de mantener la atención de sus clientes, ya que de ellos depende la venta de pan. Más tarde, logra realizar un préstamo en Kiva para capital de trabajo ya que necesita la compra de materia prima para que su negocio pueda salir adelante. Ella va a pagar la cantidad de C$ 20.000 córdobas a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
Mayra Rosa M. A. is 49-years old, married, and has two children. Mayra began baking bread in her small oven in small quantities. She has run her business for over five years, always investing some of her earnings back into the business. Mayra's priority is good customer service, since her sales depend on her clients. She needs a working capital loan from Kiva to buy raw materials and advance her business. Mayra will repay the loan amount of 20,000 córdobas (NIO) over a period of 18 months.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nou T., 57, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$6 every day, while her husband makes US$5 a day by running a moto-taxi business. This couple has one child. Nou T. is asking for a loan to purchase yams from farmers to resell to market retailers.

loans.use: To buy yams to resell

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose is 32 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and drinks. Bose lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Penina M. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 17. Penina has been running a shop since 2000. Her business is to sell rice, cooking oil and wheat flour. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Penina currently earns about US $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US $400 in order to purchase beans, wheat flour and cooking oil for resale. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Penina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans, wheat flour, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon D. is a pig grower. He has been into this business since 2006. He was convinced to pursue raising pigs because, aside from the fact that he loves pigs so much, he has earned a lot of profit since he started his business. As the head of the family, Gideon work very hard to succeed in this kind of endeavor to support the needs of his family.

Gideon is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy pig feed. Currently he has five pigs for fattening. He needs support, especially in buying the feed, to sustain his business.


CEVI helps people to grow their business. It provides all its clients not only with loans but with training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his pigs

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: madame awa A. est femme mariee née en 1951 à louga;elle est enseignante de profession et fait également du petit commerce;elle achète des chaussures chez les cordonnires de la ville de thies pour ensuite les revendre au détail à ses collègues et voisins qui sont ses principaux clients;c'est dans le but d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire qu'elle sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa A. is a married woman who was born in 1951 in Louga. She is a teacher by profession, and she also has a small business. She buys shoes from shoemakers in the city of Thies for retail sale to colleagues and neighbors who are her main customers. With the goal of increasing her turnover, she’s requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in shoes

loans.name: Pe

texts.en:
Pe S. currently earns a daily income of $5 from driving a motorbike taxi. He always leaves his house in the early morning to pick up people who are local traders selling merchandise. He mostly provides his service at the busy local marketplace located in and around Phnom Penh City. He is 41 years old, a married man and blessed with three children. All three of them are teenagers attending secondary school. His wife, Peng Eng, 39, is an internal staff member for an organization.

Recently, Pe S.’s motor is not so attractive and his profit is decreasing. Because of this problem, Pe S. would like a loan of $700 in order to purchase a motorbike to replace his existing one. This will help him to attract more customers with income.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est âgé de 31 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi à Womé. A. exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans. Il désire avec ce crédit réparer le moteur de sa voiture étant donné que celui-ci est vétuste et est la cause de plusieurs dépenses. Kossi compte sur cette opportunité pour épargner plus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is 31 years old, is married, and is the father of 2 children. He is a taxi driver in Womé. A. has been doing this job for 4 years. With this loan he wants to repair his car's motor as it is run down and is the cause of many expenditures. Kossi counts on this opportunity to save more in order to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his car's motor

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en: Gerlie is living in the simple place of Barangay Manano Mallig, Isabela. She is blessed with three children and married to Rodolfo, who is a farmer in their village. Despite the difficulties that they are experiencing in their lives, the couple is still doing their best to be able to provide for their needs through their typical village store business. Since the business has been always a big help as their source of income, Gerlie has decided to borrow a loan from Kivato to make her store more progressive. If Kiva will give her the opportunity, she hopes to take a loan of around PHP10,000 to be utilized as additional working capital to purchase more products for selling in her store.

loans.use: To purchase more products.

loans.name: Len

texts.en: Mrs. Len L. lives in Ta Saum Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Eang Khom, is a construction worker. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to provide a good house for their family to live. Thus, Mrs. Len L. has decided to ask for a loan. She will use the loan funds, along with her savings, to build a house for her family. She is 41 years old and the mother of five children One of her children works in a garment factory, three attend the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband appears in the picture with her.

loans.use: To build a house for her family.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene B. is a 40-year-old businessman who lives with his wife and their four children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. All of the children, three girls and a boy, attend the local secondary school. Bat-Erdene and his wife of 20 years began selling clothes at the local market in 2000. Because of their hard work and honesty, their business has grown rapidly and they have established a very positive reputation throughout the local community. 

Bat-Erdene has proven to be a savvy businessmen. He has expanded his business to selling solar energy panels and electric generators after noticing they were becoming popular among the local farmers. He keeps his bookkeeping very neat, helping him track the costs and sales of the business. 

The success of the business has enabled him and his wife to buy a van and a storage container at the local market, which will be used for the business. In the future, Bat-Erdene says, "I want to expand my business even more and have my own store." 

Bat-Erdene is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 tugrugs to purchase more clothes, solar energy panels and electric generators from Erlian, China.

loans.use: Purchasing solar energy panels and electric generators from Erlian, China

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos y estudio secundaria incompleta, vive en el sector Urani Marca Kollo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra  de papas, chuño, quinua, cebada, etc. Para la venta en los mercados de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the "Manuela de Hoy II" (The Manuela of Today II) Village Bank, located in the Camicachi Community, Llave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She's 35, married, the mother of three children, and has an incomplete secondary school education. She lives in the Urani Marca Kollo sector. She's been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years. She used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy products from her region. She currently needs a loan for 2000 soles which she'll invest in the purchase of potatoes, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc., to sell at local markets. Yolanda's wish is to continue working. She enjoys the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc.

loans.name: Unutsetseg

texts.en: O. Unurtsetseg is 39 years old and lives in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She is single and shares a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home, with her mother. She currently operates a small children's clothing business in his town by importing clothing from China and selling it at the local market. After leaving a job as a saleswoman, Unurtsetseg started her children's clothing business in 2007 with capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). Due to her hard work and persistence, she has found much success. Today, her working capital exceeds 600,000 tugrugs (~420 USD). For the future, Unurtsetseg hopes to grow his business further by offering a wider variety of products. Her mission is to deliver the highest quality clothing possible to the children in her community. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase more children's clothing items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more children's clothing items

loans.name: Phork

texts.en:
Mr. Phork Y., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Ratana Bou, 39, live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1988 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. His wife is shown in the photo.

Phork has been a policeman for over 20 years, while his wife stays at home and does housework. He wants to supplement his salary by operating a taxi business when he is free, and so is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to add to his own money to buy a van to drive as a taxi.

loans.use: To add to his own money to buy a van to drive as a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is 39 years old.  He is married and a father of two children. The client has been running this mechanical shop for eight years. He has two employees working for him.  He applied for this loan in order to buy additional equipment and hire more labor. The client has a good reputation in the market and has lots of customers.

loans.use: buy equipment and hire additional labor

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a twenty-nine year old, married, young woman with a son in school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kade, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Though Kade is a commercial town, majority of the inhabitants are into farming as a hobby or major occupation along side other trading activity. Alice is a trader. She trades in groundnut paste. She buys the fresh groundnut from nearby communities, roasts and sends to the mill to have it milled into paste. Alice sells at the local market and also supplies to food vendors. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts in large quantity.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.es:
Mildred tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y vive con la última de sus 3 hijas, quien ya es mayor de edad y trabaja.
Desde hace 5 años tiene un pequeño kiosko afuera de su casa donde vende bebidas y golosinas. Su horario de atención es de 2 de la tarde a 9 de la noche.
Mildred está muy satisfecha con su negocio, y lo que más le gusta es poder brindar a sus clientes una buena atención para que siempre retornen a comprar sus productos, pues ella es una persona muy carismática y jovial.
Una de las ventajas de su negocio es que está ubicada en una zona por donde transitan muchas personas, por ello siempre tiene buenas ventas.
Por ello, para el futuro quiere lograr instalar un restaurante en su vivienda.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y lo que más le gusta de ser parte de un banco comunal es que se trabaja en unión y sus compañeros son muy responsables con sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá  en la compra de más productos para surtir su kiosko.
texts.en:
Mildred is 46 years old, a single mother, and lives with the last of her three daughters, who is already adult and working.

For the last 5 years she has had a small kiosk outside her house where she sells drinks and sweets. Her schedule is from 2 in the afternoon until 9 at night.

Mildred is very happy with her business, and what she likes best is to be able to offer her customers good service so that they will always return and buy her products. She is a very charismatic and jovial person.

One of the advantages her business has is it's location in a zone where many people walk by, resulting in good sales. For this reason, in the future she would like to install a restaurant in her home.

This is the first credit she has requested with MFP and what she likes most about being part of a community bank is working in union with companions who are very responsible about their payments. The money she is soliciting will be invested in purchasing more products to add to her kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer
