loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE FOR HER KIOSK

loans.name: Tulia

texts.es:
Tulia M. es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el distrito D. Calleria región D. Ucayali, tiene 55 años, es viuda, madre D. cuatro hijos, todos mayores D. edad.
Tulia se dedica a la venta D. pollos, paralelamente, atienD. una pequeña bodega instalada en su propia casa.
Tulia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martín D. Porres” desD. hace nueve años. El primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que invirtió en la venta D. pollos. 
Actualmente requiere un crédito D. 3000 soles que será utilizado en la compra D. productos comestibles para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. La meta D. Tulia es ser distribuidora D. gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Tulia M., 55, has been a dynamic and hard working member of the “Fray Martín D. Porres” communal bank for 9 years. She lives in the Calleria district, Ucayali region. She has four adult children. She sells chickens and also tends to a small grocery store in her home. He first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy chickens. She currently needs 3000 soles to buy food items such as, rice, sugar, pasta, etc. for her store. Tulia's ultimate goal is to be a wholesale soft-drink distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items (rice, sugar, pasta, etc) to stock her store.

loans.name: Kaï

texts.fr: M. Kaï est née en 1965 à Djidja au Bénin. Kaï vit depuis 9 ans à Bazounkpa non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Kaï est mariée à AFANSSINOU Coffi, un transitaire, et est mère de quatre enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Bazounkpa. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Kaï n’a pas été à l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Kaï exerce ce métier depuis cinq ans. A côté de cela, Kaï vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier. C’est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Kaï s’approvisionne. C’est la première fois que Kaï sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à renforcer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Kai M. was born in 1965 at Djidja in Benin. Hai has lived in Bazounkpa, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin since she was 9 years old. Kai is maried to Coffi Afanssinou a transient worker. She is the mother of 4 children. All of her children attend school and live with their parents in Bazounkpa. The couple support the needs of their family. Kai never attended school, but learned to be a hair dresser. She has practiced her trade for 5 years. She also sells hair pieces and cosmetic products from her salon. Kai buys her supplies at Lome in Togo, a country neighboring Benin and from Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. This is the first loan that Kai has requested from ALIDe and will be used to strengthen her business and better satisfy the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 dozen hair pieces and 3 cartons of cosmetic products

loans.name: Rina Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Rina  S. forma parte del Banco Comunal Avenida del Ejercito en la ciudad de Portoviejo,  está casada tiene seis  hijos su esposo trabaja como chofer de un bus interprovincial y  ella desde hace diez  años se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurant ubicado en el  terminal terrestre de la ciudad, sus actividades  inician a las 4 de la mañana ya que desde esa hora empieza a  atender en su negocio  y cierra a la 5 de la tarde todos los días,  además tiene unas cabinas telefónicas en otro local dentro del terminal.

Para Rina atender su negocio es muy importante porque le ayuda en su estado emocional, además  ella cuenta con la ayuda de una señora en el restaurant y un chico atiende en las cabinas,  gracias al trabajo de su esposo y el de ella han logrado  salir adelante y cumplir con los pagos a la Fundación. 

Con este nuevo préstamo ella comprará  productos como arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, carne, pescado y más productos para preparar los alimentos en su restaurante y para comprar tarjetas de recargas electrónicas de sus cabinas.
texts.en:
Rina S. is part of the Avenida del Ejercito Communal Bank in the city of Portoviejo. She is married and has six children. Her husband works as a driver of an inter-provincial bus. For ten years she has been selling food in her restaurant, which is located in the city’s bus station. She starts her work at four in the morning, and she closes at five in the afternoon everyday. She also has some telephone booths at another location in the station. Tending her business is very important to Rina because it helps her emotional state. Also, she has the help of a woman in the restaurant, and a boy tends the telephone booths. Thanks to her work and her husband’s, they have been able to get ahead and make their payments to the Foundation. She will use this new loan to buy products like rice, sugar, salt, oil, meat, fish, and many other products to prepare the food in her restaurant. She will also buy calling cards for her phone booths.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, salt, oil, meat, and fish for her restaurant and calling cards for her phone booths

loans.name: Kelly Julliana

texts.es:
Kelly es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su menor hijo de 6 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir, joyas y cubrecamas. Ella nos comenta que empezó este negocio gracias a que pudo ahorrar dinero producto de unos años de trabajo en el país de Chile. Ella compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Trujillo y la distribuye en base a pedidos que le solicitan sus habituales clientes.

El negocio goza de buena acogida y Kelly tiene cada vez más pedidos, pero no se abastece para seguir adelante con él. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más productos para ampliar su negocio.

Kelly es una madre joven, reponsable y emprendedora. Su más grande anhelo es poder reunir junto a su esposo el dinero suficiente para tener su casa propia y brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Kelly, 29, lives with her husband and 6-year-old son in her parents' house. It is located in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 6 years she has sold clothing, jewelry and bedspreads. She tells us that she was able to start this business thanks to some savings she had from working a few years in Chile. She buys her merchandise in the city of Trujillo and she sells it based on prior orders from her regular customers. Her business is well-received and Kelly has more and more orders to fill each time; however, she often lacks funds to buy all the merchandise she needs. She is asking for her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy more stock items. Kelly is a young, responsible, enterprising mother. Her greatest wish is to gather, together with her husband, enough money to have their own home and to provide their son with a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Blessed Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Prossy is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 31 years old and married with four children aged 13 to 4 years. She also takes care of orphans.

Prossy is a business lady involved in hawking (selling door-to-door) tablecloths from Mbikko. She has been in her business for five years and her business, being competitive, gives her a chance to have quality materials for sale.

Prossy used to deal in secondhand clothes and she does not regret the change she made. She is grateful for her loans that have helped to hold her head high in business and she would like to grow her business further as well as educating her children to the higher levels.

Prossy needs a loan to be able to buy more tablecloths for resale.

loans.use: To buy more tablecloths to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 46 year old mother of one. She has a business selling new clothes in Nairobi, a business she has been running for ten years. She says that she has gained financial independence since joining Faulu Kenya. She has requested for a loan of Kes. 60,000 to add stock such as trousers, shirts and shoes. She hopes to grow her business into wholesale and own several textile shops in Limuru. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Laïdou est composé de femmes mariées ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux dans le village de Djoutièbougou préfecture de Bougouni, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de mariage et de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leurs ressources financières, elles décident d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 7 boites de 2kg de  concentrée de tomate, 4 sacs de 25kg de sel de cuisine, 10 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et diverses autres qualités de condiments. Les produits sont payés auprès des grossistes de Bougouni pour ensuite être revendus en détail, au comptant ou à crédit dans le village de Djoutièbougou à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, ces femmes du groupe Laïdou  comptent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé  dans les frais de santé et d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The Laïdou group is made up of married women with the average age of 26, 2 children and live in traditional polygamous extended families with their brothers, sisters, children and husbands in the town of Djoutièbougou in the third administrative district of Mali, Bougouni. These women know each other via family and business relationship. With the intention of increasing their financial resources they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution so they can be in the business of selling food goods. They are asking for their first group loan, to be used for the purchase of 7 boxes of 2 kg canned puree, 4 25 kg bags of kitchen salt, 10 packs of 100 count bouillon cubes and a variety of types of condiments. The products are paid for wholesale in Bougouni to be sold retail in town of Djoutièbougou. They accept both cash and credit from a client base primarily made up of women. WIth the loan, the women of the Laïdou group count on gaining a monthly income of 25.000 FCFA which will be used to pay for the health and educational expenses of their children.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of edible condiments

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a 38-year-old married man with two children who go to school.  He sells vegetables, fruits and grains and has one employee.  He has been in the business for four years. He was previously employed as a cashier in a town restaurant.  He also does farming to earn a living.  Since he is the breadwinner in his family, he works hard to meet his family’s needs.  Kennedy is a member of Nakaso group in Faulu Kenya where he saves his money.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy fruits, vegetables and grains.   For this loan, his group members have guaranteed him. He hopes to be a major supplier of farm produce.  He plans to venture into zero grazing in the future.

loans.use: To buy grains, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mamajanova Kanayim`s Group

texts.ru:
Канайым, 39, замужем. Она занимается животноводством: откорм и разведение КРС и МРС. В настоящий момент откармливает 35 овец, 3 коровы и 2-х бычков. Супруг работает в пожарной охране. У нее 4 детей: сыну 19 лет, дочерям 17, 5, 12 лет. На кредит планирует закупить сено и корм для живности.

Борубаева Мотобар 43 года. Ее супруг частный сварщик, также полуает пособие в размере 6 000 ом (120 долларов). У нее 7 детей: Старшая дочь на заработках в РФ, старший сын работает в отделе охраны сержантом, второй сын на заработках в РФ, вторая дочь студентка, остальные дети школьники. Клиент занимается животноводством: откорм и разведение КРС. Клиент хочет закупить живность для увеличения поголовья.

Алиме  77 лет. она вдова, у нее двое детей. Клиент вместе с сыном сельским хозяйством: выращивание и реализация картофеля. Посадила на 0,20 га земли картофель, 0,10 га планирует посадить табак, 0,10 га кукурузу. Клиент планирует закупить 200 кг мин. удобрения, обработать землю и сделать минирования грядков.

Кимсан,  78 лет. Она вдова. 'Она занята откормом и разведением КРС, дома откармливает 3 поголовье КРС. Она хочеть купить холодильник для дома.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kanayim is 39 years old, married. She is involved in animal husbandry: fattening and breeding cattle and small livestock. She is currently fattening 35 sheep, 3 cows and 2 bulls. Her husband works with the fire prevention service. Kanayim has 4 children: son is 19 years old, daughters are 17, 5 and 12 years old. She plans to use the loan to buy hay and feed for the livestock. Motobar B. is 43 years old. Her husband is a private welder and also receives a pay in the sum of 6000 som (120 dollars). Motorbar has 7 children. The oldest daughter works in the Russian Federation, oldest son works as a sergeant at the security department, second son also works in Russia, second daughter is a student, and the rest of the children go to school. The client is involved in animal husbandry: fattening and breeding cattle. She wants to buy livestock in order to increase livestock headcount. Alima is 77 years old. She is a widow and has two children. The client and her son are involved in agriculture: growing and selling of potatoes. She planted potatoes on 0.20 hectares of land, plans to plant tobacco on 0.10 hectares and corn on another 0.10 hectares. The client plans to purchase 200 kg of mineral fertilizers, treat and mine the soil. Kimsan is 78 years old. She is a widow. She is involved in fattening and breeding of cattle, and has 3 heads of cattle at home. She wants to buy a refrigerator for home.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hay and livestock feed

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis Carlos Rodríguez tiene 43 años y vive en Villa Katanga un barrio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 9 años de edad; en su casa adecuó un local donde tiene 12 computadores en sus respectivas cabinas de madera y maneja 3 planes de celulares, con los que ofrece servicios de internet y telefonía a destinos locales nacionales e internacionales. Como en villa Katanga y sus alrededores son pocos los negocios que ofrecen servicios de Internet, y resulta muy economico hacer llamadas a celulares, el local de  Luis Carlos permanece  muy lleno de clientes que vienen de varios sectores aledaños,  los  muchas veces tienen que esperar a que se desocupen los equipos, para acceder a los servicios ofrecidos; esta es la razón por la que él solicita su tercer crédito, porque quiere comprar un equipo de cómputo con sus  respectivas instalaciones y un par de planes de líneas telefónicas. 
Luis Carlos  se inició como emprendedor en el año 1997 cuando vendía discos puerta a puerta y ya su negocio tenía un nombre,  “Discos Carlos”, fue en ese entonces cuando empezó su relación con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con un crédito de $600.000 y pasó a tener su disquera en su casa, tiempo después  cambió  de actividad, cuando vender disco dejó de ser un buen negocio; asì fue como suspendió sus créditos y  posteriormente  cuando emprendió el negocio que en la actualidad tiene, hace tres años, volvió a  iniciar su relación crediticia con esta organización.  Asì fue como asignó en su vivienda un espacio para su nuevo negocio y desde que recibió su crédito su vida ha cambiado,  porque pudo adquirir su vivienda y comprar activos fijos. Su nuevo sueño es afianzar su negocio y hacerlo un sitio preferido por sus clientes. Su mayor desafío es comprar una vivienda para separar su espacio comercial de su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Luis Carlos Rodríguez is 43 and lives in Villa Katanga, a suburb of Soledad with his wife and his 2 children who are 15 and 9 years of age. His house has been adapted into a store where he has 12 computers, each in their own wooden cabinets and operates 3 mobile phone lines. With these he offers internet and phone services to local, national and international destinations. As in Villa Katanga and its surrounding areas there are few businesses that offer internet services, and it is very economical to make calls to mobiles, Luis Carlos' store is always very full of customers who come from several areas nearby. Most of the time they have to wait for the equipment to become free, so that they can access the services he offers. This is the reason why he is asking for his third loan, because he wants to buy computer equipment and systems and a couple of telephone lines. Luis Carlos started out as an entrepreneur in 1997 when he used to sell records door to door and his business already had a name, “Discos Carlos”. It was then that he started his relationship with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation with a $600,000 loan and he started up a record shop in his home. After a time he changed business, when selling records stopped being a good business. Therefore he suspended his loans and later when he started the business he currently has, three years ago, he began his credit relationship with this organization again. And that was how he allocated a space in his home for his new business and since he received his loan his life has changed, because he was able purchase his home and buy fixed assets. His new dream is to consolidate his business and make it the preferred site for his customers. His biggest challenge is to buy a home to separate his commercial space from his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer equipment and systems and a couple of telephone lines.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria tiene 45 años y 1 hijo que está estudiando, Maria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, que ofrece a amigos y familiares, con lo cual obtiene un ingreso para su familia. Los sueños de Maria es que su hijo pueda asistir a una universidad y logre ser un buen profesional. Maria necesita un préstamo  dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes, cremas por lo que se preocupa de generar ingresos para el alimento diario. Sueña con tener su propio medio de transporte que le facilite la entrega de sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria is 45-years-old and she has 1 child in school. Maria sells cosmetics from catalogs that she offers to her friends and relatives in order to make an income for her family. Maria's dream is that her son will be able to attend a university and become a professional. She needs a loan that she will invest in the purchase of perfumes, creams, and whatever else is necessary to generate enough income to put food on the table. She hopes one day to have her own mode of transportation that will facilitate the delivery of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes, creams, and other cosmetics

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati A. goes around her neighborhood in Abura selling children’s wear. She is married to a carpenter and has a child. She has no formal education. Fati uses her income to help her husband take care of their only son. This loan will enable her to purchase bales of children's wear to sell. Fati plans to reinvest her new profits into her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of children's wear to sell

loans.name: Ugarte

texts.es: Ugarte, de 25 años, es un joven padre de familia, muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nirce de 26 años y su querida hija Joyita de 2 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los largos días de trabajo que Ugarte tiene en sus chacras, le han hecho ver que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr una buena calidad en sus cultivos. Todas las mañanas, junto a los primeros rayos de sol, camina hasta sus campos donde están cultivados café, plátano, cacao y palta, las  cuales están a una hora aproximadamente. Durante estos 8 años de trabajo agrícola, considera que disfruta mucho del cultivo y lo hace con mucho esmero, pero parte de este trabajo tiene que tener mucho cuidado para que la plaga no ataquen y dañen sus cultivos. En lo sucesivo espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su grupo comunal, es un compañero muy participativo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para aplicar y cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ugarte is 25-years-old. He's a modest, hardworking young father. He lives in his own house with his wife Nirce, 26, and his beloved daughter Joyita, who's 2-years-old. They are the principle motivation for all his hard work. The long days of work that Ugarte puts in at his small farm have made him realize that he has to work very hard to achieve a good quality crop. Every morning at dawn he walks approximately one hour to his fields where he grows coffee, bananas, cacao, and avocado. During the past 8 years of agricultural work he's realized that he greatly enjoys farming and does it with much care, but part of the job is being very careful to avoid plagues which attack and damage the crop. In the future he hopes to buy new land to expand his crops. This is his third loan with MFP and he knows that he has to make his payments on time if he wants to gain access to other loans in the future. He's very active in his community. With the 2,000 PEN ($725) he's asking for he will buy more fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Chay

texts.en: Chay S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a farmer, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns an income of US $3 per day. S. is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel E. is from the town of Panglao. She is 49 years old. Isabel is married and has 6 children. Her eldest is aged 30. Her younger children still go to school and she hopes for them to finish college someday. To make a living, Isabel owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing laundry services in the local community. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over 8 years. She wants to start raising hogs so she would have an extra source of income. 

Isabel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. She also plans to buy piglets to raise. This will be the eleventh loan taken out by Isabel from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for laundry and buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame Y. sells kenkey at takoradi. She has received senior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is into carpentry. She is responsible by supporting her husband in giving the children a better education.

Maame’s loan will be used to buy more maize to use for her kenkey production. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a plot of land.

To prepare her kenkey, Maame buys maize from the market and soaks it in enough water to soften it. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough from the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove (ferment and rise).

On the next day she divides the proved dough into two, uses one part for her firm half-cooked dough (she mixes it with water to get it in a porridge form and cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture) and then pounds it in a mortar for some time. The pounding makes it taste different from the normal kenkey. Finally, it is wrapped in a corn husk and boiled. Then it is ready to be served with any kind of sauce.

loans.use: To buy more maize to use for her kenkey production

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Jekafo sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles  vivent dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt en collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente d‘articles divers tels la friperie  avec Aminata S..
 Avec son nouveau prêt, Aminata S. compte acheter 7 balles de friperie. Elles s’approvisionne à Bamako et au grand marché de Sikasso.
Elles vend à Sikasso ville ( à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les  quartiers de façon ambulante), au comptant, souvent à crédit avec une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et  pouvoir aménager son point de vente.
texts.en:
The five members of the Jekafo group are married women, who average 39 years of age with an average of three children. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their third loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying their customers' needs. The previous loans have been repaid in full. They sell a variety of articles, such as second-hand clothing, sold by Aminata S.. With her new loan, Aminata S. is planning on buying seven bales of second-hand clothes. She gets her supplies in Bamako and at the large market in Sikasso. She sells her goods in Sikasso town (at home, in markets and wandering around the various neighborhoods), for cash, but often on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 28,500FCFA, of which part will be used for savings and family needs, while the rest is invested in the business. Her ambition is to have more capital in order to better satisfy her customers and to do up her sales outlet.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek S. is married, but has been divorced from her husband since her children were young. Sek S. currently lives with two of her children, while another one of her children is married and lives independently. To earn the money, Sek S. sells different types of fruit in the local busy market. Sek S. will be using the loan she requested to buy fruit from her wholesale supplier and resell them to raise income.

loans.use: To buy fruit from her wholesale supplier and resell them to raise income.

loans.name: Yelba Lilliam

texts.es: Selene De Los Andes tiene 35 años es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Su actividad es la comercialización de muebles de mimbre y de madera, por lo que no es la primera vez que recurre a financiamientos para fortalecer su negocio. Ella siempre está buscando fuerzas para salir adelante y proporcionarles a sus hijos lo más necesario. Este negocio inicio por su hermana pues debido a las dificultades que atravesaba decidió que Selene administrara el negocio este crédito será para la compra de materia prima como materiales necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos, pues tiene varios pedidos.
texts.en: Selene De Los Andes is 35 years old and she is a single mom of a boy who is in her care. She has a business making and selling wicker furniture and it is not the first time she has accessed a loan to improve her business. She has always looked for support to come out ahead and to support her child as much as possible. She started this business with her sister's help. With the difficult times she was going through she decided that Selene would be the administrator of the business. This loan will be used to purchase materials necessary for the creation of her products. She has various orders that still need to be filled.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel tiene  41 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a dos hijos ya mayores de edad en el caserío San Luis, una zona rural del distrito de La Victoria, el lugar se encuentra situado aproximadamente a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida. Ella prepara los alimentos en su vivienda y luego los ofrece en venta frente a un colegio de la zona, sus clientes son los estudiantes de la institución y los pobladores de la zona. Adicionalmente cría y vende animales menores. Con estos ingresos ella se encarga de sacar adelante a los suyos.

María desea adquirir algunos insumos como arroz, papas, aceite entre otros con los cuales desea ampliar su producción para percibir mayores ingresos por las ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer luchadora y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María Isabel is 41 years old, separated, and lives together with her two grown-up children in the settlement of San Luis, a rural area of La Victoria district which is located approximately twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She prepares and sells food.  She prepares the food in her home and then offers it for sale opposite a school in her area.  Her customers are the school students and local inhabitants.  In addition, she rears and sells small animals.  With this income she helps her family to get ahead in life.

María would like to purchase some ingredients including rice, potatoes and oil with which she wants to expand her production in order to increase the income from her sales.  For this reason she decided to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 300 nuevos soles.  This will help her to achieve her goal.

María is a fighter and has a great desire to get ahead in life.  People who know her consider her to be a calm and responsible woman.

loans.use: To purchase some ingredients including rice, potatoes and oil

loans.name: Alestina

texts.en:
Alestina G. is a married woman who lives in Purok Daisy, Barangay Talacagay, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Food Vending and General Store businesses. Her husband, Wilfredo G., who is 50 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 17 to 23 years old. 

Alestina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Alestina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $150, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing 14,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy ingredients for her food vending and inventory for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Alestina G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of food vending

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Magnolia; La socia tiene 37 años de edad, ella es conviviente; y tiene 1 hijo, la socia trabaja en un laboratorio y también ella puso su propio negocio, la socia tiene un restaurante desde hace 5 años, la socia desea implementar su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de servicio y su local, ella comprara insumos, muebles  (mesas para el negocio y sillas). La socia invertirá el dinero en mejorar su negocio e implementar.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “LOS DIAMANTES”, which is located in the Huanchac district in the province and state of Cusco.

Mrs. Magnolia is 37 years old and lives with her partner.  She has 1 son.  She works in a laboratory and also started her own business; a restaurant she opened 5 years ago.  She wants to invest in her business to improve the quality of service and the locale.  She will purchase ingredients, furniture (tables for the business and chairs).  She will use the money to improve her business. 

She values and is thankful for the loan provided through this organization, and promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: She will use her money to improve her business.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anastasia; ella tiene 47 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. fabrica D. tejas y ladrillos y también se dedica a la crianza D. pollos, la socia se dedica a la venta D. menestras que venD. en el mercado D. Ttio,ella venD. desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a diferentes negocios y trabaja mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar los negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las tejas y ladrillos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank " Ricchary Cusco", the bank is located in the district, province and area of Cusco.

Anastasia is 47 years old, married and has five children, she alternates her daily activities with the business of making and selling bricks and tiles, she also raises chickens and sells dry seeds and beans at the market of Ttio, she sells from 8am to 1 pm, she is an entrepreneurial woman that works on different businesses and she works a lot to get her children ahead and wants to improve her businesses. She requests a loan to buy materials to make bricks and tiles.

The member is thankful to who is part of her dream through this website and she commits to make her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: Buy materials to make brick and tile

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLITARIO SE LLAMA SAN JOSE PORQUE ES EL SANTO PATRONO D. L. COMUNIDAD. ESTA UBICADO EN L. COMUNIDAD D. NUEVO BUENAVISTA QUE PERTENECE AL MUNICIPIO D. SAN MIGUEL SOYALTEPEC EN EL ESTADO D. OAXACA. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR  7 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN PORQUE VIVEN EN L. MISMA COMUNIDAD Y SON VECINOS. ESTE ES SU 4° PRÉSTAMO CON FUNDACIÓN REALIDAD.

EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA RUTILO V. L. TIENE 38 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 6 AÑO D. PRIMARIA ES CASADO Y TIENEN 5 HIJOS: 4 SON MUJERES Y 1 HOMBRE. 
Rutilo tiene UN TAQUERIA EN SU CASA A L. CUAL LLAMO "EL RINRIN" PORQUE ASI LLAMA A SU HIJO EL MAS PEQUEÑO. EL NECESITA un CREDITO PARA COMPRAR CARNE, ACEITE, TORTILLAS, TOMATES, CHILES, PLATOS Y bolsas DESECHABLES. SUS VECIONOS NOS COMENTAN QUE SON LOS MEJORES TACOS  D. L. COMUNIDAD. DON RUTILO ESPERA EN UN FUTURO TENER SU PROPIO LOCAL PARA QUE SU NEGOCIO crezca Y ASI BRINDARLE UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, CON SUS GANACIAS ESPERA DARLES ESTUDIOS A SUS HIJOS Y UNA MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA.

L. SEÑORA FIDENCIA L. S. TAMBIEN ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPOP SAN JOSE, ELL. NO ESTUDIO ES CASADA Y TIENE 4 HIJOS LOS CUALES YA ESTAN CASADOS. ELL. SE DEDICA A CRIAR CERDOS PARA POSTERIORMENTE VENDERLOS TAMBIEN TIENE UN PEQUEÑO MOLINO D. MAIZ ELL. REALIZA SUS ACTIVIDADES DESD. SU HOGAR, SU préstamo LO INVERTIRA EN L. COMPRA D. MAIZ, ALGUNAS piezas PARA SU MOLINO Y ALIMENTO PARA SUS CERDOS. DOÑA FID. COMO L. LLAMAN SUS VECINOS ESPERA EN UN FUTURO COMPRAR UN MOLINO NUEVO PORQUE EL QUE YA TIENE ES MUY VIEJO.

LOS OTROS 5 INTEGRANTES SE LLAMAN BIBIANA H. A., SUSANA A. D. L. L. VENDEN ABARROTES(van a comprar FRIJOL, MAIZ, ARROZ, ACEITE, DULCES Y REFRESCOS ), CESAREA J. B. VEND. REFRESCOS, GILLERMINA B. R. Y CRISTINA V. L. CRIAN CERDOS PARA VENDERLOS POSTERIORMENTE.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called San José because San José is the patron saint of the group's community.  The group is located in Nuevo Buenavista community which is in the town of San Miguel Soyaltepec, in the State of Oaxaca.  The group has 7 members who all know each other because they are neighbors.  This is their fourth loan with Fundación Realidad.

The group's representative is called Rutilo V. L..  He is 38 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  He is married and has 5 children: 4 daughters and 1 son.  Rutilo has a taco restaurant in his home which is called 'El Rinrin' because that is the name of his youngest child.  He needs a loan to buy meat, oil, tortillas, tomatoes, chilis, dishes and disposable bags.  His neighbors tell us that his are the best tacos in the community.  Rutilo hopes that in the future he will have his own premises so that his business can grow and he can proviD. his customers with a better service.  He hopes to use his profits to proviD. his children with an education and a better quality of life.

Mrs Fidencia L. S. is also a member of the San José group.  She didn't study.  She is married and has four children who are already married.  She raises pigs which she then sells.  She also has a small corn mill.  She carries out her businesses from her home.  She will invest her loan in buying corn, some pieces for her mill and feed for her pigs.  Doña FiD., as her neighbors know her, hopes in the future to buy a new mill because the one she has now is very old.

The other 5 members of the group are called Bibiana H. A. and Susana A. D. L. L. who sell groceries (they will buy beans, corn, rice, oil, sweets and soft drinks), Cesarea J. B. who sells soft drinks, and Gillermina B. R. and Cristina V. L. who raise and sell pigs.

loans.use: For buying, raising and selling pigs, for selling groceries and for selling Mexican food (tacos)

location.town: NUEVO BUENAVISTA, SAN MIGUEL SOYALTEPEC, OAXACA

loans.name: Suon's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven members living in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. Mrs. Suon Y., 48 years old, is the village bank president, having been selected by its members. They hope that the loans will help their families increase their incomes and improve their living.
 
Mrs. Suon Y. and her husband are farmers who own a 1.2-hectare  piece of land that they use to cultivate rice and other crops. They do not have enough money to support this farm, so Mrs. Suon Y. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to grow her crops. 

Aside from farming, her husband also earns his living through breeding ducks and selling their eggs to support the family. This couple has one child who is also a farmer and who supports his parents' farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline to grow crops

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Tereza De Jesús tiene 28 años, su actividad es la venta de cerdos esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos ya que han sido, muy importantes para su negocio. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su medio de vida. Ella se levanta temprano pues tiene que buscar las mejores ofertas que le realizan, ella sido una mujer muy responsable con sus cuotas de pago ya que sabe que por medio de los financiamientos es que ha podido sacar adelante su negocio. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de cerdos, que son necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en: Tereza de Jesus is 28 years old. Her business is selling pigs and it is not the first time she accesses a loan. Loans have been important for her business. She has always been a fighter and she enjoys her way of life. She wakes very early in the morning to take advantage of the best deals. She has been very responsible with her loan payments and she knows that these loans are the best way to progress with her business. She wants this loan to purchase pigs, which are necessary for her business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Luz Moserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jesús Del Gran Poder se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Luz, ella tiene 54 años de edad, en la actualidad está separada, de esa relación tiene 5 hijos pero uno de ellos falleció, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Está en el Banco Comunal ya por 10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 13h00 y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en Calceta y nos cuenta que tiene su clientela seleccionada porque es muy riesgoso dejar a personas desconocidas, nos cuenta que lleva seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer,  pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Jesús del Gran Poder community bank meets in the beautiful city of Calceta.  Calceta is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city without equal) because, as far as its residents are concerned, there is no city more beautiful in the world.

Here we meet Luz.  Luz is 54 years old and currently separated.  She has 5 children from her relationship but one of them died.  All of her children are grown up and independent.  She has been a member of her community bank for 10 years and she likes being a member because of the help that the institution provides.

Luz sells all kinds of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from her home.  She works every day from 9.00am to 1.00pm and she also works all day at weekends.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Calceta and tells us that she chooses her customers carefully because it is very risky to leave products with people she doesn't know.  She tells us that she has been in her business for six years and it has done very well.

Luz will use this loan to buy clothes; above all women's clothes, pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other garments.  Her dream is to own her own home since the house she lives in at the moment is rented.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes, pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen  is 28 years, married to a soldier, and the mother of three children between the ages of 6 months and 6 years. Allen has operated a business selling secondhand children's clothes for six years. Allen is requesting a loan in order to buy more secondhand clothes. She plans to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Aniceto; El socio tiene 41 años de edad, el socio  es casado el socio tiene 4 hijos, el menor de ellos tiene 4 años, el socio tiene una unidad vehicular, el socio presta el servicio de taxi, el socio desea hacer el mantenimiento a su auto y comprarle llantas, el socio invertirá el dinero en la compra de llantas nuevas para su auto, el socio hace 7 años era transportista y ahora con su vehículo realiza servicio de taxi en la ciudad. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas.  

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Aniceto is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu de San Jeronimo” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 41 years old, married, and has four children. The youngest child is four years old. Aniceto has a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services. He wants to maintain his automobile and purchase tires. The money he requested will be invested in the purchase of new tires for his car. Aniceto has been a taxi driver for seven years and now uses his vehicle to provide taxi service throughout the city.

He is happy with the loan being provided and promises to complete his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Gulzar's Group

texts.en:
Gulzar is a resident of Jaranawala, which is a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan. She has been living there with her family in a single room brick house for the past 12 years. Her husband works in a private firm for a low income and she operates an embroidery business to share the financial burden with him. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders from her neighboring clients every month. 

She is a mother of four sons. Her eldest son operates a sweetmeat business. He operates his small shop in the market and prepares many sweetmeat items to sell to his customers on profit. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and has a good taste in his hands which his clients admire. 

Her second son works in a mill, The third is studying in class 9th while the youngest one stays at home. He is only 6 years old. Gulzar is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her eldest son in improving his sweetmeat business. With the loan, he will buy ingredients such as milk, sugar, cooking oil and dried fruits to make sweetmeats in larger quantity which will help him increase his sales and earn better profits. Gulzar is hopeful that her son will make positive use of loan and improve his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She has maintained a good credit behavior in every loan year. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Gulzar.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for sweetmeat selling business.

loans.name: Soledad Rosalia

texts.es:
Soledad nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 26 años de edad. Actualmente,  Soledad vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú) junto con su hijo, ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y   su actividad económica principal es vender laminas plastificadas litográficas, ella nos cuenta que no es fácil encontrar en la ciudad del Cusco las laminas y por ese motivo ella tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Lima y comprar sus laminas. Ya son dos años que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El sueño de  la socia es abrir una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos y convertirse en proveedora de las láminas. 
 
Soledad en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más láminas. 

Soledad es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Soledad was born in Cusco Department and is 26 years old.  Soledad currently lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Perú) with her son.  She is a responsible mother who moves her family ahead in life.  Her main economic activity is the sale of laminated lithographs.  She tells us that it isn’t easy to find such lithographs in Cusco so she has to go to Lima to buy them.  She’s been in this line of work for two years and she does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Her dream is to open a store where she can sell her products and become a supplier of the lithographs.

On this occasion Soledad wants the loan to increase capital buying more lithographs.

Soledad is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy more laminated lithographs.

loans.name: Elena Angela

texts.es:
Elena es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora la cual se cataloga como una botánica y esotérica originaria de la costa Caribe de Nicaragua. Inicio en Adim con crédito solidario y actualmente se graduó a crédito individual. 
Elena tiene un pequeño taller de costura  desde hace 20 años donde hace ropa, fundas, ropa de cama, etc. las cuales comercializa en sus dos tramos en waspan. Además tiene una venta den pollo y especies la cual inicio con el  crédito pasado. El crédito lo invertirá en pollo, mortadela, jamón, chorizo etc. y una parte en mejoras del hogar.
Ella tiene tres hijos ya mayores los cuales trabajan con ella y su meta principal es mejorar su casa y que sus hijos tengan cada uno la suya.
texts.en:
Elena is a hard-working, driven and entrepreneurial woman who classes herself as a botanist and esoteric person, originally from the Caribbean coast of Nicaragua.  She started working with ADIM's group loans and has now graduated to receiving individual loans.

Mrs Elena has a small sewing workshop which she has had for 20 years.  She makes clothes, cushion covers, bedclothes, etc. which she sells on her two sales stands in Waspan.  She also has a business selling chicken and spices which she set up with her last loan.  She will invest part of this loan in buying chicken, bologna, ham, chorizo etc. and will use the rest of the loan to make some home improvements.

Mrs Elena has three grown-up children who work with her and her main goal is to improve her own home and to ensure that her children each have one as well.

loans.use: to buy chicken, bologna, ham, chorizo, etc.

loans.name: Jenny Maribel

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo vía a Manta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Pedro, es este lugar su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La señora Jenny es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque aquí ha encontrado mucha ayuda para continuar con su negocio. Tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y dos de 12 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en  escuela, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella se dedica a la cría de aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos, nos cuenta que en temporadas compra de cien a doscientos pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta,  cuando ya están listos los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, también entrega en algunas tiendas de Portoviejo y también vende por libras por su casa. Trabaja de tres a cuatro horas al día en la alimentación y cuidado de sus animalitos y casi todo el día cuando tiene que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa bien constrida.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo on the road to Manta, the community bank 'San Pedro' meets every fortnight. This group works in agriculture and raises animals.

Jenny is the founding member of the community bank and she likes the group because it has given her a lot of help to continue running her business. Jenny is 40 years of age, married and has four children with her husband, a driver, two of whom are now adults. The other two children are 12 and 7 years old and go to school. Three of her children live with her. 

Jenny raises poultry and runs a small chicken farm. She tells us that she buys between one hundred and two hundred chickens seasonally, which she raises for two to three months until they are ready to sell. When they are ready she delivers them to merchants who come to purchase the chickens from her home. She also delivers the chickens to stores in Portoviejo and sells them by the pound in her neighbourhood. She spends three to four hours every day feeding and caring for her animals and then almost the whole day when she has to deliver them to be sold. 

She will use this new loan to purchase chickens and feed and medicine so that they grow strong and healthy. 

Her dream is to live in a well built home.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and medicine and feed for the chickens

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
Duo Mujeres Victoriosas: Este Grupo Esta formado por dos señoras las cuales se dedican al negocio.
Aura Marina de 33 años tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica nueva y usada desde hace 7 años ella vende en su domicilio y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica nueva y usada nos cuenta que nececita capital para trabajar ya que pues en los ultimos dias a subido sus ventas y lo que tiene no le alcanza para satisfacer a sus clientes.
doña Maria santos de 46 años tiene 2 dos hijos ella se dedica a la venta y elavoracion de comales nececita su credito para la compra de material para elavoracion de los mmismos ya que por estos tiempos de invierno los materiales se ponene caros  ella nos cuenta que lleva 11 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. su sueño es poder agrandar mas su negocio y superarse un poco mas.
texts.en:
Two strong woman -- this group is made up of two women who work in their own small businesses.

Aura Marina is 33 years old, and has 4 children. She has worked selling new and used clothing from her home for 7 years. She is applying for this loan to buy clothing, because her sales have recently increased to the point where she has not been able to keep up with the demand.

Maria Santos is 46 years old, and she has 2 children. She makes tortillas for a living, and she needs this loan to buy materials to make them because during the winter, the ingredients and materials become expensive. She has worked making tortillas for 11 years. Her dream is to grow her business and improve herself a little more.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing and materials to make tortillas.

loans.name: Sharavnyambuu

texts.en:
Sharavnyambuu is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house in Govi-Altai province in Mongolia. His son is a student and his wife helps with the family business. 

Sharavnyambuu runs an auto parts trading business at a local market. He started his business with a working capital of 200,000 MNT in 2002.  In the winter, he also operates a meat trading business in order to supplement his earnings.  Sharavnyambuu is planning to plant trees this coming summer.  He now owns 1 hectare of land where he will plant 2500 trees.  He is a hardworking man who is planning to buy a car with his earnings. 

Sharavnyambuu is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase seeds for his business.

loans.use: purchase seeds

loans.name: Urandari

texts.en:
Urandari is 27 years old, married, and has one child, who attends school.  They live in a small house in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. Her husband is a taxi driver. Urandari’s mother, who lives with them, is retired.

Urandari supports her family by operating a retail stall at the local accessories shop. She sells clothes and accessories at a low price so demand for her products is high. She is planning to expand her business so that she can rehabilitate her own small house.

With this loan of 3,000,000 MNT, Urandari will purchase more clothes and accessories from Ereen City, China. She wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He also goes around using his bicycle, selling retail goods around town.  He is 42 years old, married to Jane and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of KES. 40,000 well and in good time.  He used the previous loan to add stock to his shop.  He plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell.

In the future, Peter hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in shop

loans.name: Nhelajean

texts.en: Nhelajean is 33 years old and lives in Balok, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children. To earn a living, Nhelajean has a business selling fish. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month. Nhelajean has requested a loan of 5000 to repair her motorcycle used for the selling fish. Nhelajean has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Nhelajean would like to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle used for selling fish

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De San Miguel Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Estrellitas de San Miguel. Está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla, en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Felipa es la presidente del grupo, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estudió hasta la secundaria, se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos, tiene 3 hijos.  Ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, inició hace 1 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar cremas, maquillaje y fragancias. Sus clientes son conocidos en su comunidad y comentan que les gusta comprar con ella porque da buenos precios y siempre entrega los pedidos a tiempo además de que los pagos son flexibles. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas de sobresalir. También espera con este préstamo obtener mejores ganancias y así obtener más clientes para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
This group, called "Estrellitas de San Miguel", is located in the state of Puebla, Mexico and has 9 members. Felipa, 43, is the president of the group. She attended high school and now sells cosmetics. She has 3 children. 

For a year now she has been selling cosmetics from catalogs. She asks for the loan to buy creams, makeups and fragrances. Her customers are known in her community and they comment that they like to buy from her because she gives them good prices and always gets their orders to them on time. She also offers flexible payment plans. 

With this loan request she feels really excited and has a lot of will to overcome her circumstances. She also hopes that with this loan she will bring in more profits and get more clients so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, makeup and fragrances.

loans.name: Jamilya's Group

texts.en:
Jamilya is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married to an electrician. Together with her husband she brings up two sons and two daughters. The sons study at school and the daughters are not in school yet as they are preschool age (under seven). At the moment Jamilya is on maternity leave. She looks after her daughters. In order to earn additional money to meet the family's needs, Jamilya and her husband breed livestock. They started this activity eight years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 soms. Reselling livestock at a higher price after fattening, they earn an additional 2,000 soms per month. Jamilya has applied for this loan because she needs additional money to purchase a washing machine in order to improve their living conditions. In the future she wishes to purchase a vehicle for the family. Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.en:
For the past 21 years, Abdujabbor has worked in agriculture raising animals.  He raises cattle which he cares for greatly since, thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses.  Abdujabbor's cattle have been vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock. Abdujabbor, is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that in the future he can earn more money. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Genny Marlene

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Genny, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, de 21, 19, 14 y 11 años de edad, uno de los mayores estudia en universidad y los menores en  colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual tiene un taxi que es el sustento de toda la familia, su esposo trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 en la ciudad de Manta, nos cuenta que el lleva con esa profesión más de 18 años y que gracias a Dios nunca ha tenido ningún contratiempo  a pesar de que la profesión del taxista es muy peligrosa.

Este crédito lo van a emplear en comprar tres llantas y repuestos para arreglar el taxi. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por tres años y le gusta porque con los créditos han podido mantener el taxi en buen estado.
 
Sus sueños son comprar otro carro más nuevo.
texts.en: The Montecristi Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-Columbian culture and for its craft-work recognized on a national and international level. The village is famous for its straw hats. It is here we find Genny. She is 40 year old, married and has four children, ages 21, 19, 14 and 11. One of the older ones attends a university, while the younger ones are in school. Her husband is a taxi driver. Genny is requesting the loan for her husband's taxi, which is the sustenance for the entire family. Her husband works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. in the city of Manta. She says he has been in the profession for more than 18 years and thanks to God has never had any problems even though being a cab driver is very dangerous. They plan to use the loan to purchase three tires and spare parts to fix the taxi. Genny has been with the community bank for three years and enjoys it because the loans have helped her and her husband keep the taxi in good shape. Their dream is to buy another, newer car.

loans.use: to purchase three tires and spare parts for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Sosik

texts.ru:
Сосик родился в 1961 г. в городе Капане, где окончил восемь классов средней школы. После чего он поступил в профтехучилище, где получил специальность маляра. 
Сосик женат, двое его сыновей и дочь живут отдельно со своими семьями. 
Сосик работает по на найму на одной из частных ферм и, параллельно, занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью в деревне Вардаванк Сьюникского района. 
Жена помогает ему на их ферме и благодаря совместным усилиям они разводят крупный рогатый скот, кур, овец, а также выращивают овощи и фрукты. 
Сосик реализует говядину, баранину, курятину, молоко, яйца, овечью шерсть, овощи и фрукты своим постоянным клиентам в городе Капане. Часть полученной сельскохозяйственной продукции приобретают скупщики с Капанского городского рынка. 
Сосик получает кредит от Kiva во второй раз и сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для покупки трех коров.
texts.en: Sosik was born in 1961 in the town of Kapan, where he completed eight years of secondary schooling.  After that, he went to a professional technical college and obtained a specialty of a painter.  Sosik is married, and two of his children lives separately with their own families.  Sosik is employed at one of the private farms and, parallel to that, is involved in an agricultural business in the Vardavank village in the Syunik district.  His wife helps him with the farm work, and, thanks to their joint effort, they breed cattle, chickens, sheep and also grow vegetables and fruits.  Sosik sells beef, lamb, chickens, milk, lamb woof, vegetables and fruits to his loyal customers in the town of Kapan.  Distributors from the Kapan city market buy part of his agricultural products.  Sosik is requesting a loan from Kiva for the second time and now needs a loan in the sum of 1 000 000 dram for the purchase of three cows.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio tiene 36 años, el se destaca por ser un hombre con muchas responsabilidades que cumplir, por ello se despierta desde muy temprano para empezar a comprar sus productos. Dicho negocio funciona desde hace 19 años, y desde entonces se dedica a ello,  los platillos que ofrece son deliciosos y los disfruta. Su puesto de ventas se sitúa en un lugar muy concurrido por su clienta. Este crédito ser realizara con el fin de comprar granos básicos, bolsas, platos desechable, verduras, frutas, carnes y pollos.
texts.en: Silvio is 36 years old. He stands out as a man with a lot of responsibilities. That is why he gets up very early to start to buy his products. He has had his business for 19 years. The dishes he offers are delicious and he enjoys them. His point of sales is located in a place frequented by a lot of customers. This loan will be taken out in order to buy basic grains, bags, disposable plates, vegetables, fruit, meat and chicken.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, disposable plates, vegetables, fruit, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Kihuura Kwetegekera Group

texts.en: Karoli is 70 years old and married with four children. He has dependents who live with him in his house in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been in commercial farming for over 30 years and this helps him maintain his extended family. He faces the challenge of debtors who have a tendency of defaulting. His dream is to venture into mechanized farming. Karoli needs a loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 26 años y vive en la aldea de Cofradía. Es casado y tiene dos hijos con su esposa Alba. La niña tiene 5 años de edad y ya asiste a la escuela. El niño tiene 3 años de edad. 

Don Jorge alquila un local en Cofradía donde tiene una tienda de joyería y relojería. Aprendió el oficio junto a su madre, con la cual había trabajo por 10 años. Hace 2 años se puso su propio local. Tenía el deseo de contar con un negocio propio y de aumentar sus ingresos. Trabaja en la tienda junto con su esposa. En el local, Jorge vende y compra joyas y relojes y, repara relojes y alajas. La reparación se consiste en cambiar baterías y brazaletes.

Jorge va a utilizar este préstamo de L20,000 para expandir sus servicios y ofrecer el empeño de objetos de oro y plata. Don Jorge también pretende aumentar su inventario de joyas y relojes. Su meta propia es  poner varias tiendas en la área para poder dar su familia un mejor futuro económico.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 26, lives in the village of Cofradía.  He is married to Alba, and he has two children.  His daughter is five years old, and she goes to school.  His son is three years old.

Jorge rents a place in Cofradía where he has a jewelry and watch store.  He learned this trade together with his mother, with whom he worked for ten years.  Two years ago he established his own place.  He had the wish to have his own place and to increase his income.  He works with his wife in the store.

In his place he buys and sells jewelry and watches, and he repairs watches and jewelry.  The repairs consist of changing batteries and watchbands.

Jorge will use the loan of 20,000 lempiras to expand his services and to offer to pawn gold and silver objects.

His goal is to set up various stores in the area in order to be able to give his family a better financial future.

loans.use: to expand his services and to start to pawn gold and silver objects.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mariam from Fullahtown. She is married with five children between the ages of two and 25.  Three children attend school. 

Mariam runs a provision shop and sells milk, sugar and Ovaltine.  Mariam has been in business for three years and her shop is her only source of income.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Mariam has requested a loan to buy more provisions to resell.  The extra income will allow her to improve her standard of living.  

In the future, she plans to open a mini supermarket.  She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more provision items such as milk, sugar, and Ovaltine.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 48 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 24 years old. Felicitas' husband is a farmer.

Felicitas has been in the business of raising pigs for 20 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins. Felicitas also helps her husband grow rice on their land.  Felicitas hopes to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto is 28 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 9, both of whom are presently in school. 

For the past ten years she has been selling cookies in the local market. She enjoys her business a lot because she has a lot of customers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, flour, sugar, and butter for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, flour, sugar, and butter for her business.

loans.name: Florephis

texts.en:
Florephis is 36 years old and married with two children.

Florephis works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Florephis has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns extra income from raising pigs.

Florephis aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, de 56 años, es una mujer buena y muy amable, esta casada y con Eduardo de 67 años, han sido compañeros por mucho tiempo y esperan continuar juntos para así poder tener una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Dolores consiste en la venta de comida de todo tipo ya que posee un gran don, el de tener manos mágicas ya que posee una de las mejores sazones de la ciudad, su restaurante es uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad de Pucallpa, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy buena y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina. Aún recuerda cuando se inicio y empezó con su gran sueño de tener su propio restaurante. Al principio le fue complicado ya que tenía que ganar terreno en un gran mercado, pero con el tiempo lo logró. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola. Para más adelante, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante, además comprar más menajes. Este será el crédito número 6 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo una socia buena y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si.
Con los 700 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para cocinar, ya que la demanda por su comida ha aumentado, además de comprar platos, tenedores y cuchillos.
texts.en:
Dolores, 56, is a good, kind woman married to Eduardo, 67.  They have been companions for a long time and expect to continue together into a tranquil old age.  

Dolores’ work consists in selling all types of food because she has a great gift: magic hands since she makes some of the city’s tastiest food.  Her restaurant is one of the most popular in the city of Pucallpa.  Every day her customers meet in her restaurant to enjoy the delicious menus she prepares.  She is a very good cook and she’s loved cooking since she was a little girl.  She still remembers when she started out with her great dream of having a restaurant.
