At the beginning it was complicated because she had to win over a market share in this very large market.  But in time, she managed to do so.

What she enjoys the most about her work is cooking which she does with much dedication.  She’s been in business 20 years and considers the most difficult part having to tend to all the people who come to the restaurant because often she has to work by herself.  For later on, she’d like to improve her restaurant’s infrastructure as well as to buy more furnishings.

This will be MFP loan #6.  She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support to continue increasing her working capital.  In addition, she’s convinced that she will continue to be a good member who is responsible with her previous loans.  She likes belonging to the communal bank she works in because they are all responsible and very mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 700 new soles to buy ingredients to cook since demand for her meals has increased.  She will also buy plates, forks and knives.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her kitchen.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: Don Jose, de 45 años quien habita en la ciudad de Granada , de oficio comerciante , se dedica  a la venta de queso al detalle actividad que realiza de manera ambulante desde hace dos años. El vende a las pulperías, casas tocando puerta a puerta para ofrecer sus quesos frescos y sabrosa crema de leche aunque la lucha ha sido dura ha sido un guerrero incansable en su caminar para salir adelante con su negocio todo sacrificio para que a su familia no le falte nada y puedan vivir mejor. El requiere un segundo crédito para compra de queso y crema. Este es su segundo crédito pues el primero fue muy positivo para su negocio ya que logro mejorar sus ventas y espera que este segundo le vaya aun mejor.
texts.en: Don Jose, age 45, lives in the city of Granada. He is a merchant and sells cheese door-to-door; he has been doing this for two years. He sells his fresh cheese and flavourful cream to grocery stores and homes. Times have been tough but he has worked without tiring in order to get ahead with his business. He has made many sacrifices so that his family will not lack for anything and will have a better quality of life. He needs a second loan for the purchase of cheese and cream. This is his second loan; the first was very good for his business because he was able to improve his sales. He hopes that this second loan goes even better.

loans.use: to buy cheese and cream.

loans.name: Sembrando Group

texts.es:
La mayoría de los socios del banco comunal “Sembrando” siguen participando y les va muy porque son personas responsables con los pagos de las cuotas. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el segundo ciclo de funcionamiento (cada ciclo está conformado por cuatro meses). El banco comunal está conformado por nueve personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

La socia Junia nació en la distrito de Pomacanchis provincia de Acomayo departamento del Cusco y tiene 46 años edad, ella tiene un hijo de 19 años que está estudiando en un instituto superior, ella es profesora de educación especial en el programa ECEBE de la ciudad del Cusco, ella también pertenece al equipo de trabajo SAANEE (Servicio de Atención a la Diversidad a las Necesidades Educativas Especiales.).   
 
La socia nos cuenta que desde los 5 años hasta los 27 años edad vivió en la ciudad de Lima y donde estudió en una de las universidad más prestigiosas de la ciudad de Lima pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Ya son varios años que se dedica al trabajo y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone a sus funciones, ella requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para la educación de su hijo.   

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido. (En la parte inferior de la fotografía aparece la socia que llego tarde a la reunión).
texts.en:
Most of the members of “Sembrando” Communal Bank are still participating in the program and they are doing well because they're responsible with their payments. The Communal Bank is currently on its second cycle (each cycle lasting 4 months) and is comprised of nine hardworking people with a marked entrepreneurial spirit who tirelessly seek ways to move forward and give their children a better future. Most of the members live in the city, where they also have their livelihoods. Cusco is widely known as a city for tourism and trade, hosting the traditional Inti Raymi festivity and one of the seven wonders of the world, “Machupicchu”. 

Our featured member, Junia, was born in Pomacanchis District, in the Acomayo Province of the Departament of Cusco. She is 46 and has a 19-year-old son that attends a technical school. She works as a teacher for children with special needs as part of the ECEBE Program in Cusco City and also belongs to SAANEE's working group (SAANEE stands in Spanish for the Service for Bringing Diversity to Special Educational Needs).
 
She says she lived in Lima from age 5 to 27, where she studied in one of the most prestigious local universities but she now lives in Cusco. She has been working in her field for several years and has done well thanks to her dedication. She is asking for this loan for personal use, i.e., providing education to her son.  

All members appreciate the loan and are thankful for the opportunity given and promise to make their payments on time, according to schedule. (The lower right end of the main picture shows the member that arrived late to the meeting).

loans.use: to educate her son

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Financial constraints alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her 5 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged our Naheed  to start her business selling animals by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.  Naheed  is 49 years old.  She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a Murabaha loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales

loans.name: Juan Crisostomo

texts.en:
Hello my name is Juan Crisostomo, I have a small family business that manufactures items made from reed-grass, such as: lamps, baskets, rugs, picture-frames and others. I have several years experience in this trade, which creates income enough to cover family expenses. I also have the help of my son and my wife in the business. Now I need more investment as the \"coffee season\" is approaching and I have a high demand during this time and I do not have enough capital to satisfy my clientel.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi Nombre es Juan Crisostomo, cuento con una micro empresa familiar de manufactura del Carrrizo tales como: Lamparas, canastas alfombras, cuadros y otros, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, tambien cuento con la colaboración de mis hijo y mi esposa este negocio. actualmete necesito mayor inversión ya que se aproxima la temporda de cafe y tengo mucha demanda para esta temporada y no cuento con el capital para poder satisfacer la clientela.

loans.use: Buy reed-grass.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Mr. Willy G. and his wife, Mrs. Martha Elena Mamani Ramos, work manufacturing metal frames and moldings for furniture. They later sell their products to artesan carpenters. Their workshop is located in their home in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz. They are both 35 years old. They have one son, and have worked in this business for 10 years.

This is the fourth time that they have come to Impro to apply for a loan with which to buy tools and improve their earnings. Their history in the institution classifies them as "Client 1", since they have been punctual making their monthly payments. They have also shown advances in the manufacture of their products. The loan for which they have applied will be used to buy iron, the raw material of their work.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Willy G., junto con su esposa,la señora Martha Elena Mamani Ramos, se dedican a la elaboración de molduras y agarradores metálicos para muebles que luego venden a artesanos carpinteros. Su taller de halla ubicado en su domicilio ubicado el la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Ambos tienen 35 años, tienen una hija y trabajan en este rubro hace 10 años.

Esta es la cuarta vez que recurren a Impro para obtener un crédito y con los que compraron herramientas y mejoraron sus ingresos. Su historial el nuestra institución los clasifica como clientes 1 al ser puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales y mostrar avances en la elaboración de sus productos. El monto solicitado estará destinado a la compra de fierro que se constituye en la materia prima de su actividad.

Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios en nuestra institución le permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Rain has light to my business and Family sayd Mrs. Christian O.. A 35 years old, a trader, and married with four children. She joined LAPO in 2000. She provides the community with food for a large number of people in the urban centre in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She is a dynamic leader in one of LAPO's groups of beneficaries. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of garri.

loans.use: To buy bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Chien

texts.en: Mrs. Chien is 47 years old and her husband is 9 years older. They have 3 children who are laborers and are between 16 and 29 years old. She catches fish daily on a small canal. She can’t expand her activity as she doesn't have a boat. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to purchase a small boat. At the moment, their family income is $7 per person/month. Mrs. Chien will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To purchase a small boat in order to catch fish in a canal

loans.name: Rosemy Liliana

texts.es:
My name is Liliana and I started my own grocery shop business three years ago. I run it from my home. My best clients are my neighbors who come to my shop on a daily basis to buy the groceries they need. My best advantage is that there is no other grocery shop close to mine and is convenient for my neighbors because I provide a fast and cordial service.

My children help me in the business when they have some time. The more people we serve, the more we sell and our income improves. Right now, I need to provide a better variety of products and I also need to introduce new ones to my customers. That way I can grow the business and increase and improve the income of my family

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Me llamo Liliana y tengo tres años de tener mi negocio propio en mi casa de habitacion, mis mejores clientes son mis vecinos quienes a diario llegan a comprar lo que necesitan. Mi mayor ventaja es que cerca de mi negocio no existe otro y por la comodidad de mis vecinos les atiendo rapida y cordialmente.

Mis hijos me ayudan cuando tienen tiempo y entre mas atendemos mayor vendemos y nuestros ingresos mejoran. Ahorita necesito surtir el producto y meter nuevo para hacer crecer mi negocio y mejorar los ingresos de mi familia.

loans.use: Buying eggs, breads, soaps, laundry detergents, sausages, beans, rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a photocopying machine and more stock.

loans.name: Siri

texts.en:
Amidst a flutter of feathers, Mama Shafii feeds her brood -- but her name refers to her 6 year-old son Shafii, not one of the birds she is feeding. She raises chickens for sale and requires a loan of $625 to purchase more chicks. Mama Shafii is 27 years-old and married to Shafii’s father Mohamedi.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Buguju C (Iv) Group

texts.en:
Esther has a small retail shop. She intends to use the extra profits from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock in the retail shop

loans.name: Usubali

texts.en: Usubali is a 52-year-old widower with three children. He is a farmer. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 2001, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The income from this business is not enough to cover all the family and business expenditures. Usubali purchases calves, breeds them, and sells them to the butcher, who works in the local market. To increase his profit margin, Usubali has to invest some money to make his small herd bigger. His application to Normicro Saatli branch for a $500 loan is approved already.  He hopes eventually to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Borka

texts.en: Borka  was born  in 1951 and lives in  the town Pale with her husband. He is a pensioner.  His monthly pension is 400 KM. This is her second loan from MCO WWI, this one in the amount of $950 and she will use it for buying additional inventory.  She sells clothes at the market. By selling clothes, Borka wants to improve her  monthly income.  She wants to  secure money for her son's school fees.

loans.use: Buying more clothes.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Mrs. Genara A. is 58 years old and she has been married to an argentine citizen, Ernesto Veron, for over 30 years. They have lived in their own house in Barrio Pacu Cua for a long time and the only have one 24 year-old daughter who is about to graduate from a private law school in their country.

The credit applicant owns a convenience store that is situated in her home and has been open for over 22 years. Her husband helps her run the store that has accumulated a large amount of loyal customers throughout the years.

Mrs. Genara and her husband's dream is that their daughter graduates from college - this is her last and final year. They hope she will become an excellent professional and form her own family.

The credit requested is for the purchase of school material such as, notebooks, pencils, erasers, books and other items that were offered to her and that would allow her to yield a good profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Genara Ávalos de 58 años de edad está hace mas de 30 años con el señor Ernesto Veron de nacionalidad Argentina, viven en casa propia en el Barrio Pacu Cua hace mucho tiempo y tiene una sola hija de 24 años que esta estudiando y culminando la Carrera de Derecho en una universidad privada del país.

La cliente es propietaria de una despensa y mercería que esta ubicado en su propio domicilio particular que funciona hace mas de 22 años y que es atendida por ella su marido, cuenta con buena clientela formada que trabajan con ello hace años.

El sueño de Genara y su marido es lograr que su hija culmine sus estudios ya que este es el último año de la carrera la que está cursando, esperan que sea una excelente profesional y forme su propia familia.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de artículos escolares como cuadernos, lápices, borradores, libros entre otras cosas que le han ofrecido a un buen precio y que le permitirá tener un buen margen de ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of school material such as, notebooks, pencils, erasers, books and others.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Thanks to her long experience in the business, Claudia has become one of the best merchants in her district. Since a very young age, she has worked in multiple employments in order to support her household.

As she now runs a small shop, her life has improved. That is why she would like to move ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Los años de experiencia a Claudia, le sirvieron para convertirse en una de las mejores comerciantes de su zona. Desde muy joven ella se ha acostumbrado a realizar múltiples trabajos para poder sobrellevar las riendas de su hogar.

Ahora que posee una pequeña tiendita las cosas en su casita han mejorado y desea continuar con esta su noble labor.

loans.use: To increase the offer of products

loans.name: Bilda

texts.es:
Bilda is a happy and hard-working woman and due to her performance as a farmer she has had the opportunity to travel abroad and publicize and gain recognition for Peruvian agricultural products on behalf of her community.

She produces citrus fruits, bananas, and coffee beans, which she sells in the Capital. Due to her willingness to transport her produce, she has succeeded in attracting customers in the surrounding towns in addition to her local area.

Now, by investing a large sum of money, she plans to increase her sales of coffee beans further, her most profitable product, by improving the quality of the beans.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

BILDA, es una dama muy jovial y muy trabajadora gracias a sus actividades y desempeño como agricultora tuvo la oportunidad de viajar al exterior en representación de su comunidad y dar a conocer los productos que producimos en el Perú.Ella posee terrenos de producción de cítricos, plátanos y café los cuales comercializa en la capital y gracias a su movilidad puede trasladarse a captar compradores en su localidad además de trasladar algunos de sus productos por las ciudades más cercanas. Y ahora no solo va captando clientela sino que desea también captar su interés para mejorar su producción de café que es el producto más rentable en el mercado y para su siembra y cosecha se invierte grandes sumas de dinero.

loans.use: Capital investment for the production of coffee beans

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina T. is a 35-year-old woman and a resident of Bijeswori. Bijeswori is located within the Kathmandu valley. Most of the people in this location are involved in business professions. She has five members of her family including herself. She has three daughters who are studying in grades 10, 9 and 7 respectively. And her son is studying in grade 2.
Mrs. T. has been in the handicraft profession for 2 years. She sells different types of bangles and key rings in her shop. The additional things like thread, stone, beads of chandan, key rings of mobile sets etc. are needed, and she requires many other things to display in her shop, so she is requesting her first loan of Rs 15,000 (US$225). She spends her income in fulfilling the household requirements of her family.

loans.use: To buy things for her shop

loans.name: Ruqaiya

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is the wife of M. Ashraf, and she has been living in the city of Riwind, Pakistan for the last 7 years. She owns a two-room, brick house. Additionally, she is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons work in a cotton factory; her elder daughter sews clothes; and her younger daughter is a teacher in a local school. Her husband, meanwhile, is a watchman at a factory.

Ruqaiya baji has a milk business, and she has been selling milk for the last 20 years. Notably, she successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is seeking another loan in order to buy a buffalo to expand her milk business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her milk-selling business by purchasing a buffalo

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vững là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997.  Từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay anh chị đều vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi  vì thế từ mô hình chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ đến nay qua hơn 10 năm gia đình chị đã có hệ thồng chuồng trại khá quy mô với hơn 200 con vịt. lợn. Ngoài làm chăn nuôi và trồng trọt, tranh thủ  thời gian  nhàn rỗi vợ chồng chị Vững  còn đi thu mua phê liệu về bán lại cho các đại lý.  Vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn ổn định ở mức 3 đến 4 triệu đồng/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới anh chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để  mua thức ăn phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi vịt.
texts.en:
Note: the original description was in English

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Islomuddin

texts.ru: Шералиев Исломуддин житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 56 лет, женат,имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее,по специальности учитель.Но специальности не работает.Клиент  занимается куплей продажей сладостей,соков . Имеет опыт в бизнесе 14 лет. На доход от торговли содержит свою семью.На кредит Исломуддин хочет закупить больше товара,увеличить ассортимент точки.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Islomuddin S. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 56 years old, married and has four children. He has high education, his profession is a teacher, but he does not work by his profession. He is in the business of selling sweets and juices. He has around fourteen years of experience in this business. He uses the profits to support his family. Islomuddin wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise and increase the variety of his offered goods. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy T. and her husband, Mr. Tuy Ty, residents of Rolos Village in Takeo Province, are farmers who own a small piece of land upon which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Unfortunately, their field is currently infertile, so Thy is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to make the field more productive.

Thy is 49 years old and the mother of two children, one a farmer and the other a student at the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el Mercado Central, la señora Silvia S. se dedica al negocio de panadería donde fabrica todo tipo de pan para ofrecerlo a sus clientes. 

La señora Silvia es madre de dos hijos con el deber de mantener y de brindarle todas las condiciones para su desarrollo. Es por esta razón que se ha esforzado grandemente en la elaboración de pan, galletas, picos, pudines y manjares para ofrecerlo a  sus clientes. 

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual espera en Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito solicitado para la compra de los insumos o materia prima para preparar el pan. Su record crediticio es de 8 créditos anteriores cancelados satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the Central Market, Mrs. Silvia S. has a bakery where she makes all types of bread to offer to her clients.

Silvia is the mother of two children, with the task of taking care of them and providing them with the conditions for their development. It is for this reason that she has worked so hard in making bread, cookies, snacks, puddings, and delicacies to offer to her clients.

Nowadays her motivation for which she looks to Ceprodel is to obtain the loan requested to purchase the ingredients or raw materials for making bread. Her credit record shows 8 previous loans paid off satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Jan Baz

texts.en:
Jan Baz lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. His house is near the high schools. He is single and 39 years old. He has worked in the Afghanistan national bank for many years. He is engaged and in the next few weeks he wants to get married and he needs money.

He requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to use for his wedding party and begin his life with his wife and make a better future. He would like to say, "I am working in a bank but until now I haven't such a great program in Afghanistan."

He would like to thank lenders around the world who help those who need money in this poor country. He wants to continue his partnership with Kiva and AFSG.

loans.use: Use this loan for his wedding party

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel es casada, de 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos: uno de 4 meses y otro de 8 años de edad en 4to grado, trabaja para la zona rural como directora con 4 años de servicio, sale a las 6:00 a.m. y regresa a las 6:30 p.m., sus niños son cuidados por una hermana, su esposo se fue a Costa Rica en busca de mejores horizontes, está trabajando y le envia 70 dólares mensuales para hacerle frente a la dificil situacion economica que se esta enfrentando, esta solicitando su 2do credito y lo utilizara para repellar su dormitorio, acondicionar el baño y poner la puerta de su dormitorio, si el prestamo no es suficiente, con lo que su esposo le envia quiezas pueda teminar la obra que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel is married, 28 years old, and has two children: one four months old and the other eight months old in fourth grade. She works for the rural zone as a director with four years of service, she leaves at 6 a.m. and returns at 6:30 p.m. Her children are cared for by a sister, her husband went to Costa Rica in search of better horizons, and is working and sends her 70 dollars monthly to make her move forward with the difficult economic situation she is facing. She is asking for her second loan and she will use it to repair her bedroom, condition the bedroom and put a door on her bedroom, if the loan is not sufficient, with what her husband sends her she may be able to finish the work she has proposed.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Mildred Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mildred tiene la edad de 46 años, reside en Hialeah II etapa, con dos hijos de 18 y20 años de edad,  su esposo es contratista en la construcción, el negocio de la Sra. Mildred es la venta de fresco, y bebidas pues  tiene diez años de vender variedad de alimentos, es una pequeña pulpería, y también vende productos de cosméticos, que inicio con ahorro propios, con esta solicitud  es la séptima que hace en Afodenic, que va invertir en comprar granos básicos y otros producto que son de consumo del cliente para sastifacer las necesidades. Sus planes es  poder remodelar su casa, comercializar otros productos que generen buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Mildred is 46 years old and lives in Hialeah with two sons, 18 and 20 years old. Her husband is a construction contractor. Ms. Mildred's business of 10 years is the sale of soft drinks and other beverages and a variety of foods in her small store. She also sells cosmetics products which she got started in with her own savings. With this loan request, her seventh with Afodenic, she will invest in buying basic grains and other products which are for consumption by her clients to satisfy their needs. Her plans are to remodel her home and market other products that generate a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and products for daily consumption for her store

loans.name: Debora's Group

texts.en:
Debora has owned a small food vendor store in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $215. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, get more food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

Debora is married and has four children between the ages of 11 and 17. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Angelina, who also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Набиев Ахмад житель города Вахдат. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается животноводством. Покупает и продает животных. Скупает на одном рынке а продает на другом. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ahmad N. lives in Vahdat. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. He is involved in animal husbandry. He buys and sells livestock. He buys livestock at one market and resells at another. Ahmad plans to obtain this loan to increase his livestock headcount. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Fatuma H.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Fatuma S. from Kyela. She is a 35-year-old mother of with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 17. Additionally, she supports one dependant who is an orphan.
 
Fatuma has been purchasing rice wholesale and reselling it retail since 1999.  She works for 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week. Fatuma currently earns about $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 in order to purchase rice in bulk for her business. Fatuma thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets.  Because of this, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the leased equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: 51-year-old Paulina E. is from Jimenez,Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Her husband administers the making of metal works such as window grills, steel chairs, motorcycle cabs, and more. She received various loans from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and all these loans were repaid in a timely manner. She is a member in good standing. The loan efforts of Paglaum MPC have helped the couple send their children to school and meet their daily necessities. The couple is truly thankful to Paglaum MPC for keeping them company in all their financial needs. What they focus on is taking care of their existing business and in marketing.

loans.use: additional capital for metal shop.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope sells provisions to make a living. She is 39 years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of 140,000 nairas to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma P. is from the town of Opol in Misamis Oriental, Philippines. She is 43 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma buys and sells fish. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase an additional fishing net. This will be Wilma's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to educate her children and support her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Mrs. Silveria is 47 years old and works making children’s clothes.  She has her own store and tailor's shop in the back of her house.  When she was younger she worked in Argentina, where she learned the profession.  She then came to open her own business in her country.  

She thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the capital they have helped her obtain.  One of her dreams is to have her own brand of children's clothing.

loans.use: The purchase of corduroy fabric

loans.name: 007-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en: Yên H. Thị (12) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Yên is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 007-Quảng Hưng (18.02.007). Yên is married and has three adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a months. In 2004, Yên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Yên is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 9th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị Xoan (55) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 2. Lê thị Tiêu (41) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business. 3. Lê thị Nhắn (36) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business. 4. Vũ Thị Năm (9) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Yên H. Thị (12) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Yên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 007-Quảng hưng (18.02.007). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Yên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Yên kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2004, Yên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Yên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Xoan (55) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Lê thị Tiêu (41) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 3. Lê thị Nhắn (36) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 4. Vũ Thị Năm (9) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en:
Mimi M. is from the village of Masahod. She is 19, is separated from her husband, and has one infant. Mimi operates a clothing business; her main source of income comes from buying and selling clothes in the local community. Mimi has been engaged in her business for 1 year and earns approximately Php2,400.00 a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Mimi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mimi is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which she will invest in expanding her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Mimi from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lyngiene

texts.en:
Lyngiene C. runs a food stall selling cooked food and viands in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has school-age children. She is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. Lyngiene has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lyngiene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lyngiene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon K. is from the village of Gingoog, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ice candy and fruit salad in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Corazon joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Tsendbazar

texts.en:
Tsendbazar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter currently attends university and his younger two sons are high school students.

Tsendbazar operates a small café in his town with the help of his wife. The two rent space in a building where they produce quality meals for their customers. Tsendbazar started his café in 2007 with capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~150 USD). Due to his hard work, he has found success in a short time and, today, his working capital exceeds 600,000 tugrugs (~450 USD).

For the future, Tsendbazar hopes to move from his rented space and own his own café. He needs to expand so that he can better serve all of his customers. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan in order to buy more materials and produce in order to cook satisfying meals for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for his café

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia manages a retail store for almost three years.  Aside from selling , she also sells cooked food during lunch time. Her daily net income is PHP300.00.  With her dream to expand her retail store her mini-eatery, she is now requesting to avail a loan of PHP15,000.00 that she can use to pursue her plans.  

She is married to Carlito, a farmer.  They have two children: Janine Frances- 17 years old, 1st year college student and Jessica- 15 years old, fourth year high school student. They are harmoniously residing at baranggay Sillawit, Cauayan City.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is fifty-four years old. She is a wife and the mother of five children.

Charity is a food vendor who sells gari, beans and fried plantain, which is popularly known as ‘red red.’ It is one of the popular local meals enjoyed by many Ghanaians, especially students, because of its affordability. It is very tasty and satisfying, and very nutritious too because of the protein content from the beans.

Charity wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of gari, beans, bunches of plantains, and palm oil to increase her production and make a good income to support her children's education. She will be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs in bulk

loans.name: Alioune Badara

texts.fr: M. N. est un commerçant de tissus à Grand Yoff, Dakar.  Il voudrait une crédit court-terme pour financer son activité de vente de tissus pour la veille de la fête de Tabaski.  La Tabaski est une célébration pour commémorer le sacrifice du fils d' Abraham, et marque la fin du Hadji, le pèlerinage à Mecque.  Au Sénégal, La Tabaski est une célébration très importante, donc tout le monde doit être bien habiller.  Avec le crédit de 100.000 CFCA, M. N. voudrait acheter des tissus pour répondre à cette demande élevé. Il est marié et le père d'un enfant.
texts.en:
Mr. N. sells fabric in Grand Yoff, Dakar. He would like a short term loan in order to finance his fabric retail business on the eve of the Tabaski festival. Tabaski is a celebration to commemorate the sacrifice of Abraham's son, and it marks the end of the Hajj - the pilgrimage to Mecca.

In Senegal, Tabaski is a very important celebration, thus everyone should be well dressed. With the loan of 100,000 CFCA, Mr. N. would like to buy fabric in order to meet the rising demand. He is married and the father of one child.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen his stock of fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase corn and beans

loans.name: María Elisa

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, específicamente en el mercado La Terminal, la señora María Elisa L. se dedica a laborar en su establecimiento de venta de güirilas y elotes ofreciéndolos diariamente en su establecimiento a partir de las cuatro de la mañana hasta el atardecer.
Es de importancia destacar que ella ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio con mucho ahínco y la razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para comrprar el maíz para hacer las güirilas y a la vez vender los elotes. También lo invertirá para la compra de frutas como manzanas, uvas y bananos para continuar ofertándolos en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the area of Leon, specifically in the Terminal Market, Maria Elisa L. works selling local snacks known as guirilas and elotes (roasted corn and tortillas). Maria runs her small stand in the market from 4 in the morning until evening. It's important to highlight that she has managed to grow her business with a lot of hard work. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy the corn she needs to make the snacks. She would also like to purchase fruit, such as apples, grapes and bananas to sell from her stand as well.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn for the local snacks she makes and sells, as well as various fruit to offer her customers.

loans.name: Olivia Del Socorro

texts.en: Olivia has a clothing sales business that she runs out of her house. She also sells her items by peddling. She will use this loan to buy merchandise like clothing, shoes, cosmetics, perfumes and other items that her customers request. Her aspirations are to continue to increase her business and to make it more like a store. Olivia’s husband works as a distiller in a local liquor factory and they have two children. Their children’s ages are eight and four and both are in school, although the four year old is only in preschool. Olivia has had her business for eleven years and has maintained an excellent credit history with Fundación León 2000.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. H.” y son 20 socios. Ellos viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa. El socio Eusebio es el presidente del banco comunal y da unos saludos por navidad y año nuevo a sus compañeros y a los inversionistas D. kiva.  

Algunos D. nuestros socios tienen unos pequeños negocios como por ejemplo: Yeni, Erika, Yanet, Magali, Giovanna, Sandro,  Edgard y Pilar trabajan haciendo fotocopias al frente D. la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco, Andrea y Yaneth tiene una carpintería, Wilbert es técnico electricista y también hace llamadas e impresiones,  Flora venD. cueros y Yeny es  guia D. turismo en el centro arqueológico D. Moray. 

Los socios requieren el préstamo para aumentar su capital D. negocio comprando más productos como papel, madera y muchas cosas más.  

Margarita es casada y tiene 44 años y venD. comida, su restaurante se llama “El burrito amigable”. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como carne, verduras, arroz, papas y muchas cosas más.
   
Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(En el video el presidente dice que son 21 socios pero una socia se retiro del banco comunal a ultima hora)
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Señor D. H. Communal Bank; there are 20 members. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in the Arariwa Association’s central office. Eusebio is the president of the communal bank, and he is giving Christmas and New Year’s greetings to his colleagues and the Kiva investors. Some of the members have small businesses. For example; Yeni, Erika, Yanet, Magali, Giovanna, Sandro, Edgard, and Pilar make photocopies in front of the San Antonio Abad National University of Cusco. Andrea and Yaneth have a carpentry shop. Wilbert is a technical engineer and also makes calls and recordings. Flora sells leather, and Yeny is a tour guiD. in the archeological center of Moray. The members need the loan to increase their business capital by purchasing more products like paper, wood, and many other things. Margarita is 44 and married. She sells food. “El Burrito Amigable” is the name of her restaurant. She has been in the business for ten years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to buy more supplies like meat, vegetables, rice, potatoes, and many other things. The members appreciate and value the loan, and they promise to pay it on time. (In the video the president says there are 21 members, but one member withdrew from the bank at the last minute.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products like paper, wood, and many other items

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan Manuel de 45 años de edad es soltero, tiene 2 hijos: Cristel de 15 años en 4to año de secundaria y Juan Manuel de 10 años en 4to grado de primaria, su compañera de vida Maricela, trabaja y se encarga de la casa. Don Juan trabaja desde hace 5 años para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como colector tributario. Esta solicitando su 2do credito para mejorar su vivienda, construyendo un muro de retencion en la parte trasera de la casa en donde va a comenzar a construir.  El mayor sueño de Juan Manuel es tener una vivienda bonita y comoda para sus hijos ya que es el patrimonio que puede dejarles.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel, 45, is single and has two children: Cristel, 15, who is in 10th grade and Juan Manuel, 10, who is in fourth grade. His life partner, Maricela, works and is in charge of the household. Juan has worked for the Juigalpa's mayor's office as a tax collector for the last 5 years. He is requesting his second loan to do home improvements. He wants to build a retaining wall in the rear of his house where he will begin to build. Juan Manuel's greatest wish is to have an attractive, comfortable home for his children since this is the main asset he can leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Bujakukya Group, Kampala

texts.en:
Hadija Bint A. is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is a friendly and hardworking lady who is married with three children, as she takes care of two dependents. She has a retail business selling clothes from the Cooper Complex near the Kabalagala taxi stage in the center of Kampala. She has been in business for four years and this is her first loan. Her good communication skills have enabled her to win more customers. 

A. has a dream of opening up a bigger shop so that she becomes financially successful. She needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing stock for sustainability.

loans.use: Buying more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Limbert

texts.es:
El sr. Limbert M. P., esta casado con la Sra. Sandra Corrales. tienen juntos 3 hijos de los cuales solamente uno acude a la escuela de la zona viven en su casa propia.

Los solicitantes del prestamo se dedican a la lecheria desde hace mucho tiempo, unos 11 años, tienen bastante experiencia, empezaron a trabajar con sus padres los cuales les enseñaron todo sobre el cuidado del ganado lechero, cuentan con 11 vacas lecheras.

Ahora requieren del prestamo para poder alquilar un terreno donde cultivaran alfa-alfa y chala, esto debido a que los precios de los demas insumos (soya, pepa de algodon) estan muy altos y lo que requieren ellos es minimizar sus costos para obtener mayores ingresos a mediano plazo.

Es segundo credito que solicitan a nuestra entidad, el primer credito pagaron sin retrasos.
texts.en:
Sr. Limbert M. P. is married to Sra. Sandra Corrales. They live in their own house with their three children, of whom only one attends the local school.

These loan applicants have been in the dairy business for quite some time, approximately eleven years. They have enough experience and learned the trade from their parents, who taught them everything about taking care of dairy cattle. They currently have eleven dairy cows.

Limbert and his wife are requesting a loan to rent farmland for growing alfalfa and corn because the prices of other types of feed (such as soybeans and cottonseed) are very expensive. This will help them minimize their costs so that they can earn a better income in the medium term.

Limbert is requesting his second loan from our organization. The previous loan was repaid without any delays.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent farmland for growing alfalfa & corn

loans.name: Dibor

texts.fr: Dibor S. est une femme de 57 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et a la charge d'un autre enfants qui lui a été confié. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis juillet 2007 et a de bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficier 7 fois de suite. Elle fait essentiellement l'élevage de poulets de chaire mais développe aussi un petit commerce de fournitures scolaires. Son activité lui procure des bénéfices lui permettant de s'équiper en meubles (lit et armoire) et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dibor S. is a 57-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children.  Plus, she has another child entrusted to her.  Dibor has been a member of Banc Villageois since July 2007 and has a good record as a borrower for having benefited from seven consecutive loans.  She essentially raises fryer chickens but is also developing a small business involving school supplies.  Her business brings in profits allowing her to have furniture (bed and armoire) and to take part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing her business further in raising chickens

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née en 1962, T. Julienne vit depuis 12 ans environs au quartier Sètovi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Julienne est mariée à SAGBO Jean-Paul un militaire, et a cinq enfants à sa charge. Tous les cinq enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble et le couple assure les différentes charges familiales. Julienne a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Julienne prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs et de cossette d'igname) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Julienne vend également des chaussures. Julienne se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo. Julienne avait obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de Julienne s'accroît au jour le jour et elle n'arrive plus à tous les satisfaire. C'est donc pour renforcer son capital et augmenter sa production journalière que Julienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1962, Julienne T. has lived for around 12 years in the Sètovi district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Julienne is married to Jean-Paul SAGBO, a military, and has five children in her care. All five children attend school. The family lives together and the couple covers the various family expenses. Julienne left school during secondary level. To provide for her needs and those of her children, she prepares and sells food (corn pasta and "cossette", a type of cereal made from yams) in her neighborhood. As a secondary activity Julienne also sells shoes. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market, and in Lomé in Togo. Julienne has had two loans from ALIDé and has repaid them both without incident. Her customer base is growing from day to day and she cannot satisfy them all. In order to strengthen her capital and increase her daily producttion she is thus applying for a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et de cossettes d'igname. Purchase of bags of corn and yam "cossettes".

loans.name: Carmen Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. H. A. Carmen Margarita vive en el distrito de Santiago, junto a sus dos  hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad. Trabaja como obrera de campo en el fundo Ica Pacific desde hace 2 años. Tiene casa propia la cual la esta construyendo. Solicita financiamiento para  terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. La Sra. Carmen agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tarves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Margarita H. A. lives in Santiago with her two children who are 10 and 3 years of age, respectively. She has worked as a field hand for Ica Pacific farming estate for the past two years. She is building her house and needs funds to complete it. Her dream is to provide a better quality of life for her family. Carmen is grateful for whatever support we can offer via this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en:
Mirzoali is married and has 5 children. He sells groceries. His store is located in a very busy place, which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries from Mirzoali. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything they need. Mirzoali has been running this business for 10 years. Lending services from “IMON International” have promoted the expansion of his small venture. Mirzoali’s business is the only source of income for his family. He takes this responsibility seriously and is doing his best to meet the needs of his children. Today he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fresh food items. Mirzoali will never forget the support you give to him. 
      
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase food to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Рахмонов Дилшод проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 32 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Дилшод имеет средне - специальное образование, "Механик". По специальности работал 8 лет. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. У него собственный магазин, где он продает велосипеды и запасные части. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 7 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Dilshod R. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Dilshod has a secondary-specialized education as a mechanic. He spent 8 years working in that field. Now he is involved in retail sales. Dilshod owns a store, where he sells bicycles and spare parts. He has been involved in this business for over 7 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara tiene 33 años D. edad, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo, vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayoría D. su población concentrada en un pueblo central y en varios caseríos que distan mucho uno del otro, pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Sara ha estudiado la carrera técnica D. enfermería y actualmente se vale D. sus estudios para percibir ingresos, lleva diez años trabajando en centros D. salud D. la zona rural D. su distrito. Esta labor le provee D. ingresos estables con los cuales ayuda a su esposo en el sostenimiento D. su hogar. 

Adicionalmente se dedica desD. hace seis años a la comercialización D. aves D. corral, compra aves a los pobladores D. los caseríos D. Mórrope, las engorda y las ofrece en venta en la ciudad D. Chiclayo. Eventualmente también compra pescado y lo venD. en su vivienda a sus vecinos.

Sara nos comenta que estas actividades le han servido para salir adelante y ahora su familia ya cuenta con una vivienda propia, además siente que con el trabajo que realiza en los caseríos D. la zona ayuda a los lugareños a tener una mejor calidad D. vida. Ella desea trabajar un poco mas para poder percibir una mayor cantidad D.  ingresos ya que su menor hijo ingresará muy pronto a estudiar, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crrédito D. 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. aves D. corral para ampliar su negocio D. comercialización.

Sara es una mujer alegre y que trabaja siempre pensando en el bienestar D. su familia. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar la infraestructura D. su vivienda que aun esta construida D. material rustico. En la zona donD. vive ella es muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Sara, age 33, is married and has a young son. She lives with her family in the Mórrope district. This district is noted for having the majority of its population concentrated in a central town and in various rural communities that are very far from each other. The district belongs to the Lambayeque province. It is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Sara has studied for a career as a technical nurse. She currently relies on her studies to get income. She has been working in health centers in rural areas of her district for ten years. This work provides a stable income, which helps her husband support the household. Also, she has been selling poultry for six years. She buys birds from the people who live in the rural area of Mórrope. She fattens them and sells them in the city of Chiclayo. Occasionally she also buys fish and sells it in her house to her neighbors. Sara tells us that these activities have been useful to her in order to get ahead. Now her family has their own home. Also, she feels that the work she does in the rural areas helps the villagers to have a better quality of life. She wants to work a little more to be able to get a greater income because her youngest child will be registering for school very soon. That is why she has asked, for the first time, Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 800 PEN. She will use it to buy poultry to expand her business of selling poultry. Sara is a happy woman, and she always works thinking of her family’s well-being. Her greatest desire is to improve the infrastructure of her house because it is still maD. of adobe. In the area where she lives she is loved and respected by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry to expand her business of raising them and selling them

loans.name: Maame Ama

texts.en: Maame Ama N. is a hairdresser by profession at Abura. Maame Ama is single and has received a senior high education. Maame Ama has been a hairdresser for two years. She is responsible for herself in terms of accommodation, feeding and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy more hair products to fill her shop and to meet the demands of her customers. She wishes to use the fresh profits from her business to save to buy an additional hairdryer for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more hair products

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alberto de 40 años y sus 6 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda de Alejandrina es la primera en abrirse en su pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 1 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarle a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus compañeras de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone en su grupo. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 38, is a cheerful and hardworking mother who lives in her own home together with her husband, Alberto, 40, and their 6 dear children. They are the main reason that she makes all these efforts. Alejandrina’s store is the first to open in her village. Starting at 6 am her doors are open for the early morning customers who know that they can find all types of merchandise in her store and don’t hesitate to shop there. They always know that they will find all the items that the need. What she most likes about her work is chatting with the customers and finding out about what is going on in the village. She has been in this business for 1 year; what she finds the most difficult is staying inside the store all day without being able to leave. With time she would like to have her business grow and be able to offer her customers better service. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she hopes to be able to repay it on time, because she doesn’t want to cause any problems for her companions in the communal bank. She is very respected there because of the care she takes with the group. With the two thousand new sols that she is requesting, she will buy more products to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to supply her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de queso duro, queso fresco, cuajada en borona y crema.  To purchase hard cheese, fresh cheese, curd, and cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the business of selling simsim and groundnut and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize, millet, and sorghum to sell.  Mary is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. They have five children, all of whom attend school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 36-year-old husband and father of a seven-year-old child.  For twelve years, he has been selling sugarcane.  He also runs a boda-boda (motorbike) transport business.  He employs three people and hopes to hire two more in the future.  He has learned good customer service skills from Faulu Kenya, where he has previously taken out a loan.  He is requesting another loan for 40,000 KES to buy more sugarcane for selling.  In five years, he hopes to have two other locations for his business.

loans.use: To buy sugarcane for selling.

loans.name: Joseph Kinuthia

texts.en:
Joseph has run his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last nine years.  He is 37 years old and married to Esther Wangeci. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to build a food stall next to his butcher shop. This will increase his income.

Joseph wants to grow in the food sector in the future.  He would love it if he was able to run a chain of food stalls and also become a major supplier of meat in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To construct a food stall next to his butcher shop

loans.name: Vicky Jicela

texts.es:
la señora Vicky Jisela A. C. tiene 26 años de edad, tiene una hija y esta casada.
ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio, Vicky cuenta con un pequeño comedor en el cual ofrece desayunos, almuerzos, cenas y otro tipo de golosinas como ser: tamales, emparedados, enchiladas. sus clientes son vendedores de empresas,
personas que trabajan cerca de la zona y con los familiares.
ademas vende refrescos, agua en botellon y jugos naturales.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de verduras, carnes de res, cerdo y pollo, refrescos, condimentos y gas.

su mayor sueño es construir su casa ya que vive en la casa de su suegra.
texts.en:
Vicky Jisela A. C. is 26 years old, she has a daughter and she is married. She and her husband are business partners. Vicky has a small restaurant from where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner and she also caters snacks such as: tamales, sandwiches, and enchiladas. Her clients are the salespeople and other workers that are in the region, and her family.  She also sells soft drinks, bottled water and fresh juices.

The loan will be used to purchase vegetables, beef, pork and chicken, soft drinks, condiments and fuel gas.

Her greatest dream is to build a house. They currently live with her mother-in-law.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es una madre de familia de años de edad que reside junto a su esposo ya sus dos hijos en el sector El Salitral del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región y en distrito con mayores índices de pobreza.

Se dedica a la venta de menestras cocidas recorriendo las diversas calles del complejo Moshoqueque, para ello es ayudada por su esposo que tiene una mototaxi. Juntos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia y progresar.

Rosario desea adquirir más menestras con las cuales pueda ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos con los cuales pueda seguir ayudando a su esposo a salir adelante. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Rosario es una mujer responsable y que siempre busca el desarrollo de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Rosario is a mother who lives with her husband and two children in El Salitral, José Leonardo Ortiz district.  This is one of the most densely populated districts in the region and has one of the highest levels of poverty.

She sells cooked pulses and legumes throughout the streets of the Moshoqueque complex.  She is helped by her husband who has a 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cart in back for passengers).  Together they try to help their family succeed and make progress in life.

Rosario would like to acquire more pulses and legumes which would enable her to expand her business and make more income.  This increased income would enable her to keep helping her husband to make progress.  For this reason she decided to request her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles which will help her achieve her goal.

Rosario is a responsible woman and is always looking to improve her family's situation.  People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: Purchase of pulses and legumes to expand her sales business

loans.name: Lilia Gloria

texts.es:
Lila tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y tiene doce hijos D. los cuales tres están viviendo con ella. Vive junto a su madre en el anexo San Luis del distrito D. La Victoria, una zona rural que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Lila se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores en su domicilio. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta en los mercados Modelo y Moshoqueque D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, usualmente va a estos centros D. abasto dos veces por mes. Adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en un ambiente D. su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos verduras, frutas y algunos abarrotes. Los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Lila desea adquirir mas productos para surtir su bodega y aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Lila is 45 years old, married, and has twelve children. Three of them still live with her. She also lives with her mother in the San Luis Annex of the District of La Victoria, a rural area located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Lila raises and sells small animals from her home. When the animals have reached the proper stage of development, she offers them for sale at the Modelo and Moshoqueque Markets in the city of Chiclayo. She usually visits the markets twice per month. In addition, she has a small grocery store established in a room in her house. There she offers her neighbors vegetables, fruits, and other grocery products. The earnings generated from her businesses have been useful in helping her husband with the family finances.

Lila wants to acquire more products so that she can restock her store and increase her sales. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can accomplish her goal.

Lila is a peaceful and responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities for her store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; tiene 50 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la socia atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas para la tienda de abarrotes.
