 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the “SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO” community bank which is located in Cachimayo district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Vilma is 50 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling young animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  She also has a grocery store where she serves from 5.00am to 7.00pm.  She would like to expand her grocery store.  She is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies for her grocery store.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies for her grocery store

loans.name: 10 Estrellas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama 10 ESTRELLAS. Significa que son diez integrantes y les gusta soñar viendo las estrellas. Esta ubicado en san Juan Tilapa, Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. La Sra. Antonia es una integrante  del grupo  quien tiene 33 años. Tiene 5 hijos, 3 mujeres y 2  varones. Se dedica a las labores del campo y vende dulces, solicito su préstamo para invertir en su negocio y poder adquirir productos dada la cercanía de las fechas de fin de año. Ella es una mujer que pese a ser trabajadora del campo busca  opciones de ingreso para mantener su familia lo mejor posible y con menos carencias. Es feliz de saber que puede contribuir con su esfuerzo y sueña que en el futuro su condición económica mejore.Observación: la señora Esperanza se movio al momento de capturar la foto.
texts.en:
The group is called 10 ESTRELLAS (10 Stars).  It means that there are 10 members and they like to dream gazing at the stars.  It is located in San Juan Tilapia, México state.  The group has 10 members.

Antonia is one of the group members.  She is 33 years old and has five children, three girls and two boys.

She works in the fields but also sells candy.  She asked for a loan to invest in her business to be able to buy products due to the nearness of end of year dates.

She is a woman who despite being a field worker seeks other income options to support her family the best way possible with fewer wants.  She is happy to know that she can contribute with her effort and dreams that her economic situation will improve in the future.

Observation:  Esperanza moved at the moment the photo was taken.

loans.use: To invest in their sales.

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es:
Arlen es una mujer emprendedora, que se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosmético, negocio que viene aumentando desde hace cuatro años, también trabaja como maestra de primaria por la mañana. Teniendo un dinero fijo.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con capital propio, y dinero que su esposo dio, por medio de su trabajo como albañil. Luego para aumentar sus ventas de productos busca alternativas para vender variedad, siendo Afodenic que por medio de sus financiamientos compra más cosmético de Vogue, ropa. Lo que logro más captación de clientela.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en mas ropa de niño, cosméticos, zapatos gran parte de estos productos son encargados, así como la compra de muchos perfumes de dama y caballeros. Esperando tener mejores colocaciones en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Arlen is an entrepreneurial woman who sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics as a part-time business which she has developed over the last four years.  She also is a primary school teacher in the mornings and has a steady income.

She began her business with her own capital and the money given to her by her husband who works as a bricklayer.  To increase sales she wanted to add variety to her products and through the loans provided by Afodenic she was able to purchase Vogue cosmetics and clothing, thereby developing her customer base.

The new loan is to be used to purchase more children's clothing, cosmetics and shoes, all of which have to be ordered.  She'll also buy more women's and men's perfumes.  Hopefully in this way she can improve sales.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing, cosmetics and perfumes to increase sales

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophan S. is a silk weaver. She lives with her parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has three children – one son and two daughters. Her parents are farmers.  

Sophan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives and to provide her parents with capital for their farming business.

loans.use: To repair house and provide capital for parents' farm

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is from the village of Patawag Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 55 years old. Justina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Justina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Justina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Justina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Justina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Justina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Juana Del Rocío

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jesús Del Gran Poder se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta. Para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Aquí conocimos a Juana, tiene 44 años de edad, está soltera y vive sola en su casa propia. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy fáciles de hacer  y por la gran  ayuda que la institución le ha brindado. 

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta y también vende en su casa ya que sus clientes la visitan para poder escoger lo mejor, nos cuenta que trabaja a base de pedidos que sus clientes le hacen. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas y también en las tardes cuando puede, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio tres años y que gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, interiores, entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son tener su local para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Jesus del Gran Poder" meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta. For the population of the city there is no place more beautiful in the world.

Here we meet Juana. She is 44 years old, single, and she lives alone in a house that is her own.  She is the founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys partaking because the loan process is easy and for the great support the organization provides.

She sells all types of clothing through her business, selling itinerantly and from her home when clients visit her to choose the best pieces. She says that she takes orders placed by her clients. She works every day in the mornings and in the afternoons when she is able. She completes her sales in credit, taking payments every two weeks. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil. She has had her business for three years and thank God it has gone so well. 

This loan will be used to purchase all types of clothing for ladies, pants, blouses, t-shirts, undergarments, and others. Her dream is to have store from where to provide better service to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' clothing for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 36 years old, married and blessed with three children. He makes a living by selling green maize in Gikomba's open-air market, and supplements the income he earns there by running a boutique.  He has benefited from his affiliation with Faulu Kenya, which has provided him with loans to expand his business. His goal is to become a major supplier of green maize in the next five years.  He will use this loan, for 60,000 Kes, to buy more green maize to sell to his customers,

loans.use: To buy more green maize to sell to his customers

loans.name: Guzman Eleuterio

texts.es:
Guzman de 47 años, es un microempresaria que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha trabajado para que su familia tenga todas las comodidades que se merecen. Comenzó con sus ventas de helados hace varios años. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano con ayuda de su esposa e hijos. Vende los helados a un precio muy económico desde $ 0.40 y $ 0.75. Una de las complicaciones de vender los helados es la delincuencia que hay en la zona donde vive. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio pero por ahora quiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Guzman, 47, is a micro businessman who works hard and diligently so that his family will have all the comforts they deserve.  He started selling ice cream several years ago.

He currently works from very early with help from his wife and children.  He sells ice cream at very reasonable prices starting from $0.40 and $0.75.  One of the complications he faces selling ice cream is the lawlessness in his neighborhood.  

He has many hopes for his business but what he wants the loan for now is to buy building materials and supplies to provide his family a better life.

loans.use: For zinc metal sheeting and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina P. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Carolina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carolina owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal use products such as shampoo, soap & body lotions in the local community. Carolina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carolina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Carolina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mr. Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has 17 people, each of whom will each use their loan portion to improve their family's living standard.  Touch, the village bank president selected by the other members, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land upon which he grows rice both to sell  and to feed his family. His wife, a balut-egg seller, is able to earn some profit to help support the family. 

Eager to start a new business, Touch is requesting a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. He is the father of four children, two of whom are construction workers, one a driver, and one a student in a local public school.

loans.use: to buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Monte Nuevo Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario monte nuevo esta conformado por tres mujeres que se dedican al comercio, todas ellas tienen varios años de conocerse y de trabajar juntas como grupo, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

La señora Candida M. M. tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niños y se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un puesto ubicado en la entrada principal de Nacaome a la par de la llantera el Amigo.
Candida es una mujer servicial y trabajadora. En su negocio vende tacos, enchiladas, pollo, tajadas, papas, refrescos, agua , etc.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las comidas, ahorita que empieza la semana santa tiene muchas ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con sus 2 hijos.

La señora Ana Bessy E. tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de dos niños y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria , tiene una pulperia en la cual vende productos como ser manteca, pasta dental, huevos, jabon, refrescos, carnes, lacteos, embutidos y otra variedad de productos.
Ana es una mujer emprendedora y se destaca por ser una mujer simpatica, Ana es reconocida por las personas de su barrio y es muy popular entre los vecinos del mercado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria al por mayor y asi surtir su negocio.

la sra. Cinthia Carolina E. tiene 21 años de edad, es madre de un niño y se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, sus tortillas las vende en comedores, colegios, escuelas  y otras instituciones.
Cinthia es una mujer atenta, amable y trabajadora .
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
Cinthia tiene la ayuda de su esposo, el es trabajador de la contruccion.

la meta de ellas es darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Monte Nuevo community bank is made up of three women who work in sales.  They have known each other and worked together as a group for several years.  Here we will provide details about their different business activities:

Candida M. M. is 58 years old.  She is a single mother and has two children.  Her business is selling food from a stall which is located at the main entrance to Nacaome, alongside El Amigo tire shop.  Candida is a helpful and hard-working woman.  In her business she sells tacos, enchiladas, chicken, sliced plantain, potatoes, soft drinks, water, etc.  She will use her loan to buy supplies that she needs for making her food.  Now that Semana Santa (Holy Week) is starting, she has a lot of sales.  She needs the profits from her business to get her two children ahead in life.

Ana Bessy E. is 28 years old.  She has two children and her business is selling groceries.  She has a small grocery store where she sells products including butter, toothpaste, eggs, soap, soft drinks, meat, dairy products and cold meats.  Ana is an enterprising woman and she is also noted for being kind.  She is well known by the people in her neighborhood and is very popular with her neighbors in the market.  Ana will use her loan to buy groceries wholesale so that she can stock her business.

Cinthia Carolina E. is 21 years old and has one child.  She has been selling tortillas for two years.  She sells her tortillas to small restaurants, high schools, elementary schools and other institutions.  Cinthia is an attentive, kind and hard-working woman.  She will use her loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her tortillas.  Cinthia has the help of her husband.  He is a construction worker.

The goal of these women is to provide their children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, vegetables, soft drinks, corn, firewood, water, butter, oil, beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, candles and sanitary towels

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchick, es casada, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos de 15, 13, 10, 6 y 4 años de edad. Maribel se dedica a la venta de discos, prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir y lencería. Los domingos vende en la feria de las Americas y los lunes en la feria de las Nazarenas. Los demás días de la semana en su tienda ubicada en le Jr. Libertad.
Maribel ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia, le gusta por la facilidad de los créditos, se puede ahorrar y aprende en la capacitaciones que recibe de su promotora. 
Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Kallpanchick communal bank. She is married, is 34 years old and has five children ages 15, 13, 10, 6 and 4.

Maribel sells CDs and clothing for women, men and children. The loan she is asking for will be invested in clothing and lingerie purchases. She makes sales at the market in Las Americas on Sundays and at the Nazarenas market on Mondays. The rest of the week she makes sales from her store in Jr. Libertad street.

Maribel joined FINCA Perú at the invitation of another member. She likes it because loans are easy to get, she can save money, and she learns from the training sessions she receives from her facilitator.

Her dream is for her business to continue growing and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Sonia Yesenia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad.  Es conviviente y tiene dos hijos.  La señora estudió educación secundaria.
Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales.  Paralelamente brinda el servicio de animación con orquesta musical, negocio alternativo para solventar otros gastos.
Trabaja hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su préstamo anterior fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de artesanías.
En la actualidad solicitará  un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio para comprar  pedestales y micros para la orquesta.  Trabaja junto con su esposo, quien es veterinario y también realiza servicio de taxi.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de artefactos bien implementado.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo  y la ganancia del ahorro.

En la foto la vemos junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank located in Juli District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department.  She’s 20 years old, has a live-in spouse and two children.  She finished secondary school.

She sells crafts but in a parallel way also provides entertainment with a musical orchestra, an alternative business to cover other expenses.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  She used her initial, 300 new sol, loan to invest in her crafts business.

Now, she will ask for a new, 500 new sol, loan to increase her business’ capital buying music stands and microphones for the orchestra.  She works with her husband, who’s a Veterinarian and also provides taxi services.

Her dream is to have a well equipped crafts shop.

In the photo we see her with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy music stands and microphones.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 36 years old.  She resides in the Kampong Chnang province of Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Srey is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3.33 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband operates a motorbike with a trailer attached to provide transportation services, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 40 on other necessary expenses. 

Srey is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for her husband's transport business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 35-year-old single lady who has been operating a hair salon for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES.30,000.  This will be her second loan from KADET LTD, her first one now repaid. Josephine will use the loan funds to buy hair treatment products and a hair dryer. Her goal is to own a classic modern salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair treatment products and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eleven years.  He is 36 years old, married to Margaret, and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. He then will sell the produce in the local market.

In future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has no children but has four additional dependents who live with her while going to school.

In 2006, Salamatu established her palm oil business to help her husband provide a livelihood for their dependents. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month.

As the high cost of palm oil is greatly reducing her profit margins, Salamatu would like a loan of 3,500,000 SLL in order to buy 35 five-gallon containers of palm oil at 100,000 SLL each. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL.

In the future, Salamatu plans to build a bigger store where she could store larger quantities of palm oil. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 35 five-gallon containers of palm oil at 100,000 SLL each.

loans.name: Soppante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Soppanté  est créé le 28 décembre 2010, il est constitué de  quarante femmes qui sont parentes et s'activent dans l'agriculture, de la poterie, l'embouche et le petit commerce.


La responsable Marième est âgée de 54 ans, mariée elle est mère d'un enfant et a deux membres; elle mène une activité de petit commerce, elle fait parallèlement de l'embouche et a une bonne expérience; elle est debout à droite sur la photo couverte d'un châle blanc.


Elle achéte ses produits cosmétiques et huile (3 bidons de 20 litres), dans les villes les plus  proches et revend dans son village.


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter de l'huile en grande quantité et une brebis à élever et à revendre après 4 à 5 mois pour se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Avec ses bénéfices elle souhaite augmenter son épargne afin d'avoir un prêt élevé, mais aussi d'appuyer ses belles filles et  d'assurer un mieux bien être de ses enfants pour la santé, nourriture et habillement.
texts.en:
Le groupe de solidarité Soppanté  est créé le 28 décembre 2010, il est constitué de  quarante femmes qui sont parentes et s'activent dans l'agriculture, de la poterie, l'embouche et le petit commerce.


La responsable Marième est âgée de 54 ans, mariée elle est mère d'un enfant et a deux membres; elle mène une activité de petit commerce, elle fait parallèlement de l'embouche et a une bonne expérience; elle est debout à droite sur la photo couverte d'un châle blanc.


Elle achéte ses produits cosmétiques et huile (3 bidons de 20 litres), dans les villes les plus  proches et revend dans son village.


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter de l'huile en grande quantité et une brebis à élever et à revendre après 4 à 5 mois pour se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Avec ses bénéfices elle souhaite augmenter son épargne afin d'avoir un prêt élevé, mais aussi d'appuyer ses belles filles et  d'assurer un mieux bien être de ses enfants pour la santé, nourriture et habillement.

loans.use: Acheter de lh'huile et des produits cosmétiques à revendre.

loans.name: Tiessiri Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe TIESSIRI II est constitué de  10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, YAMA TAHIROU, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. YAMA TAHIROU compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The group TIESSIRI II is composed of ten married women who average 34 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are rice and peanuts.

The group members are now on their first collaboration with the institution. With this initial loan, YAMA TAHIROU, who is the second person sitting from the left in the photo, intends to buy inputs and assorted equipment and to pay the cost of plowing and weeding for maintaining about 0.5 hectare of peanuts. After the harvest, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. YAMA TAHIROU plans on making an average profit of about 60,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, weeding, and assorted equipment

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 30, is an enterprising businessman, married to Joyce. They have no children. He has been running a video show shop for the past year with the monthly income of KES 6,000 which he uses to support their basic  needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan To buy films, connect and  pay  for the Digital Satelite Television (D.S.T.V)

With the anticipated profit from the business he will venture into farming. His hope is to own a farm with dairy cows which will increase their living standard.

loans.use: To buy films, connect and  pay  for the Digital SateliteTelevision (D.S.T.V)

loans.name: Dusangire I Group

texts.fr:
Munaria est une commerçante âgée de 35ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la localité de Bukirasazi. Elle fait le commerce de vaches depuis 15ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 170,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter des vaches à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUSANGIRE I».
texts.en:
Munaria is a 35-year-old merchant who lives in the town of Bukirasazi in the center of the country. She is a member of the community group DUSANGIRE I.

She started selling cattle 15 years ago, and she is also a farmer. She attended primary school up to the 6th grade. She is married with five children, three of whom are in primary school. 

This first loan of 170,000 Burundian francs will help her to increase her working capital and buy cattle for resale to earn substantial profits.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Kayunga Market Women's Group B

texts.en:
Owning a business is a worthwhile proposition that many people have of late been eager to explore. From the estimation of 28-year-old Esther, it carries a whole lot of meaning and brings dividends that one would not enjoy while in formal employment.

Esther, a happy-go-lucky mother of two set forth in her pub business a year ago. She operates from Kayunga, a stone's throw away from Kampala. She had gotten disillusioned with the red tape manifest in formal employment.

Esther says from the day she started working, the thought of being her own boss always crossed her mind. She invariably wanted to have the leverage to make her own decisions. What has helped Esther in periods of uncertainty has been her ability to look on the bright side of things. A pub is a profitable venture so if one is painstaking in his or her plans and adds a sense of shrewdness, they are bound to reap big.

Esther sells both hard and soft beverages at her pub. Monthly, her sales profits add up to Ugandan shillings 350,000. Esther’s group is on their 5th loan with Pearl Micro-finance. Esther also ekes out a side income from farming. She says she will use her loan to purchase more crates of soft and hard drinks to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of soft and hard drinks to resell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 26 years old, married and a mother of two children. 

Iman has been a tailor since 2007; she is an owner of a workshop where she makes, repairs or alters clothing professionally, and especially suits and women’s clothing. She has more than five years experience in this field. She has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in her surroundings.

She is requesting a $1800 loan in order to purchase an electric diesel generator, a split air conditioner and a sewing machine .She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase an electric diesel generator, split air conditioner, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sudi Sisters Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sudi Sisters Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Alice is the facilitator of this group. She is the mother of five children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best prizes offered by the firm, in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on 0.5 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize on 0.5 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Sudi Sisters Group will each plant  between 0.5 and 1 acre of maize.
Alice is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 55 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Hioma, Uganda. He has been a farmer for 16 years. He started as a samba boy and after saving enough money, he started his own farm. William faces a challenge of weather changes, which affect his production. His dream is to venture into modern farming practices. William needs a loan to pay for labor to clear his garden.

loans.use: to pay for labour to clear his garden.

loans.name: Juana Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino hace 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad, que está ubicado en su vivienda en donde muchos clientes llegan a realizar  los diferentes trabajos. Ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su molino. Es muy buena cliente, trabajadora y muy responsable, ella es madre soltera pero a pesar de sus desventajas ha logrado salir adelante sin ningún problema. Juana se encuentra agradecida por la confianza y el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ms. Juana has been offering milling services for 12 years.  Her business is set up in her home and she has many customers for whom she provides different jobs.  She is requesting a loan to buy repair parts for her milling machine.  She is a very good, hard-working, responsible borrower.  She is a single mother who, despite the disadvantages, has been able to get ahead without any problems.  Juana is very grateful for the confidence and support.

loans.use: To buy repair parts for her milling machine.

loans.name: Turatbek

texts.ru:
Туратбеку 43 года, женат  и имеет троих детей,  двое из которых школьники.  В поисках источника финансирования для своих детей, Туратбек начал бизнес  в животноводстве - откорме и перепродаже скота. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Туратбек сумел развить хозяйство, насчитывающее  4  коровы, 20 баранов и 1 лошадь с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 12,500 сом (KGS).  Откормленный скот  Туратбек продает в живом виде на скотном рынке.  Также, в наделе имеется земля, где Туратбек сеет зерновые культуры и эспарцет, урожай продает постоянным оптовым покупателям. 
Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Туратбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Туратбек намерен использовать для заготовки кормов  и сена на зиму, чтобы весной продать откормленный скот по хорошей цене.
texts.en: Turatbek is 43 years old, married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  In search of a financial support for his children, Turatbek started his animal husbandry (fattening up and reselling livestock) business.  Having started with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS), Turatbek was able to develop his business, which now has 4 cows, 20 sheep and 1 horse and a monthly profit of 12,500 som (KGS).  Turatbek sells fattened-up livestock at a livestock market.  His property also includes land, where he sows cereal crops and sainfoin.  He sells the harvest to his regular wholesale buyers.  In order to further increase his livestock headcount, Turatbek requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock for fattening up.  He plans to use the expected profit to stock up on fodder and hay for the winter in order to sell fattened up livestock at good prices in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Nabeki Shg Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Nabeki SHG group. Alice and her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Alice takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting eleven bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest three bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing and buy a piece of land for future use. In 2012, the members of Nabeki SHG group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Alice is pictured with her group members and a cow raised by a group member. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Duo Panimabey Group

texts.es: Duo Panimabey. este duo esta integrado por dos personas luchadoras que dia a dia se esfuerzan por salir adelante,en su negocio,Doña Delia tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar ella se dedica a la elavoracion D. tejidos tipicos,desD. hace años,ella nos  esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos tipicos, para seguir con su negocio y seqguir dandoles a sus hijos lo nesesario,
texts.en:
Duo Panimabey. This duo is composed of two people, fighters who day by day make an effort to get ahead in their business. Delia has 5 school-aged children, and she has worked at making typical weavings for many years. 

She is asking us for this loan to buy the raw material to make typical weavings, to continue with her business and continue giving her children what they need.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make weavings.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Elizabeth has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Elizabeth became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Carlina Del Rosario

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Carlina, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años los cuales estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante y albañil.

Ella es una ama de casa que al ver que lo que hace su esposo no le alcanza para los gastos familiares, se dedico al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los mas que todo en las mañanas ya que en la tarde llegan sus hijos de la escuela y ella tiene que ayudarles en sus tareas y cuidarlos también, compra su mercadería en Portoviejo y en otros casos en Guayaquil, depende de donde le salga más barato, lleva más de 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y en especial ropa de niños que es lo que más vende. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace más de 15 años y le gusta ya que gracias a los créditos puede sacar adelante su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
Picoaza is characterized in books as one of the indigenous villages that is part of the Manta culture.  This urban parish is located only ten minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has an abundance of history.  The members of the communal bank María Asunción meet here bimonthly.  

This is where Carlina lives.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children ages 12 and 8 with her husband.  Both of her children attend school.  Her husband is a merchant and a bricklayer.  

She is a homemaker.  When she realized that her husband's income would not cover the family expenses she started selling all types of clothing.  She sells door to door.  She works mostly in the mornings since her children come home in the afternoon and she has to help them with their homework and take care of them.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo and sometimes in Guayaquil, depending on where it is cheaper.  She has been running this business for 8 years and things are going well for her.  
 
She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and especially children's clothing which is what she sells the most of.  She has been a member of the communal bank for more than 15 years and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has been able to get ahead in her business.  

Her dream is to have a well-constructed house as the one she has now is made of reeds.

loans.use: purchase pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella es comerciante de queso y ropa, este negocio lo tiene en el mercado municipal desde hace 5 años, tiene buena ubicación para atender a la clientela.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de blusas, camisas, faldas, y queso al por mayor, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, fortaleciéndolo para obtener mejores ventas.
El objetivo de Verónica es tener un mejor negocio, con la mercadería necesaria para abastecer la demanda, dándole una mayor seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband and they have no children.  She is a merchant and sells cheese and clothing.  Her 5-year-old business is set up in the municipal market and well-located to attend to customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, shirts, skirts and cheese, wholesale.  This investment will help her improve and strengthen her business so she can increase sales.

Verónica's goal is to have a better business and enough merchandise to meet demand, which will give her a more stable economy.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, skirts and cheese.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: Roger Antonio tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a un taller de costura ya tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio, este taller lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación muchas de las empresas lo buscan por la calidad de servicio que brinda. Roger Antonio está solicitando financiamiento para comprar telas, hilos entre otras cosas que necesita para la elaboración de la prendas.
texts.en: Roger Antonio, 35, is a tailor with many years of experience.  His shop is located in his house and many companies seek him out because of the quality of his service.  Roger Antonio is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread and other items he needs to make clothing.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread and other items.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 50-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a business clothing in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Matalena has requested a loan to buy more secondhand clothes and etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cloths, sewing machine, and needles

loans.name: Shaida

texts.en: Shaida , is 33 years old, married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. The garment selling business has allowed Nusrat to help earn money for the household thus easing the expenses and improving the standard of living for the family. For the improvement of her business, Shaida  has requested a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
He started his business as a taxi driver. In spite of the fact that he is taxi driver he is interested in the sale of genuine leather  goods. He borrowed  the loan $300 in order to repair his car. Then he decided to apply for a loan $600 in order to start his new business. In the beginning his business he drove some small retail trade. He has been engaged in this business  for 10 years. He likes both businesses and he can not leave one of these businesses. He borrowed the loan amount of $1000 for the extensive repairs of his car. 
He needs $1800 to change the car with the lorry in order to transport  of the  genuine leather  goods from the regions  and to improve the sale of the genuine leather  goods. Elman is married, has 3 children. This 59-year-old businessmen is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam. He and his family settled in the building of Sevinj  nursery school in Khirdalan town.

loans.use: To buy the lorry

loans.name: Dunia Guadalupe

texts.en: I buy and sell new and used clothing since having more options causes my customers to buy more. I need capital to be able to stock my inventory and increase my income so that I can help and support my children and keep them in schools that will give them a good education.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing to sell: jeans, tee-shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Mr. Raphael N., a 46 year old dynamic client of LAPO. He is married with four children and has proved his worth of experience in his line of business. He is maintaining his repayment schedule with LAPO without fail. He needs this money ($500) to keep his business booming.

loans.use: To buy more gas cookers for sale

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong S. (on the left with the blue shirt) is 26 years old  and sells mangos to the people in her community. She can generate about $2 per day in profit, while her husband makes on average around $3.30 a day by plowing other people's rice paddies, using his own tractor. This loan will be used to repair their house in order to keep it from leaking during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair their house which often leaks during the rainy season.

loans.name: Damián

texts.es:
Damián lives with his wife and children in the city of Pucallpa. With his wife, who is his friend and partner, he sells vegetables at the "La Hoyada" market. His wife started the sale of these products on a small table 12 years ago and diligently they have taken advantage of the mornings to satisfy the customers´ needs of vegetables for the preparation of delicious lunches. Don Damián is also a construction worker and his extra income contributes to the household economy and the education of the children. Thanks to their dedication they are succeeding in improving even if they do not have a stable sales stand they are not giving up, on the contrary they stay focused on their goal.

Damián needs $400 to obtain one of the conditioned sales booths at the market and his plan is to repay the loan in 6 months. Remember that with your support Damian´s family will be able to improve their life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Damián es padre de familia, vive con su esposa e hijos en la ciudad de Pucallpa, realiza en compañía de su esposa, amiga y socia la venta de verduras en el mercado “La Hoyada”.Su esposa tuvo la iniciativa, empezó con la venta estos productos en una pequeña mesa hace 12 años y diligentemente todos los días aprovechan la mañana para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes que llegan presurosos para encontrar lo necesario para preparar sus apetitosos almuerzos; Damián paralelo a la venta de verduras es maestro albañil y esta actividad le genera ingresos adicionales que ayudan a la economía familiar y a la educación de sus hijos. Gracias a la dedicación e ímpetu están logrando salir adelante a pesar de no contar con un puesto laboral estable jamás se rindieron por el contrario siempre se mantuvieron firmes en sus propósitos.Damián necesita 400 dólares para obtener un puesto de ventas acondicionado en el mercado y les extiende su compromiso de devolver este dinero en un lapso 6 meses. Recuerda que con tu ayuda la familia de Damián podrá incrementar su calidad de vida

loans.use: La Compra de más productos permitirá la obtención de un espacio acondicionado  para el negocio de Damián.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: Mrs. R. Sopheak was married in 2006 and has one daughter. A relative taught her how to weave in 2001 and she started silk production in the same year. She and her husband live with her parents.Her husband is a bricklayer, a skilled painter and an artist. He also owns a horse and cart which he uses to transport local people around the area. Neither husband nor wife finished primary school This is the first time R. Sopheak has requested a loan from MAXIMA, for the amount of $200. She intends to use this loan to purchase additional silk materials and sewing thread in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase silk material and sewing thread for selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha Lorena M. is a single woman with 4 children, who have been her greatest motivation to begin a business. While stabilizing her own business, she can give her family a good future and help them improve their standard of living.

Before beginning her business, she dedicated herself to helping her parents’ business for months. Once she began her own business, she started in a market, and then moved up to the Market Terminal and obtained a fixed stand with a better structure.

Currently, the infrastructure of her business does not meet the need to protect her products from the sun and rain, taking into account that they are perishable products and they require more care and hygiene. However, her project is to buy merchandise in order to supply her business with more and, at the same time, invest her earnings in infrastructure so she may gain a better presence at the market which will attract more customers.

Martha Lorena started her business with savings in the initial amount of CS 1,000.00 (Cordobas). She has worked with CEPRODEL for two years granting her 33 credits, which have helped her grow her finances and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Lorena M. es una mujer soltera con 4 hijos, los cuales han sido su mayor animación para emprender en un negocio y asi darle un buen futuro a su familia al igual que estabilizar su propio negocio ayudandole a mejorar su nivel de vida.

Antes de dar inicio a su negocio ella se dedicaba ayudando al negocio de sus padres por meses. Al dar inicio a su propio negocio empezó en mercado, luego pasó al Mercado la Terminal logrando tener su puesto fijo mejorando asi la estructura del mismo .

Actualmente la infraestructura de su negocio no cubre con las necesidad de proteger sus productos del sol y la lluvia, tomando en cuenta que son productos perecederos y requieren de un mayor cuidado e higiene. Pero su proyecto es comprar la mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio y al mismo tiempo con las ganancias invertir en infraestructura para una mejor presencia en el mercado y atraer mayor clientela

Martha Lorena dio inicio a su negocio con ahorros con un monto inicial de CS 1,000.00 (Córdobas). Ha trabajado con CEPRODEL desee hace dos años, otorgandole 33 créditos, los cuales le han ayudado a crecer sus finanzas y mejoramiento del mismo negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. sells clothes and also sews clothes for people living in her community. She is married with 9 children, and she is 50 years old and a LAPO member. She is asking for the loan of $525 to buy more clothes for sale and also to expand her business. She learned her business for 12 months and has been in it since 1985.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Ol

texts.en: Mrs. Ol C., 30, works as a grocery vendor normally earning on average $5 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Vong Vy, 29, works as a farmer and he generally earns around $2 a day. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more groceries to sell in large amounts. At the same time, they will use this money to renovate their house, too.

loans.use: Ol hopes to use this loan to purchase more groceries to sell in large amounts.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year old Rehema N.. She is married with five children, between the ages of 2 and 14. She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are her younger sisters.

In 2000, Rehema established a fruit and vegetable stall business. Working seven days a week from 9 to 12 hours a day and assisted by her children, she earns about $75.00 a month from this business. Rehema now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $30.00. In the future, Rehema also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock.

When you walk down the streets of Dar, you are greeted at almost every corner by a stall or wheelbarrow full of mangoes, pineapples, bananas or sugarcane. Rehema is one such seller of this luscious fruit and she thanks you for the support she needs to continue and expand.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Socorro Felicidad's Group

texts.es:
Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda have belonged to the Community Bank “Nueva Era” for 8, 7, and 3 years respectively.

Felicidad is married, 68 years old and has two daughters. She has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables and clothes, located in the district of Quinua, one hour from the city of Ayacucho. Socorro is married, 35 years old and has two daughters. Socorro sells clothes on credit to friends and relatives. She also sells cosmetics through catalogues.

Eduarda is married, 45 years old and has three children. Eduarda goes to the Huanta market where she buys small animals, selling them in the district of Quinua. She also makes clay crafts. Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda need loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 300 soles respectively, money for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, oil, snacks, creams, perfume, clothes and guinea pig. The dreams of Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda are that their businesses prosper, they have stable jobs and their children are professionals.

Translated from Spanish] by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Felicidad, Socorro y Eduarda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Nueva Era hace 8, 7, 3 años respectivamente.

Felicidad es casada, tiene 68 años y 2 hijas, Felicidad tiene una bodega donD. venD., abarrotes, verduras, ropa, esta ubicado en el distrito D. Quinua que esta a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Socorro es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijas, Felicidad venD. ropa a crédito a amigos y familiares. Además venD. cosméticos por catálogos.

Mientras que Eduarda es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Eduarda viaja a la feria D. Huanta donD. compra animales menores y lo venD. en el Distrito D. Quinua. Además realiza artesanías en arcilla.

Felicidad, Socorro y Eduarda necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 300 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, golosinas, cremas, perfumes, ropa y cuy.

Los sueños D. Felicidad, Socorro y Eduarda son que sus negocios prosperen, tener un trabajo estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda need loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 300 soles respectively, money for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, oil, snacks, creams, perfume, clothes and guinea pig

loans.name: Faatoaga

texts.en:
Faatoaga T., 66, is married with six children. Not allowing her age to restrict her, Faatoaga is still very active. She has been selling vegetables for many years to the people in her village, working six days per week.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~$83 USD). This is Mrs. T.'s first loan request. She sees this first loan as a very successful way for sustainable development in her family.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkins, lemons, and a small cash box

loans.name: Sulesa Tapusoa's Group

texts.en:
This is the second group from the Vaitoomuli 1 Center on the big island of Savaii. This is the first loan for these women, who will be starting a taro plantation and sewing businesses. They will use the loan to purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, weed killer, weed spray, and bush knives for the plantation and material, a sewing machine, and other items for the sewing businesses.

This loan offers a good opportunity to provide the members' families with extra income and to move away from dependence on other villagers for survival. The group members know that, if they work hard on their businesses, they can look forward to another loan to extend the businesses, renovate their houses, and pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, weed killer, weed spray, and bush knives for the plantation and material, a sewing machine, and other items for the sewing businesses

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara started her business because her husband worked as a bricklayer at that time, and they did not have enough money to cover their 3 young daughters’ expenses. Furthermore, they were in debt, so they needed the extra income. Sara's husband was not able to bear their situation, so he left them, which is why she felt the need to help her daughters get ahead in life.

She started her business 7 years ago when she requested a loan in order to purchase jewelry and sell it. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has managed to establish a client-base that has been increasing, and she now sells shoes as well.

She is requesting a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase glass cases to display her merchandise because her business is prospering and she wants it to succeed even more.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara inició el negocio dado que su esposo trabajaba como albañil y no les alcanzaba el dinero para los gastos de sus 3 pequeñas hijas además que tenían una deuda y necesitaban de ingresos extras ante esta situación su esposo no soporto la deuda y las dejo, motivo por el cual ella se vio en la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijas.

Comenzó hace 7 años pidió un crédito para poder comprar un portafolio de joyería y empezar a vender su producto, gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo, ella ha logrado crear una cartera de clientes la cual se ha ido incrementando y ahora tambien vende zapatos.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar vitrinas para exhibir su mercancía ya que le empieza a ir bien en su negocio y quiere que le vaya mucho mejor.

loans.use: Purchase glass display cases

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Sa P., 43, lives in Siem Reap with her husband, Thoan Soeung, and their eight children. Sa P. stays at home to manage this large family, while her husband works as a fisherman making US$5 each day from selling his catch in the local food market. One of their children works at a local golf course, while three others sell various food products, and the rest are too young to be employed. Sa P. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to open up a food stand that sells roast beef and drinks. Previously, she had been employed in a similar food stand and now she believes she has the experience necessary to open her own business. She looks forward to watching this new enterprise grow and is optimistic about her investment.

loans.use: Sa would like to open up her own food stand, selling roast beef and drinks.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a 40-year-old entrepreneur and mother of 4 school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Mombasa, Kenya. She began her current business of dressmaking in 1997. She specializes in making both women's and men's clothing. Her business location coupled with her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good client base. She owes her success to hard work and perseverance. She has also established a training site for girls who have dropped out of school (currently she has 10), who are trained in dressmaking. She has also employed a full-time tailor to meet her customers' demands. Dorothy plans to move to a more spacious site with her next loan of KSH 42,300.

loans.use: To relocate her business to a more spacious place

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris is married and lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Boris sells retail items in the central town market. His vending location is characterized by nice selection of products and favorable location of the kiosk itself. Boris has been involved in this business for over 4 years. His nice assortment of inventory helps him get good sale rates despite the season.

Boris always puts much emphasis on growth of his business. He has learned some of the tricks that stimulate promotion of his enterprise and knows how to manage his time and finances well to add to success of the trade. Boris's business is the only source of income for his family. His venture provided him with much needed finances after the earthquake that had happened in his area. The insurance company refused to cover the expenses and Boris was forced to repair everything using his own money. He is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to re-stock his merchandise.

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Enaradela Group

texts.en:
This is the Enaradela group: Masse S. and Tenneh S.. They have been with SMT for the past three years. The previous loans have made meaningful impacts in their lives. The last loan was for Le 500,000.00 each. Now they are requesting a loan of Le 800,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Masse is the leader of the group. She was born in Koindu in the Koinadugu District in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-nine and married with seven children. Four of her children are already married, two are in secondary schools, and one is in primary school. Her husband is a retired soldier, now working as a security guard in the government hospital. 

She has been in business for over twenty years. She buys husk rice before it is pounded and cleans it before selling. She buys a pan of husk rice from villages surrounding Kabala at Le 2,000.00 and sells at Le 3,000.00. Masse uses part of her profit to repay the loan, part to feed herself and her family, and the rest to buy cattle. She rears the cattle and keeps them as collateral. In an emergency situation, Masse can then sell the cattle.

loans.use: To purchase husk rice.

loans.name: Isaura Margarita

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Estacion en la ciudad de León la señora Isaura T. se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras como lo son uvas, manzanas, papas, cebollas, chiltomas, plátanos, zanahorias, entre otros.

Su negocio lo ha venido desarrollando a través del tiempo ya que ha invertido grandemente para aumentar el volumen de venta de los perecederos. Es importante destacar que Ceprodel le ha beneficiado grandemente por lo que le ha brindado los créditos para la compra de estas frutas y verduras. Es por esta razón que ella espera una vez más que su crédito sea aprobado para continuar con su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
At the La Estacion market in the city of Leon, Isaura Telleria makes a living selling fruits and vegetables. Among other things, she sells grapes, apples, potatoes, onions, sweet peppers, platanos, and carrots.

Her business has grown over the years because she's invested significantly to increase her sales of perishables. It's important to note that Ceprodel has played a huge role in her success by extending loans to her to buy the fruits and vegetables she sells. She's now applying for another loan so that she can continue her business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Choukouratou

texts.fr: Née le 10 Octobre 1971 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au Sud du Bénin,Dame O. Choukouratou est marié à ABALIOU Razack. Mère de cinq enfants, elle s'est depuis près de dix ans spécialisé dans le vents de différents articles divers, plastiques, et l'eau. Comfrontés aujourd'hui à des difficultés financières, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour remforcer son activité en ces périodes de fête de fin d'année.
texts.en:
Born on October 10, 1971, in Sakété in the Plateau department in the south of Bénin, Ms. Choukouratou O. is married to Razack Abaliou. A mother of five, she has specialized for the last ten years in the sale of miscellaneous items, plastics, and water. Confronted with financial hardships, she seeks this third loan to strengthen her business during these holiday periods at the end of the year.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two boxes of sugar and liquors for the holidays

loans.name: Chear

texts.en: Mrs. Chear S., 29 years old and the mother of two children, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, where she earns around $3/day selling fish in a local market; her husband, a construction worker who builds houses, earns about $5 a day. Chear is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport the fish to market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita tiene 48 años de edad, casada hace 26 años con el padre de sus 4 hijos, su hijo mayor vive en otra ciudad, por lo que está viviendo con sus 3 hijos en la casa heredó de un familiar. Se dedica a pastar sus animales, también le ayuda a su esposo con los cultivos generalmente  cultivan zanahorias, porque aprovecha doblemente este cultivo, cosechar y vende los frutos, y con el resto que no ha cosechado los procesa y para conseguir la semilla que vende a unos clientes bolivianos que las cotizan a un buen precio y se llevan de 100 a 200 kilos. Este proceso es muy trabajoso pero también muy rentable, en temporadas altas le llena de mucha alegría porque su negocio le permite cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. En sus préstamos anteriores con MFP tuvo varios cargos, era secretaria, también vocal, y estos cargos los asumió con mucha responsabilidad, este es su 12vo crédito, y todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para sus chacras de zanahorias y papas, para ayudar a desarrollar sus frutos y den un buen tamaño.
texts.en:
Sarita is 48 years old and has been married for 26 years. She has 4 children—her oldest son lives in another city so she lives with her other three children in a home a family member left her. She raises animals for a living in addition to helping her husband with their crops. Normally they plant carrots because they get an extra advantage with this crop: first they harvest the vegetables and sell them and with what they don’t harvest, they process the seeds and sell them to Bolivian clients, who buy 100-200 kilos at a good price. This process is a lot of work but it is profitable. In good seasons she is filled with happiness because her job allows her to cover educational costs for her children. With previous MFP loans she has had various responsibilities, like secretary and spokeswoman. This is her twelfth loan and she has always made her payments on time. The money she is asking for is to buy fertilizer for her carrot and potato fields, to help the plants develop into a good size.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en:
Abdo is a 44-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Abdo has been selling fruits since 1988. He has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business.

This is Abdo's third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business and diversify his merchandise. Abdo is special in his work because he has a good variety of fruits. His clients can be anybody. When he first started, he had difficulty purchasing merchandise. In the future, he plans on improving his sales and purchasing the shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Dildorhon

texts.ru: Дилдорхон и ее муж занимаются предпринимательством – продают мужские брюки. Постоянного места для торговли не имеют и ездят по окрестным рынкам. На больших базарах им еще помогает старшая дочь. Дилдорхон 43 года, воспитывает 4 детей. Больше  года сотрудничает с МикроИнвест и проблем с погашением не было. Сейчас собирается получить новый займ и планирует приобрести весенний ассортимент брюк. Новый займ планирует погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dildorhon and her husband are small business owners - they mainly sell men's pants. They don't have a permanent spot, and for this reason, they travel to different markets. Their older daughter occasionally helps them when they visit large markets. Dildorhon is 43 years old and has 4 children. She has been working with MicroInvest for more than a year and never had problems with repayment of her loan. At this moment, she would like to obtain a new loan so she could purchase pants for the new spring season. She plans to pay off this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for the new spring season

loans.name: Alika

texts.fr: Alika A. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est tapissier à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. il désire avec ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre et des outils de travail pour la bonne exécution de son travail. Cette opportunité lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alika A., age 33, is married and the father of two. He is an upholsterer in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy a sewing machine and tools of the trade for carrying out his work well. This opportunity will enable him to earn more money in order to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and work tools

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Mrs. Carmela A., 50 years old, is married and lives at Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is blessed with three children. One of her children is in school. Her husband is a driver. She wants to help him have additional income. She has an existing sari-sari store and is eager to develop it. She turned to Paglaum MPC for assistance and has no regret in her membership. Recently, she applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional stock as well as soft drinks and canned goods for her store. She prays for the success of her business and the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods and soft drinks for her store

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr: Folly G. est un jeune homme de 29 ans célibataire sans enfants. il est réparateur d’appareils électro-ménagers à Wome. Il exerce ce métier depuis 4 ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, il tient le commerce des pièces détachées. Folly désire avec ce crédit alimenter son magasin afin de mieux satisfaire aux exigences de la clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Folly G. is a young man, 29 years old, unmarried, and without children. He is a home appliances repairman in Wome. He has been working at this trade for four years. Concurrently, he does commerce in spare parts. Folly would like to use this loan to supply his store in order to satisfy customer demand better. This will enable him to earn more money to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply a store

loans.name: Kalsoom Muhammad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji is the wife of M. H.. They have lived in a mid-size city Riwind, Pakistan for the past ten years. They are a very hardworking couple. Kalsoom baji prepares decorative embroidered dresses based on orders from the shops and Mr. H. makes artificial jewelry and sells it the jewelry shops.

Kalsoom baji is applying for a loan to buy beads, tools, and sketches for her husband’s jewelry making business. She is the leader of a group of three other women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery ssyore. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy material beads, colored thread, and clothing for her embroidered clothing business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy biscuit packs wholesale to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband's jewelry business.

loans.name: Guerreros Para Cristo 4 Group

texts.en:
The members of this group of five micro-entrepreneurs live in a small sugarcane settlement called Batey Guerrero. It is a small "neighborhood" only three streets long. During the cutting season, some people, specially male workers, work the fields and generate some kind of income. However, during the off-season employment in the batey is almost nonexistent and people don't have money to purchase the merchandise offered by those self-employed.

Luis B. is this group's representative. He sells clothing for a living. In most cases it's better for him to go to La Romana or other large towns to sell on market days. He will use this second loan he's receiving from Esperanza to buy fresher clothes to sell during the summer months. His dream is to have his own large boutique and own a house where he can live with his family.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cloth

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene comes from a family who experienced poverty. Now that she is the mother of five, she doesn't want her children to experience the life that she had. She is 43 years old and married to Lydio, a carpenter. She lives in Morong, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

With her innate desire to remove her family from poverty, in 2004 Arlene joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was very careful and wise in spending her loans and invested them in her resale business. Her business brings her income that can sustain the needs of her family, specially of her children.

Just recently, Arlene requested a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional rolling capital for her resale business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for fifty kilos of peanuts, rice, charcoal, bananas and vegetables, all for resale. She hopes that her business will grow and will bring her enough profit for her to achieve her dreams: to educate her children and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To pay for 50 kilos of peanuts, rice, charcoal and bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang D. is a 28-year-old mother, and has been married for 6 years. She has two young children, a son and daughter. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Samnang has been fishing for over 10 years. Her boat is old and it breaks down, which disrupts her business. As a result, she is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase a new boat. The new boat will replace her old one and will allow her to continue her business.

loans.use: Purchase a boat for her fishing business

loans.name: Gnanyome

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame habite l’un des quartiers périphériques de Lomé peuplé d’habitants : le quartier Minamadou à Agoè. Elle a appris la coiffure. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 2006 et cette activité lui permet non seulement de se prendre en charge mais aussi de subvenir aux besoins scolaires des ses petits frères. Elle est bien connue dans son quartier et coiffe ses clientes dans la perfection. Elle profite aussi de cette occasion pour vendre des mèches ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour renouveler son stock de mèches en baisse en ce moment. Avec l’argent du prêt, elle pourra s’acheter 100 mèches Nina et 100 mèches Curly. Cette femme n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle n’a aucune crainte de rembourser son prêt dans les délais en vigueur.

loans.use: Achat de mèches

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en: Mrs. Saroem K. is a villager in Samraong village in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her business. She is a widow with three children, one of whom earns an income by charging batteries. The others are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more grocery good for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is forty-three years old. She is married and has five kids in school.

Veronica has been trading in grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skim milk, body pomade, etc in the market in her community for two years. Her experience in trading has made her one of the successful traders in the market. She considers this loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables, and palm oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale. She hopes to increase her profits to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to expand her selection

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 62-year-old married woman with six children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Rita works to help her husband to provide for their family. 

Rita produces and sells palm oil. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil, and supplies to retailers in her community. She sells at the local market and treks to other communities, as well. Rita has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastes

loans.name: Felicita Mafalda

texts.es:
