La Sra. Felicita Mafalda Z. A. tiene 62 años de edad, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado Urb. Pedreros – San Carlos – Ica zona afectada por la inundación del año 1997  y por el terremoto del 2007.
A pesar de eso la Sra. sigue adelante y vive con 3 de sus hijos los cuales son profesionales gracias a que es una persona bien trabajadora.
Actualmente es obrera de campo y reparte recibos de luz y agua. Trabaja de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm. y los fines de mes en las tardes reparte los recibos ya mencionados.
Es padre y madre para sus hijos, es por eso que solicita el financiamiento de un crédito para asumir gastos personales.
Cuenta con buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos.
texts.en:
Felicita Mafalda Z. A., 62, lives in the Pedreros Urbanization, San Carlos, Ica. This area was affected by the 1997 flood and the 2007 earthquake. Despite that, she perseveres. She lives with three of her children, who are professionals, thanks to her hard work. Currently, she works as a field hand and she distributes light and water bills. She works from 6am-6pm and at month's end she distributes the afore-mentioned utility bills. She is both mother and father to her children. This is the reason for her requesting funding to defray personal expenses. She has good references from her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ROSARIO tiene 44 años, es viuda y hace 8 años que falleció su esposo. La socia es padre y madre para sus dos hijos. Cesar tiene 18 años y estudia Ingeniería de Sistema en la universidad y Geanella estudia en el colegio. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de Artesanías. La socia tiene una tienda de artesanía llamada “Charito” en el Aeropuerto “Velasco Astete” del Cusco donde vende chompas y cerámica de barro. Ya son 30 años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que desde niña trabajo a lado de su mamá y heredo el negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales para confeccionar más artesanía y chompas de lana de las mayorista que traen de la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento de Puno. 
 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Cusco.

Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosario is 44. She is a widow; her husband died eight years ago. She is father and mother to her two children. Cesar is 18 and is studying Systems Engineering in the university. Geanella is in school. Rosario alternates her activities between the household and selling handicrafts. She has a handcrafts store called “Charito” in the Valasco Astete airport in Cusco. She sells sweaters and ceramics made of clay. She has had the business for 30 years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother, who worked at her mother’s side as a girl. She inherited the business. She needs the loan to buy more material to make more handicrafts and to buy more wool sweater from the wholesalers who bring them from the city of Juliaca in the Puno department. She belongs to the Fuente de Vida Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. Cusco was the ancient capitol of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of the viceroyalty of Perú. It was declared the Patrimony of Humanity and the archeological capitol of America. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more materials to make more handicrafts and wool sweaters

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: El señor Isaac actualmente tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Tiene  37 años el negocio del señor Isaac es una pulpería donde vende arroz, frijoles, azúcar y otros productos para el consumo del hogar  el comenzó con un financiamiento que adquirió en una  institución y compro una parte de mercadería dando apertura de esa manera,  ya que el comercio es mucho mayor  sus ganancias incrementaron muchísimo. Y con la ganancia logro comprar más mercadería  para vender, entonces ya cuenta con un buen inventario y su negocio se ha incrementado. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos que es lo que sus clientes más solicitan. El sueño de ella es obtener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Isaac is 37 years old and has a son under his care. He owns a convenience store where he sells rice, beans, sugar and other household products. He started with a loan from an institution and purchased some supplies to open his store. Since then his commerce has increased and his profits have greatly improved. With his earnings he has been able to purchase more products to sell, so he has a good inventory and his business has improved. He plans to use the loan he is currently requesting to purchase basic grains, which is in high demand from his customers. His dream is to obtain financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and other supplies for his store

loans.name: Aldo Jose

texts.es: Aldo José tiene 38 años es una persona muy inteligente y capaz. El tiene 4 hijos y todos están a su cargo. El se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, el no tenia los recursos necesarios para salir adelante con este negocio, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha mejorado, la atención que Aldo ofrece a sus clientes es la mejor ellos no se quejan del servicio que el ofrece. El solicita este financiamiento para proporcionarle a su negocio los productos necesarios para la variedad de clientes que tiene. Su deseo es ampliar su casa para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aldo Jose is a very capable and intelligent 38 year old man who takes care of four children. He has been selling basic grains for seven years to make a living. He did not have the resources to get ahead in this business, but with financial help it has gotten better. Aldo provides very good service to his customers and receives no complaints. He is asking for this financing so he can get basic products for his business to meet the variety of clientele he has. He would like to make his house larger so he can expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, de 65 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Estela de 46 años, quien le ayuda en sus cultivos y sus 3 hijos; Elizabeth de 23, Luis de 20 y Rosa de 17 años. Lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila, para lo cual necesita darles una buena educación a sus hijos. 

La agricultura ha sido para Esteban una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron que trabajando en la chacra la comida no le faltaría. Es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde tiene sembrados papa, alverja, zanahoria, etc., los cuales una vez cosechados llevara a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, lleva 50 años en la agricultura y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. 

Este es el octavo préstamo de Esteban con MFP y sabe que el dinero del crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.
Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, abono e insecticidas, para tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Esteban is 65 years old. He is a very hardworking and responsible father. He lives in his own home with his wife Estela, who is 46. She helps him with his crops. He also lives with his 3 children: Elizabeth, 23, Luis, 20, and Rosa, 17. What he wants more than anything is to have a calm old age and for this he needs to give his children an good education. For Esteban, farming has been an activity he needs to live. Since he was very small, his parents taught him that if he worked in the fields he wouldn't lack for food. That is why he decided to continue with the family work and now he has his own crops. He has planted potatoes, peas, carrots, etc. Once these are harvested, he takes them to market in the city of Tarma. What he likes the most about his work is planting, since he knows that his family's stability depends on this activity. He has been in farming for 50 years. What he considers the hardest is taking care of his crops in sudden weather changes, since this affects his productivity a lot. This is the eight loan that Esteban has had with MFP and he knows that the loan will be beneficial to the development of his activity. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member, and because of this he is very respected. With the eight hundred nuevos soles he is asking for, he will purchase pea seed, fertilizer and insecticide to have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more salon items in bulk.

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Mrs. Juna N. lives in Dolchoki Village. She lives with her husband and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 1 and daughter is studying in grade 3.

Both Mrs. N. and her husband Mr. Lekba N. are farmer in the village of Dolchoki. They owns a piece of land where they grow seasonal vegetables. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily. Mrs. Magarkoti is requesting the first loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for their vegetable farming.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata S. lives in Wellington with her husband and four children. She is 36 years old. She has a shop very close to Wellington Market, where she sells pepper, palm oil, onions, maggi (instant soup), tomatoes, groundut oil and charcoal. Aminata has taken two loans from LAPO,SL since she joined in 2009. She was able to take care of her children's school fees with the extra profits resulting from the loan. She is asking for a loan of SLL1,500,000 to enable her buy more pepper, maggi, palm oil, groundnut oil, tomatoes, rice, charcoal and beans to stock her shop. She intends to make a good profit from this loan that will change her living forever.

loans.use: This loan will be use to buy pepper, palm oil, onions, maggi, rice, tomatoes and beans.

loans.name: Dashbileg

texts.en: Dashbileg G. lives with her husband and grandchildren in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic housing tent). They have been living together in their current home for 15 years. With the help of her husband, Dashbileg operates a newspaper selling business at Huchit Shonhor, a local market in the city. She has been operating her business since 2002, and has gained significant experience over the past eight years. Dashbileg's main goal is to find more sales channels to sell her newspapers. She is an open and very hardworking person. Dashbileg is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase cell phone credits which she will resell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones credits

loans.name: Las Orquideas De Jilo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las Orquídeas de Jilo y esta ubicado en el  Estado de México, en México. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan crédito a credicomun.

La señora Ángela Zúñiga Hernández es integrante de este grupo, tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos varones de 8 y 7 años, ella se dedica a ala crianza y engorda de borregos que inicio hace 8 años con un solo borrego, el cual engordo y lo vendió, y con el dinero compro una borrega para la reproducción de la especie, y así fue como ha ido forjando su patrimonio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de alimento y forrajes para alimentar a sus borregos y en cuanto estén listos venderlos para nuevamente adquirir otros e invertir en el crecimiento de las crías de sus borregas, ella también tiene otros animales como pollos, guajolotes y conejos. Al momento de solicitar el crédito se siente animada ya que dice ha tenido otros créditos que le han beneficiado notoriamente pues con las ganancias ha podido invertir en la siembra para la alimentación de sus animales y el consumo de su hogar, en útiles escolares y prendas de vestir para sus hijos y esta convencida que mientras la actividad siga funcionando ella seguirá trabajando, para así brindar una mayor oportunidad de estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida, ponerle loza a su casa  y los servicios de agua y luz ya que hasta el momento no cuenta con ellos.

También espera a un plazo no muy largo ampliar la cría y engorda de conejos pues considera que este negocio también genera buenas ganancias y tal ves mas adelante pueda conseguir pedidos más grandes para entregarlos en canal o vivos y que el negocio crezca generando para ella y su familia mejores ingresos.

Areli C. Díaz es la presidenta del grupo tiene 22 años y estudio hasta el 3° de secundaria es ama de casa y aun no tiene hijos ella se dedica a la engorda de puercos que inicio hace 1 año y solicita el préstamo para comprar el alimento de estos animales.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:
-	Paulina T. D.  (Venta de dulces)
-	Ma. Luisa M. G. (Venta de dulces)
-	Dolores S. V.        (Cría y engorda de guajolotes y pollos)
-	Celia Hernández G.  (Venta de mercería)
-	Lourdes G. F.   (Venta de Colchas)
-	Graciela D. A.    (Venta de verduras)
-	Yanet T. D.    (Venta de servilletas)
-	Teresa Zúñiga V.       (Cría de pollos)
texts.en:
This group is called the Orchids of Jilo and is located in the State of Mexico, in Mexico. The group is comprised of 10 members and it is the first time that they have requested a loan from credicomun. Mrs. Ángela Zúñiga Hernández is a member of this group; she is 31 years old and studied until the 6th grade. She is married and has two sons- ages 8 and 7. She breeds and fattens sheep, which began 8 years ago with a single lamb, which fattened and sold. With this money, she bought a lamb for the reproduction of the species and that’s how their business began. She is requesting the loan to buy food and fodder to feed their sheep. When she sells them, she will be able to acquire others and again invest in the growth of the lamb from the sheep. Also, she has other animals such as chickens, turkeys, and rabbits. She is excited about her loan application, because she has had other loans, which have benefited her greatly. She has been able to invest in growing food for her animals and to consume in her home. She has also been able to invest in school supplies and clothing for her children. She is convinced that while business thrives she will continue working to provide greater opportunity for her childrens’ education. She will also be able to improve their quality of life by bringing in goods for the home and services such as water and electricity since she does not currently have them. Also, she hopes in time to increase the size of her rabbit-raising business because she believes that this business also generates good profits and maybe later can get larger orders, butchered or alive. Then, the business will grow generating the best income possible for her and her family. Areli C. Díaz is the president of the group. She is 22 years old and studied until her third year of high school. She is a housewife with no children. She started fattening pigs a year ago and is requesting a loan to buy the food and fodder for these animals. The other members of the group include: -Paulina T. D. (Candy Sale)  -Ma. Luisa M. G. (Candy Sale)  -Dolores S. V. (Breeding and fattening of turkeys and chickens)  -Celia Hernández G. (Sale of Haberdashery)  -Lourdes G. F. (Quilt Sale)  -Graciela D. A. (Vegetable Sale)  -Yanet T. D. (Napkin Sale)  -Teresa Zúñiga V. (Breeding Chickens)

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food and fodder to feed their sheep

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
femme de 41 ans avec 3 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 22 ans et 13 ans.elle s'est interessee a la quincaillerie depuis 2001, generalement c'est une activite reservee aux hommes , comme etant tres courageuse et entreprenante elle a ose faire de la quincaillerie son travail.


  Elle a juste 35000f quand elle commence ,elle a elargie son activite 
 en multipliant ses efforts 
avec ce pret elle va
  renforcer les activites en achetant des serrures,crochets, materiels de plomberie;menuiserie, tuyauterie , des robinets et electricite; pointes et vis.
Tres strategique elle va s'approvisionner dans les grands magasins de quincaillerie sur place et soit a Pointe Noire, sa vente journaliere est de 20.000 a 25000 frs par jour, elle epargne toujours pour assurer son avenir et ameliorer les conditions de sa vie et celle des ces enfants.
texts.en:
This is a 41-year-old woman with three children to support whose ages range from13 to 22.  She became interested is hardware in 2001.  Generally, this is a business reserved for men.  But since she is very courageous and enterprising, she dared to make hardware her line of work. She only had 35,000 francs when she stared.  She expanded her business by doubling her efforts.  With this loan, she is going to bolster her business by buying some locks, hooks, and supplies for plumbing, carpentry, electricity, and piping, and some faucets, spark plugs, etc.  A very strategic woman, she is going to stock up at the big hardware stores locally and perhaps in Pointe Noire.  Her sales amount to 20,000 to 25,000 francs per day.  She is still saving money to ensure her future and to improve her and her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying locks, keys, saws, hooks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase palm nuts for palm oil

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is 41-year old lady, married and a mother of a single son. They all belong to a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her son's name is M. kashif and he reads in the 8th standard (grade). Zarina pays attention to his future so that he will walk in the world and prove himself a good human being.  

Zarina operates a decorative embroidery business to bear the education expenses of her son so that he gets a quality education without any hurdles and financial problems. 

Her husband's name is M. B., and he is involved in a timber-selling business. He has been in this business for over twenty years.  
Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy the timbers in bulk and increase his selling.  
She is a fourth-year member. In the last three years she has maintained a good credit behavior with Asasah and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: Purchase timbers for reselling

loans.name: Mussarat Nazir's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat Nazir, 53 years old, lives in the historic city of Lahore, in Pakistan. She makes her livelihood from her clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is also involved in selling clothes.

She purchases cloth from the Azam market, a big cloth market in Lahore. She generates better income with her clothes selling business than from her sewing but she can't quit her sewing because her customers don't allow her to quit because of the quality of her stitching.

Her husband, M. A., is a driver. He works full-time to put three meals on the table for his family. They have three sons who could not complete their education due to financial constraints. They all are young now and involved in different kinds of work. The eldest and youngest son are rickshaw drivers and the middle son has a business of renting bikes.

Mussarat has applied for her third loan from Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan she will buy clothes in bulk and expand her business.

She has applied for a loan for this business because she has been doing it for the last 15 years and she is very sure that she can change the fortune of her family by expanding this business. She is a regular borrower from Asasah and has maintained a good credit record in the last two years.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.fr: H. Jean Marie Vianney est un homme de 50  ans qui a été à Kicukiro en province de la ville de Kigali, il vit actuellement en province de Kigali  district de Kicukiro, capital du Rwanda. Il est marié, il a trois enfants dont le plus âgée a 20 ans et le moins âgée a 3 deux  vont à l’école. Il est salarié dans une entreprise fabriquant les matériaux métalliques. Avec le prêt il veut réhabiliter  sa maison en achetant du sima, pierres pour fondation, portes et fenêtres. Les épargnes continuelles lui permettent de la survie de sa famille et il acheter une vache pour le lait des ses enfants, le reste il le vend pour augmenter les revenues et la capacité financière de la famille. Dans l’avenir il veut acheter une deux autres vaches pour devenir un grand éleveur en abandonnant le secteur des salaries et planifier pour le bon futur de  sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney H. is a 50 year-old man who has lived in Kicukiro in the province of Kigali City. He now lives in the Kicukiro district of Kigali province, the capital of Rwanda. He is married and has three children. The oldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Two of the children go to school. He is an employee in a metal manufacturing company. He wants to renovate his house with the loan, buying sima, foundation stones, doors and windows. His continuous savings enable him to support his family and he will buy a cow to provide milk for his children. He will sell the rest of the milk to increase his income and the family's financial resources. In the future, he wants to buy two more cows and become a large breeder, leaving the wage-earning sector and planning for a better future for his family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sima, doors, windows and foundation stones for his house

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 48 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pepe de 53  años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Ana ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora y media para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa y arveja, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, de esa manera pueda mejorar su economía. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Ana, 48, is a cheerful, hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Pepe, 53, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Working hard, Ana has gotten her fields to produce the necessary products to support her family. Before the sun even shows its first rays she is out of the house to walk the nearly hour and a half to reach her fields where she grows potatoes and peas, products which she later takes to sell in Tarma’s wholesale market. What she likes best about her work is tilling the soil because she feels she uses them well. She has been a farmer for 27 years and considers the most difficult part of it transporting the products to Tarma because the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. In time she’d like to install a grocery store to improve her economy. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she is happy to be able to access it. She wants to thank all the people that will fund it making it possible for her to get the money she needs. She is respected in her communal bank because she imposes order at the meetings. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy new pea seed and sacks of manure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and pea seeds.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Сафарова Гулдаста проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Сын на заработках в России. Сама Гулдаста имеет среднее образование. Вместе с мужем занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Имеет хороший опыт в этой сфере. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Guldasta S. lives in the Yavan district. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 children. Her son works in Russia. Guldasta has a secondary education. Together with her husband, she is involved in animal husbandry. She breeds livestock for future resale. She has a good experience in this field. Guldasta is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es: El señor Osvaldo vive en el Barrio de la Urbanización El Terrado, el se dedica al servicio del transporte Urbano hace como cinco años, él necesita el crédito para la reparación del vehículo, ya que es su fuente de ingresos y debe cambiar algunas partes del motor. Tiene cuatro hijos que asisten a primaria, su esposa se dedica al servicio de la educación, es profesora en un colegio cerca de su casa, ambos tiene como meta conseguir el dinero que les falta para comenzar a construir su casa para ya no vivir en alquiler ya que no les alcanza el dinero para otros gastos que tienen, Ellos son personas responsables y muy carismáticas, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Osvaldo lives in the El Terrado urban neighborhood.  He has been a taxi driver for about five years.

He needs the loan to repair his vehicle because it’s his source of income and he has to replace some of the engine’s parts.

He has four children in elementary school and his wife is a teacher at a school near their house.  The goal of both of them is to acquire the money they still need to start building a house and stop renting because their money isn’t enough to cover other expenses they have.

They are responsible, very charismatic people.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: For vehicle repair.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita B. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Florita buys and sells green bananas in the local community. Florita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Florita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional bananas to buy and sell. Florita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the the 3rd loan taken out by Florita from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of bananas, and as working capital

loans.name: Elida Carmita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Elida,  ella tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido tres hijos de 17, 11 y 9 años, la mayor este año termina el colegio y los menores están en la escuela. Su marido vende periódicos. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de yogurt por litros, el mismo que lo recibe de la ciudad de Quito que es donde fabrican este producto, ella recibe en su casa de dos a cuatro  veces por semana, una vez que recibe el producto, sale a recorrer con sus productos, vende a personas de su localidad y en tiendas a las que deja a buen precio, dice que aunque gane poco lo importante es vender. Trabaja todos los días en sus ventas desde las 7am hasta las 11am, lleva tres años en este negocio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar el producto ya que tiene que pagar por adelantado. Hace tres años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras siempre están atentas a las necesidades de las otras socias. Su sueño es tener algún día su propia fábrica.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Communal Bank “Constructoras del Éxito” (Builders of Success) meets every fifteen days. This city has long been known as the “City of the Valley” because of the many surrounding hills.

Sra. Elida is 36 years old and in a common law marriage. She has three children (ages 17, 11, and 9). Her oldest child finishes high school this year and the younger children are in elementary school. Her husband sells newspapers.

Elida sells yogurt by the liter. Her product comes from the city of Quito where it is made. The yogurt is delivered to her house 2-4 times per week. As soon as she receives her product, she goes out to sell it to customers in her community and to stores at a good price. Elida says it is very important for her to make sales even though she may not earn much. She works every day making sales from 7am to 11am. Her business has been in operation for three years.

This loan will be used to buy yogurt since she must pay for the product in advance. Elida has been a member of the Communal Bank for three years. She likes the fact that her fellow members are attentive to the needs of all the others. Her dream is to have her own factory one day.

loans.use: Purchase yogurt

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora vive por la Zona de Viloma Grande, a 25 Km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, ella se dedica a la produccion de leche cruda y a la agricultura, con el cultivo de cebolla, zanahoria y maiz. Tiene 3 hijos pequeños. de 12, 7 y 5 años. Su concubino la abandono hace tres años. Desde entonces viven solos en su casa y ell a siempre a buscado la forma de  sustentar su hogar por eso tiene multiples actividades como la agricultura, la alecheria y ademas ayuda en un vive con el cuida de plantas. 

Ahora ella desea aumentar su ganado para poder tener mejores ingresos mensuales pues la agricultura solo le ayuda de forma temporal cada 6 meses o cuando es epoca de cosecha, y ella necesita mas ingresos mensuales pues sus pequeños hijos requieren de mas necesidades. Por esa razon solicito un credito para poder compranse una vaca mas.
texts.en:
Dora lives in the Viloma Grande area, 25km from the city of Cochabamba. She works in raw-milk production and agriculture, cultivating onions, carrots and corn. She has three small children, who are 12, 7 and 5 years old. Her partner left her three years ago. Since then, they have lived alone in their home. She has always looked for a way to support her household, which is why she undertakes multiple economic activities, such as agriculture, dairy farming and also helping in a nursery taking care of the plants.

Now she wants to increase the number of her cattle in order to have greater monthly income, since agriculture only helps her on a seasonal basis every six months or when it is harvest time. She needs more monthly income to support her children. For this reason, she sought a loan in order to buy herself one more cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hugo Enrique

texts.es:
Hugo, reside en Corinto, departamento de Morazán, tiene 25 años de edad, administra una tienda de la cual obtiene los ingresos para dar la alimentación y salud a su esposa y su hija Nohemí de 2 años de edad, este negocio tiene 3 años de existir y surge por iniciativa propia, él con su esposa lo atienden sin horario fijo.
Actualmente el necesita comprar mercadería para el negocio ya que por las fiestas de fin de año que se acercan quiere preparase desde ya, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, ayudando así a que el negocio este preparado para atender la demanda y ofrezca un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Él sueño de Hugo es poseer un negocio estable que le garantice ingresos para solventar las necesidades del hogar y le permita ir creciendo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Hugo, who lives in Corinto in the Department of Morazán, is 25 years old. He runs a store, which provides what he needs to ensure that his wife and 2 year old daughter Nohemí have their health and enough to eat. He has had the business since he started it on his own initiative 3 years ago. He and his wife serve in the shop, without a fixed schedule. 

Now he needs to buy merchandise for the store, because he wants to be prepared for the approaching festive season. He is therefore seeking a loan for the purchase of basic household goods, so that the store will be well-prepared to meet demand and offer a better service to customers.

Hugo's dream is to have a solid business which guarantees him sufficient income to meet the needs of the household and permit him to expand his market.

loans.use: To buy household products

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa L. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. She is 31 years old. Elsa is separated from spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, sardines, spices, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily use products to sell

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila L. is from the village of Katipunan,Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Cirila is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Cirila owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising goats for sale. Cirila has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Cirila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cirila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cirila is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase young goats, livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cirila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo I Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama San Judas Tadeo I, está ubicado en San Martín Texmelucan en el Estado de puebla. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. Felix S. H es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 42 años, estudió hasta el 3ro de secundaria. Es casada y tiene en total 3 varones.  Ella se dedica a vender en una cooperativa escolar que inició hace 2 años. Aparte tiene su negocio de comida que con ayuda de su esposo atienden por la tarde comenta que gracias a este tipo de prestamos a logrado sobresalir con el paso de los años, al igual apenas inicio un pequeño negocio de papelería. Solicita el préstamo para compra de refrescos, jugos y otras cosas para su negocio. Sus clientes son alumnos y maestros de la escuela. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada ya que obtiene un crédito que para ella es importante para sobresalir cada día. Quiere este crédito para compra de refrescos, jugos y pan, gas y una mesa para que puedan comer los maestros. También espera que con este préstamo y su esfuerzo poder tener unas mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called San Judas Tadeo 1. It is located in San Martín Texmelucan, in Puebla state. The group has 9 members. Felix S. H. is the group president. She is 42 and studied up to the third grade of secondary school. She is married and has 3 sons. She sells in a school cooperative that she started two years ago. She also has a food sales business with which she helps her husband in the afternoons. She says that thanks to these loans she has been able to excel as the years have passed. She recently started a grocery store business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of drinks, juice and other items for her business. 
Her customers are students and teachers at the school. She is excited to be getting the loan that for her is so important to her success. She wants this loan for purchasing drinks, juice and bread, pop and a table where the teachers will eat.
She also hopes that through this loan and her hard work she and her family will have  better quality of life.

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Las Velocez Group

texts.es: El  grupo se llama LAS VELOCEZ, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México. Esta conformado por 11 integrantes, entre ellas está la señora Maria Isabel A. y tiene 24 años de edad,  tiene  1 hijo de 1 año 8 meses. Se dedica a vender zapatos desde hace  2 años. Ella vende para poder apoyarlo porque lo que gana su esposo no les alcanza, ella comenzo vendiendo zapatos con su familia y posteriormente  como vendia mucho comenzo a vender con los vecinos y en las colonias aledañas. Con su crédito pretende comprar muchos catálogos de diferentes marcas. Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y asi poder darles una educación a su hijo, y que el negocio cresca cada día más.
texts.en: The group called "Las Velocez" is located in the state of Mexico.  There are 11 members: among them is Maria Isabel A., who is 24 years old.  She has a child who is a year and 8 months old.  Maria has been selling shoes for 2 years.  She works to support her child, since her husband's earnings are not enough for them.  She started selling shoes with her family, and later, as she sold a lot, she started to sell to neighbors and in the surrounding neighborhoods.  With her loan she plans to buy many catalogs of different brands.  Her desire is to make her business grow, and in this way be able to give a good education to her child.  She hopes to see her business grow larger each day.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman who lives in Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  perfumes/cosmetics sales and fish vending.  Her husband Roland, who is 46 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 12 to 24 years old. Elisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy perfumes/cosmetics to sell to continue to save up for future house renovations.  Elisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more perfumes/cosmetics

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silvia Patricia; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica al negocio de carpintería metálica ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo llevan años en este negocio del cual se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante, a la vez la socia trabaja en una ONG como madre sustituta cuidando a niños que no tienen papas esta actividad le gusta mucho ya que puede ayudar a niños que necesitan cariño. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de una maquina de soldar para su negocio ya que con este instrumento le será más fácil realizar su trabajo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu de San Jeronimo” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 44 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Silvia manages a metal shop where she and her husband have worked together for several years. She is pleased with her business because it has enabled her family to get ahead. At one time she worked for an NGO as a foster mother who took care of orphans. She enjoyed that job very much because was able to provide the love these children needed.

Silvia is requesting a loan to buy a soldering machine for her business since it will help make her job easier. She is happy to receive this loan and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase a soldering machine

loans.name: Naseem Akhter's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Naseem Akhter is a seamstress by profession. She does sewing work for her neighboring clients. She receives a good number of orders every month and earns a good income after completing them. She is also a very good housewife and takes care of her household responsibilities very well. 
 
She is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a three-room brick house for the past 14 years. 

Her husband’s name is M. A., and he operates a lathe machine. He provides iron items and spare-part repair services to his clients. He is very good in his work and provides quality service.
 
Naseem has three children. All of them are young and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy iron in larger quantities, which will enable him to repair more iron items and increase his monthly income.  

He has been operating this business for many years, and Naseem is very confident about the positive growth of his business after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. She has maintained good credit behavior in every loan year and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem Akhter.

loans.use: to buy iron for the lathe business

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en: Rodora is a 34-year-old married mother of two children, aged five and four months. She grows rice and corn to earn a living. She tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. Rodora sells her harvest to the people in her community. She works hard to support her family. Rodora has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that her business will grow and dreams for her children to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Blanca Azucena se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una mujer muy admirable, por lo que se siente muy contenta con su medio de vida. Inicio este negocio hace más de 8 años con muy pocos productos fue que ella inicio este medio de vida. Se siente muy contenta pues la mayoría de sus clientes son personas jóvenes que le solicitan calzado, perfumes, ropa en general, cremas, tratamientos entre otros productos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de estos productos. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en: Blanca Azucena sells general merchandise.  She is an admirable woman and she is very happy with her career choice.  She started this business eight years ago with only a few items and is happy because most of her customers are young and request shoes, perfume, clothing, creams, and skin treatments, among other products.  She is asking for this loan to invest in these items.  She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Cecilia Verónica

texts.es:
La Señorita. Verónica C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, cuenta con grandes iglesias que resaltan la belleza de esta ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio de todo tipo, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señorita. Verónica tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres y ayuda en la economía de su hogar. La casa en la que habitan es propia.
 
Nuestra socia trabaja en la atención de una tienda de abarrotes, esta actividad la desempeña hace algún tiempo. También se dedica  a estudiar Ciencias Educativas en la universidad y está en primer año.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en los gastos de sus estudios.
 
Su meta es llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Verónica C., age 21, is a member of the communal bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Working Women); she lives in the city of Azogues -- a city known for its architectural beauty, its great churches, and its people who are very kind and charismatic. Veronica is single; she lives with her parents and helps them with the household expenses. They live in their own house. 

Veronica works in a grocery store; she has been in this job for some time. She is also studying at the university in an Education Science program; she is currently in her first year.Veronica has been a member of the communal bank for a year and plans to use the new loan to pay for her studies. Her goal is to become an accomplished professional.

loans.use: to pay for education expenses

loans.name: Segundo Andres

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su menor hijo. Ellos residen en una localidad bastante grande del  distrito de Chepen en el departamento de La Libertad a una hora de Chiclayo.

Segundo se dedica a la comercialización de juguetes, en una zona comercial cerca a su hogar.  Dicha actividad la realiza de manera ambulatoria desde hace más de 6 años, en los cuales a obtenido experiencia en el rubro. Con estas actividad segundo realiza el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Segundo está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para poder invertir en su negocio, comprando más mercadería y de esta manera obtener mayores oportunidades de venta.

Segundo es una persona entusiasta y empeñosa, con muy buenas referencias, además cuenta con el apoyo su familia, para desarrollar su negocio y poder salir a delante.
texts.en:
Segundo, 48, lives with his wife and youngest son.  They live in a rather large town in the district of Chepen in the department of La Lilbertad, an hour from Chiclayo.

He sells toys at the shopping center near his home.  He has been working as a street vendor for over six years and gained much experience.  With this business he is able to support his family.

Segundo is very enthusiastic and hard-working, with good references.  He also has the support of his family to develop his business and get ahead.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Sophin

texts.en: Sophin, 54, resides in Kampot province, Cambodia, an area known for fresh seafood. Sophin is a housewife and her husband is a village chief, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 54 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. Sophin is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to provide transportation services when he is available from his work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Bismark

texts.en: Bismark, 24, is married with one child and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for three years, and with the income earned, he has been able to buy land. His hardship is debtors who delay payments and his vision is to have a wholesale business plus a building in town. Bismark needs the loan to buy biscuits for resale.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Piellina

texts.en:
Piellina has practiced farming in Njabini for the last six years. She is 38 years old, married to Joseph and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Piellina hopes to buy more land and practice mixed farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en: Khetam is a 28-year-old woman. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Khetam took out a loan from FATEN to purchase living room furniture that they couldn't purchase when she got married. She was using plastic chairs instead. Now that she learned about FATEN, she took out the loan to pay for the furniture and pay the loan back on a daily basis. Khetam is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in FATEN's Branch office.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es: El joven Michael, es nacido Santa Ana de Yacuma en el Beni, vive en anticrético, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona la Guardia, es de ocupación moto taxista, trabaja, hace unos dos años desde que se dedica a esta labor, el destino del crédito es para terminar de cancelar su moto nueva y trabajarla, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado ya que esta es su única herramienta de trabajo y con esta actividad mantiene a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Michael was born in Santa Ana de Yacuma in El Beni. He lives in a house located in the  La Guardia. He is a motorcycle taxi driver and has done this for two years. The loan is to finish paying for his new motorcycle and to put it to use. He is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered since this is his only work took. With this activity he supports his family. He is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to finish paying for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tiessiri Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe TIESSIRI VI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et qui ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont  le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAMA, debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz .
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group TIESSIRI VI are married women who average 29 years of age  and three children each. The women live in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. The group members are now on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, MAMA, who is standing in the middle of the photo, intends to buy inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay the cost of plowing for maintaining about 0.25 hectare of rice. After the harvests, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. MAMA plans on making an average profit of about 20,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, weeding, and assorted equipment

loans.name: Yhenny

texts.es: La señora Yhenny se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y cenas con ayuda de su madre. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser: arroz, fideo, carne, así podrá ofrecer a su clientela mayor variedad en el menú que ofrece.  Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona de villa  armonía en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera  y tiene un  hijo. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Yhenny sells lunches and dinners with help from her mother.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients like: rice, noodles and meat so that she can offer a wider variety in the menu she offers.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Armonía zone.  She’s single and has a son.  This is the first time the client has obtained an IMPRO loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 7 años respectivamente; ella es una diseñadora gráfica, que trabajó durante 15 años ejerciendo su profesión en una importante empresa de la ciudad  y el año pasado cuando dejó de trabajar, puso a funcionar su idea emprendedora de vender mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos. que hoy tiene empeño en hacerla crecer y desarrollar todo su potencial, para genera estabilidad en sus ingresos y mayor bienestar para su hogar. Su principal mercado son sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y ahora cuenta con muchos referidos, que han generado un importante crecimiento de pedidos, que hacen ver su capital de trabajo insuficiente, para resolver oportunamente sus necesidades. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  accesorios femeninos, cosméticos y ropa. Su estrategia es ofrecer a su clientela descuentos del 5 y el 10% por su pago puntual y así ha logrado fidelizarlos. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local al público, para incrementar sus ventas y lograr una atención confortable y estable, para que sus clientes continúen prefiriéndola. En su negocio maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 35% y una rotación de inventarios de 4 días, indicadores financieros desde los cuales planea su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Liliana is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 4 and 7 respectively. She is a graphic designer and worked for 15 years in this profession for a major company in the city. When she left this job last year, Liliana came up with the idea of selling merchandise through specialty catalogs. Today she is committed to growing and developing to her full potential so that she can generate a stable income in order to provide for the welfare of her household. Her main market consists of her neighbors, friends, relatives, and now the many referrals that she has accumulated. Even though Liliana has experienced significant growth in her orders, she has not built up sufficient capital necessary to respond to opportunities. For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Liliana will use the money to buy women’s accessories, cosmetics, and clothing. Her strategy is to offer her customers discounts of 5 and 10% for paying on time and for being loyal. Going forward, her goal is to have a shop that is open to the public so that she can increase her sales and provide comfortable and stable service that will encourage her customers to continue doing business with her. Liliana maintains a profit margin of no less than 35% and a product turnover period of four days. These financial indicators signal her plans for growth.

loans.use: to buy women’s accessories, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Iván Darío

texts.es:
Iván es un luchador incansable que nunca se ha rendido ante las dificultades, a sus 53 años de edad se considera un soñador, pues desde que sus hijos nacieron se ha preocupado por brindarles estabilidad y armonía en el hogar y para ello ha tenido que enfrentar grandes retos como el de llegar a la ciudad después de haber vivido por muchos años en el pueblo de donde es oriundo, Cañas Gordas, municipio que hace parte del departamento de Antioquia, allí trabajó en una finca y con la ilusión de progresar y brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos  se trasladó a Medellín, donde actualmente tiene una panadería y salsamentaria, en su negocio la variedad y calidad de sus productos, marcan la diferencia. 

Sueña con que este progreso sea continuo, es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo, ya que él no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar un botellero, en el cual organizar mejor las botellas, dándole al negocio más orden, más espacio, y mejor apariencia.
texts.en:
Iván is a tirelessly determined man who has never surrendered when faced with difficulties. At 53 years of age, he considers himself a dreamer as since the birth of his children he has been concerned with providing them with stability and harmony in the home. To do this he has had to face great challenges such as coming to the city after living for many years in his home town of Cañas Gordas, a municipality that forms part of the department of Antioquia where he used to work on a farm. With the dream of making progress and providing his children with a better future, he moved to Medellín where he currently has a bakery and delicatessen. In his business, range and quality of product make a difference.

He dreams that this progress continues. That  is why he is asking for a loan as he does not have the capital necessary to buy a bottle holder, with which to better organize the bottles, making the business more organized and giving it more space and a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy a bottle holder that he needs for his business.

loans.name: Remedio

texts.en:
This is Remedio.  He is 50 years old and is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. He is married to Jesselyn, a caregiver and mother to their three children. Their eldest child is already in high school while the other two are still staying at home. Remedio, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedio operates a rolling store. His rolling store is basically a small household product store, which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers and basins to the local neighborhood. He drives his rolling store within the local community to sell the products. He earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, Remedio is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plasticware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and other items to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Remedio hopes that his business will continue to be successful and dreams to have a permanent store. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy plasticware

loans.name: Main Street Group

texts.en:
Suward is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Suward was born in Makeni city 28 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has 5 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Suward sells market food – salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Suward and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Suward is going to use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy salt, margi, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, margi, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: El Futuro 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Mari is one of the members in the group called El Futuro 6 & 7 (The Future). She has two children and they live together with her long term partner in a simple structure home. Her group is located in a rural zone in the outskirts of the touristy city of La Romana. Her community is a sugar cane growing area where the main activity is growing and cutting sugar cane. These 10 women carry out a variety of activities like the sale of clothes, cosmetics and shoes; beauty salon, grocery store among others.

Mari is very excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional having paid her previous loans and invested her loans and profits in her business. Mari started her business 15 years ago, with a help she received from her mother, now she has a little grocery store called in Dominican Republic “colmado” which is a small grocery store where her neighbors come by to purchase basic need items for their families daily meals. She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, and other goods. 

Her most difficult challenge is to have her own house, this is also her most important dream, when she has her own house, she will be very happy and proud of her work.

loans.use: to buy rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es:
A sus 48 años de edad, Luz Estella vive con su esposo y su hijo en el barrio la salle de la ciudad de Medellín, desde hace 7 años consiente de la necesidad de colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Luz creo su propio negocio, vende en un puesto en una de las principales calles de su barrio comidas rápidas y jugos naturales. 

Ahora Luz Estella, ve la necesidad de irle realizando mejoras a su negocio con el fin de ser mas eficiente y mediante esto atraer nuevos clientes, por eso a solicitado un crédito para comprar 2 licuadoras nuevas al igual que surtido para su negocio, logrando así mejorar sus activos, producir más, mejorar las ventas y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida para brindarles todo lo que se merecen.
texts.en:
At the age of 48, Luz Estella lives with her husband and son in the city of Medellín’s La Salle neighborhood.  Conscious of the need to help her husband meet household expenses Luz started her own business seven years ago.  She sells fast food and natural juices in a stand on one of her neighborhood’s main streets.

Now Luz Estella sees the necessity to do some improvements to her business so that she can be more efficient and attract new customers.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to buy two new blenders as well as ingredients to stock her business thereby having more assets to produce more, improve sales and proportionately her quality of life to provide them with all they deserve.

loans.use: to buy two blenders and ingredients.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 26 years old and married with two children between the ages of 2 and 3 years old. Jacqueline sells tableware and has two years of experience in this business.

Jacqueline has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more tableware (dishes, plates, spoons, cups, etc) to sell. With any profits, Jacqueline will be able to save for her future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more tableware (dishes, plates, spoons, cups etc) to sell

loans.name: Wokape Njete B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wokape Njete B Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Joseph is the facilitator of the Wokape Njete B Group. He is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow maize well to ensure food security for his family and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting twenty-five bags on two and a half acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest ten bags of maize on two and a half acres of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Joseph will save to ensure food security for his family and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Wokape Njete B Group will each plant between half and two and a half acres of maize.
In the photograph above, Joseph is pictured together with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa,  está separada de su pareja hace 9 años, vive en compañía de sus cuatro hijos de 21, 19, 14 y 11 años de edad y una empleada del hogar, instalado cómodamente en propia casa.
El negocio de tiene Rosa es la venta ropa de diferentes modelos para damas, caballeros y niños, para lo cual viaja periódicamente a la ciudad de Lima, para luego venderlo entre sus amistades y familiares de manera personal. Tiene 16 años realizando esta actividad y paralelo a ello tiene otro negocio desde hace 3 años y consistes en la venta de comidas en un centro educativo. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que la mantienen ocupada y la distraen, además del ingreso económico que le generará para solventar sus gastos familiares. Comenta además que gana más en la venta de ropa donde sus ganancias logran llegar hasta el 100% de lo invertido, y con sus ganancias tiene planes de invertir en  abrir una fuente de soda en su propia casa. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso dice será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará más ropa al por mayor a menor precio para tener mayores ganancias, para ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en: Rosa, 39 years of age, is a diligent and hard-working woman.  She separated from her husband 9 years ago and lives with her four children ages 21, 19, 14 and 11 and an employee of the home, installed conveniently in her own house.  Rosa's business is the sale clothes of different models for ladies, gentlemen and children, for which she travels periodically to the city of Lima, in order to sell to her friends and relatives in a personal way.  She has been carrying out this activity for 16 years and along with this she has had another business for 3 years which consists of selling food in an educational center.  What she likes about her businesses is that they keep her busy and distract her, besides the economic income that they will generate to settle her family expenses.  In addition, she tells us that she earns more in the sale of clothes where her profits manage to reach 100% of her investment, and with her profits she has plans to invest in opening a snack bar in her own house.  This will be loan number 2 with the institution MFP.  She is happy with the financial support that she is receiving and desires to continue counting on that support, therefore she says that she will be punctual in making her payments.  With the requested total of 2000 new soles, she will buy more clothes wholesale at a smaller price to have greater profits, for this Christmas campaign.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Originally from the Ponhea Krek district, Navy is 41 years old. She is a peasant who has been growing soy beans and cassava for more than five years to make a living. She now earns more than 15 U.S. dollars per day from her current business. 

Navy is the fourth cycled loan client. The previous loans from VisionFund have helped her grow her business. Now she is applying for another loan. She will use it to grow more soy beans and use some of the loan to buy a new ladder for her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her business growing while having a new ladder for her house.

loans.use: to grow more soy beans and buy a new ladder for her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Vergie is 57 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Tag-ibo, San Juan, Siquijor. To earn a living, Vergie runs a general store and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.

Vergie is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchse stock for her store

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema is 41 years of age and is married with 7 children.

Tumema owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Tumema needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tumema joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tumema's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 1 & 3 Group

texts.en: Mary is the coordinator of her group Dios Verdadero (True God) 1 & 3. This group, in which most of the members are Haitian, lives in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry. Mary makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their five children. Mary is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza. She has a clothing sales business; she sells all kind of clothes, for women, men and kids. With this loan, she will invest in her business by increasing her inventory, buying jeans, pants, shirts, skirts, t-shirts and other items. Mary's long-term goal is to have a successful business and to build her own house. Now she is living in a batey (a sugar-cane company town) and she is very interested in moving to a more affordable community. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kahrman

texts.en: Kahrman is a 52 year old married woman who has two family members from Ashrafia Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for materials that will allow her to arrange flowers and to buy antiques to sell. She would like to sell her products to the shops near her and in other areas. In the future, she hopes to open a small shop to show her products and to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for the materials for her to sell her flower arrangements.

loans.name: Néné

texts.fr: Madame Néné est  une femme mariée qui s’active depuis 5 ans dans la vente de d’huile de palme et de balais. Elle vit dans une des localités du Sénégal. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer aux charges du ménage (paiement factures et frais  de transport).Elle est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de sa zone d’habitation ou elle a déjà remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite présentement un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat d’huile de palme et de balais a revendre. Son intention est de développer son activité de commerce, d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour parvenir a  épargner davantage et diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite  démarrer la vente de jus. Son projet futur consiste a disposer d’une cantine.

loans.use: acheter de l'huile de palme et des balais a revendre

loans.name: Ngeleno Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Silvia. She is twenty six year old, married and blessed with three children. She is a member of Ngeleno Women Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.
She is a dairy farmer. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy high quality fodder for her cows. This will increase her milk production and enable her meet the rising demand for milk in her locality hence more income. She will use the anticipated income to cater for basic family needs such as food and clothing.
 She is grateful to kiva and their lenders for the help and support

loans.use: To buy quality fodder and increase milk production hence more income to cater for basic family needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Elidja N., 26 years old, is a native of Salamanga, Matutuíne District, Maputo Province and is married and the mother of two children. She attended school through fifth grade. For various reasons, she separated from her first husband, and returned to her parents' home, starting a type of business where she walked about selling clothes. She did not have enough funds available to make the business viable, and turned to HLUVUKU's financial services in 2001.

With financing, the results were encouraging, having acquired, repaired and equipped a market-type commercial establishment.

She currently employs four people, including herself. She has two children depending on her, as well as her parents and five nephews whose parents died as victims of HIV/AIDS.
