With this loan, she is trying to increase her working capital in order to respond to the shopping for basic goods needed during the holiday period that is approaching, Christmas and New Year's. This establishment benefits around sixty (60) families residing in the village of Salamanga.

Translated from Portuguese by Naomi Baer, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização : Vila de Salamanga

Cliente : Maria Elija N.

Sector : Comercio

Montante : 47.000,00Mtn (1,808.00US$)

Aplicação : Compra de produtos primeira necessidade

Inicio : 30 de Novembro de 2006

Período : 16 Meses

Maria Elidja N. de 26 anos de idade, Natural de Salamanga distrito de Matutuíne, Província de Maputo, Casada maritalmente e Mãe de Dois filhos, frequentou a escola até quinta classe, por motivos de vária ordem separou-se do primeiro marido, regressada a casa dos pais iniciou negócio de tipo ambulatório de venda de roupa (vestuário), esta não dispunha de fundos suficientes para viabilizar o seu negócio, tendo recorrido aos serviços financeiros da HLUVUKU em 2001.

Com os financiamentos os resultados foram encorajadores tendo adquirido, reabilitado e equipado um estabelecimento comercial tipo mercearia.

Actualmente emprega quatro pessoas, incluindo ela própria, dela dependem dois filhos, seus pais e cinco sobrinhos cujos pais morreram vitimas de HIV/SIDA.

Com este empréstimo tenciona aumentar o capital de trabalho de modo a responder a procura de produtos de primeira necessidade durante a quadra festiva que se aproxima, Natal e Fim do Ano. Este estabelecimento beneficia cerca de sessenta (60) famílias residentes na vila de Salamanga.

loans.use: Increase food stock

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophie, 36,is married and has 3 children.  She started her operations 4 years ago and sells household provisions in her community.  Items sold include canned foods,beverages,soft drinks and bread as well as sachet water.

Ophie has benefited from the KRABAN'S 'TEACH' sessions in February,2007.  She intends to use the KIVA loan to add more items to her inventory.

loans.use: Add items to her inventory

loans.name: Christo

texts.en: Christo O. is a young woman of 37 years. She is married with three (3) children, a LAPO client for over 6 years. She has proved her wealth of experience in her line of business. She needs the money ($550) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream ingredients

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia M. D. S., 58 and her husband Cirilo S., 62, run a despensa (grocery store) at their home. Patrocinia, a retired professor, is a mother of two daughters, ages 26 and 19. The elder daughter is a professor and the other is a student, both of whom still live with her.

Patrocinia and her husband started the store over 7 years ago. Her husband wakes up at 5:30 in the morning to open the store every day and they work until 9 at night. They buy their merchandise from Mercado Itá, downtown Asuncion, and from vendors that pass by and sell to their store. They sell a variety of items at their store, such as notebooks, cleaning products, a huge selection of snacks, and bags.

Products that are sold most frequently are drinks and edible items. Usually, she sells more drinks in the summer when it is hotter than in the wintertime. Recently they introduced a new type of gummy candy to their store, which has been a huge favorite amongst the children in the neighborhood and is selling very quickly. Cirilo and Patrocinia are hoping to receive a loan in order to invest in their business, in particular to purchase a larger variety of products for their store. They would like to buy more of the gummy candy that all the children are demanding from their store.

loans.use: Purchase candy and drinks.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago is 51 years old, married to his wife who is 49 years old. They have 4 children, three daughters and one son, all of them study, and the oldest will finish highschool this year.

From the time he was young, Santiago was learning to work in the small business with his parents. With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lived. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. With the income he was able to open a dispensary in his house and also raise the cattle successfully.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking. He wants this loan to buy livestock, as raising and selling the animals generates an excellent profit margin.

El señor Santiago, tiene 51 años de edad y su esposa 49, tienen cuatro hijos, tres mujeres y un varón, todos estudian; tres están en edad escolar y la mayor termina este año el colegio. Desde la infancia don Santiago fue aprendiendo a trabajar en la chacra con sus padres con mucho sacrificio llegando a ser un gran agricultor y productor de la zona donde vive. Después de casarse continuó trabajando en la misma actividad, viendo crecer el fruto de su sacrificio y el de su familia progresando cada vez más, ya que con los ingresos que obtuvo pudo abrir una despensa en su casa y también realiza engorde de ganados vacunos con éxito. Su deseo es continuar creciendo y mejorar cada vez más su negocio para así ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos y verlos profesionales, éticos y trabajadores. Desea el crédito para comprar ganado vacuno, ya que el engorde y venta de estos animales generan un excelente margen de ganancias.

loans.use: purchase livestock, cattle

loans.name: Thi Phuong

texts.vi:
Ms Phượng is 47 years old. She lives in Phú Mẫn hamlet, in the town of Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is married with 2 school aged children. Before she worked as a laborer for hire: vegetables picking, construction worker, sand bag carrier. She made an effort to save money to start a chicken raising business. Today she has a peep of egg laying chickens. Everyday she carries the eggs to the market to sell. She plans to repair the chicken coop and to expand her business. She really wishes to obtain a loan to realize her plan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phượng 47 tuổi sống ở thôn Phú Mẫn, thị trấn Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Chị có chồng và có 2 con đang đi học. Trước đây, chị chủ yếu đi làm thuê như gánh cát, đánh vữa xây dựng, gặt hái thuê... Sau này, chị đã cố gắng tiết kiệm và nuôi được đàn gà đẻ. Chị dùng số lượng trứng thu được mỗi ngày mang ra chợ bán. Hiện tại chị đang muốn cải tạo lại chuồng gà cho phù hợp và rộng rãi hơn. Chị rất mong muốn có được khoản vay như đã đăng ký để thực hiện kế hoạch của mình.

loans.use: To repair the chicken coop.

loans.name: Lonise

texts.en:
Lonise is a lady of 41 years and is married with three children. She applied for this loan in order to buy food and ingredients needed for running her business. She sells food at the school every day and at stores near her house on weekends. She earns around $64 USD ($160 ST) per day, but more on weekends.

She said she is very happy with her business, because it gives her much help and the money is used to meet her family's needs, especially those of her children. She said she’s going to stay in the program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy food and supplies for her fast food stall

loans.name: Anarsih

texts.en: Anarsih, 42, is a mother of 3 children. Her husband, E., sells waste materials and earns USD21 a week. To supplement her husband's income, she sells vegetables such as chilis, onions, etc., earning USD5 a day. She needs a loan of USD75 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty K. is 36 years old and married with three school-going children. She runs a retail shop together with her husband in Nakifuma, and she has been our client for over three years. The loans have really helped her in building her shop, especially with transporting her goods from the trading center, although at times she buys goods from the wholesale shop in her area that belongs to another member of ours.

loans.use: Restock her shop with more sugar, salt, soap, Vaseline and toothpaste

loans.name: Affiwa Akpé

texts.fr:
Ms. Affiwa Akpé A., age 52, is married to Mr. Richard TSOKONA, who is a taxi driver. They have three children. Ms. A.'s main business is commerce in fabrics at the grand marketplace in Lomé. She began in this business and has been in it since 1982. Her first loan of 450,000 francs CFA, which she has by the way paid off promptly, enabled her to avoid inventory shortages up until now. Given the size of her current customer base, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy 50 roles of new fabrics to meet customer demand better. With the income from this business, she helps her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 52 ans, madame A. Affiwa Akpé s’est mariée à Monsieur TSOKONA Richard qui est un conducteur de Taxi. Ils ont 3 enfants. Madame A. Affiwa Akpé a pour activité principale l’achat et vente de tissus au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a commencé par exercer cette activité depuis 1982. Son premier crédit d’une valeur de 450.000FCFA qu’elle a d’ailleurs promptement remboursé lui a permis de ne plus avoir une rupture de stock jusqu’à ce jour. Compte tenu de l’importance de sa clientèle actuelle, elle sollicite un emprunt d’une valeur de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 50 rouleaux de nouveaux tissus pour mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. Avec le revenu de cette activité elle aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales.

loans.use: To stock an inventory of fabrics

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta belongs to "Banco Comunal Vecinas Unidas", located in "`Jr Agustín Cauper 167, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali". She is 48 years old and mother of 6 children. However, her income is not enough to support her family. WIth the first loan she received, she invested on some clothes for her store.

She currently owns a store which has clothes for men, women and children. She wakes up every morning at 7am in order to prepare breakfast for her kids. She then heads to her store in which she works until 9pm.

With this loan of S/. 1,000, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy more clothes, fabrics of diverse colors and forms, needles, threads, etc.

Violeta is very happy, her business is improving every day. She still remembers when she began and is happy to be able to support her family. She has become a hard-working woman and is very happy for the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Violeta pertenece al Banco Comunal Vecinas Unidas, ubicado en el Jr Agustín Cauper 167, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 48 años y es madre D. 6 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan para mantener los gastos familiares, Violeta con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en el negocio D. confecciones D. ropas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. bazar y confecciones D. ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, se levanta a las7am para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. allí se dedica a la atención D. su bazar y confección D. sus prendas hasta las 9 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará pasamanería, telas D. diversas formas y colores, blondas, hilos, etc. Violeta esta muy feliz y contenta, su negocio esta mejorando cada día y no olvida que cuando empezó todo era distinto ahora ella pueD. sacar adelante a su familia valiéndose por si misma, se ha convertido en una mujer luchadora, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
I must fix the front door of my house as well as a window since they were not finished during a refurbishment that we did. I am requesting $430 to carry out the repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Door and window repairs

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya H. is 51 years old and is married. She and her husband have raised seven children. For more than 12 years, Robiya has been selling vegetables, such as cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers, and garlic. Her son helps Robiya with the business. Robiya begins her work day early in the morning, at 5:00 a.m., buying vegetables wholesale from the local farmers, and then selling them in the market. In the market, she is known among people because of her attractive prices and friendly personality. This allows Robiya’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family.

Now it is the season and her goods are in great demand. For this reason, she is planning to purchase new fresh fruits and vegetables to sell. For this purpose, she requests 2600 Somoni ($775 USD) for 10 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Robiya’s business.

loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables that she sells

loans.name: Shabnam's Group

texts.en:
Shabnam baji is the wife of A. S. and lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) They have been married for the last 25 years and she is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son works in a rice factory. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school near her neighborhood. Shabnam’s husband has a livestock business and Shabnam baji sews clothes on order from her neighborhood. Now she wants a loan for her husband’s livestock business. He wants to buy another animal and resell it for profit.

The loan group has three additional members. Hanifan baji wants a loan for her scrap work. Jannat baji requests a loan for her embroidery business, and Yasmeen baji wants a loan for her garment business.

Loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Toa

texts.en:
Toa R., 29, is a young farmer living in Siem Reap with her husband, Lea Lam, and their two children. She raises pigs out of her home, making the wine that is used to help them grow large quickly. She typically makes US$2 per day, while her husband works their field making US$3 per day. Toa R. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a pair of cows to help her husband with the field work. They can be valuable as plows and the family believes the benefits that two cows can provide to the family's farm will be enough to increase their income and improve their business. They are optimistic about this investment and they look forward to the relief that these cows will provide to the work on the farm.

Toa R. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: Toa would like to purchase cows to help around the farm.

loans.name: Atsufe

texts.fr: Atsufe A.  est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis bientôt 3 ans à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle désire par ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des cartons de laits, de sucres, des sacs de riz et autres produits afin de répondre au besoin de la clientèle. Atsufe compte sur cette opportunité pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
For almost three years, Atsufe A. has been the proprietor of a general store in Kpalimé, a town situated about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 35, married and the mother of two children. She would like to use this loan to expand her business by buying cases of milk, sugar, sacks of rice and other products so as to meet the needs of her clientele. Atsufe is counting on this opportunity to be able to better support her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cases of milk, sugar, sacks of rice and other products for re-sale

loans.name: Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal trabajando juntas pertenece a L. comunidad D. Yauli ubicado en el Departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad tiene 2 zonas turísticas D. Incañan y también es zona comercial.

Norma S., es casada tiene 7 hijos, se dedica a tejer en telares, teje día y noche a pedidos. A pesar D. que esta enferma y L. van a operar Norma continúa con sus tejidos. Con los préstamos que recibe elL. compra materiales como lanas e insumos para su negocio. Su sueño es tener una empresa textil y exportar sus productos, tambien comprarse una maquina remalladora.

Norma L., es casada y tiene 2 hijos, le gusta tejer mantas, gorros, hilo D. lana D. alpaca, ovino, que luego venD. en las ferias D. Paucará – Yauli, algunas veces los lleva a Lima con el apoyo D. su esposo. Su préstamo lo utilizará en comprar materia prima para su negocio. Su sueño es tener una empresa granD. y abrir una tiendita para solventar el estudio D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Trabajando Juntas Communal Bank is located in the community of Yauli, Huancavelica province. This community's economic activities are tourism (in Incañan) and traD..

Norma S., is married and has 7 children. She is a loom weaver, and weaves day and night to fulfill customers' orders. She has not stopped weaving in spite of being ill, and expecting to undergo surgery. Norma has used her loans to buy raw materials for her business. Her dream is to have a textile factory and export her products. She would also like to buy a weaving machine.

Norma L., is married and has two children. She likes to weave covers, hats, alpaca and lamb wool, which she sells at the fairs in Paucara and Yauli. Sometimes she takes her items to sell in Lima, with the help of her husband. She will use her loan to purchase raw materials for her business. Her dream is to have a large textile company, and to open a small grocery store to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Trabajando Juntas Communal Bank needs 6,200 nuevo soles for 10 members to invest in their business

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid B. is a 29 year old trader who keeps his store, which he has already had for 8 years.  He is married and has 2 sons.  He sells drinks, home stuff, hair coloring, etc. 

Zahid doesn't have a permanent job, which is why this shop in the only own source of income for his family.  His wife actively helps him.  Zahid dreams of providing the best education to his children. 

He applied for $1,200 to purchase more inventory to stock his shop and increase his income.  Let's do our best to make Zahid's dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to stock his shop

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. Khom P. is a villager in Krodass Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Koy Kai, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice to earn their living. Since they have only one business from which they can make only a meager income to provide for their family, Mrs. Khom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy ducklings and duck food to start breeding ducks. She hopes to increase their income and improve her living conditions.

Khom is 51 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a computer teacher in the local institute while another one is employed in a garment factory. Two of them stay home to do household work while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy ducklings and duck food to start breeding ducks

loans.name: Lat

texts.en:
Mrs. Lat H. is 30 years old and she now lives in An Loung Tnout village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. En Ny, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In the plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is far froman irrigation system. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Lat H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump to water the field to make the crop more productive.

She has six children. Five are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one, four years old, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy a water pump to water the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Misriah

texts.id: Misriah, 35 tahun, tinggal dipesisir pantai. Sebagai seorang istri nelayan, Misriah menekuni usaha jual beli ikan. Disamping menjual ikan segar, Misriah juga menjual ikan Teri ( ikan kecil yang dikeringkan ). Usaha ini ditekuninya untuk menunjang usaha utamanya menjual ikan segar yang didapat olegh suaminya. Untuk meningkatkan usahanya, Misriah memerlukan dana sebesar Rp. 1.000.000.- Dana ini dipergunakan untuk membeli lebih banyak lagi ikan kecil dari nelayan yang lain. Setelah dibersihkan dan dijemur sampai kering, harga per kilo Rp. 10.000.- Dalam seminggu Misriah bisa menjual 10 kilo ikan Teri. Dengan tambahan dana yang didapatnya, Misriah berharap dalam seminggu dia bisa menjual 20 kilo ikan Teri.
texts.en:
35 years old Misriah lives by a sea shore. As a fisherman’s wife, Misriah trades fish. In addition to selling fresh fish, Misriah also sells small dried fish. She runs this business to support her primary business of selling fresh fish caught by her husband. To take her business to the next level, Misriah needs 1,000,000 IDR. This fund will be used to buy more small dried fish from other fishermen. After cleaning and drying, the fish can be sold for 10,000 IDR per kilogram. In a week Misriah can sell 10 kilograms of small dried fish. With additional capital Misriah hopes to sell 20 kilograms of small dried fish in a week.

Translated from Indonesian by Arliadi (Ludi) Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fish

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia C. is 37 years old. She lives in Barangay Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela, a rural village located near the Cagayan River. Ybanag is the common dialect of the people. She is married to Minileo, a farmer, and they have no children as of now.

She chooses to engage in eggplant production as her business. She has a 200 square meter vegetable garden near their house that she has planted with eggplant. This serves as their alternative source of income that helps provide their daily needs.

Leocadia wants to borrow the amount of PHP 3, 000 that she can use in her business. Aside from eggplant, she is also engaged in meat-vending and part of the loan will also be used for this. She said that she will work hard towards the development of their life.

loans.use: For eggplant production and meat vending

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en: A. Ravshan applied to MicroInvest in 2009 for the first time but she appears to be a reliable client since she has not had any delays in repaying prior loans. She wants to take the next step and increase turnover to expand her existing business. Ravshan has been selling vegetables for 8 years. She works directly with collective farmers and she has lower prices than the bazaar prices. Ravshan sells mostly  tomatoes, cucumbers and onions. Ravshan also works in the local library. Ravshan is applying for a business development loan of 500 STJ for 6 months to import goods on a large-scale. She thanks KIVA for its support and help.

loans.use: large-scale good importing

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo Bernardo en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, se dedica a la atención de su pequeña tienda, la cual tiene en su propia casa y en la cual aparte de comestibles, vende también prendas de vestir tejidas a mano, las cuales ella misma elabora gracias a lo aprendido de joven. Adicionalmente, da clases de tejido y manualidades en el hospital de su zona, ayudando a las personas de la tercera edad a sentirse más útiles. Sus ”viejitos” como de cariño les dice, también quieren mucho a Rosario, ya que siempre está muy alegre y desbordante de alegría, y no es difícil dejar de quererla, pues su magnética personalidad hace que cause ese efecto en todos los que la conocen, es por eso que tiene gran cantidad de clientela, siendo su negocio muy rentable. En el futuro quiere tener una gran tienda donde pueda ofrecer cremoladas, jugos y otros productos, para eso necesita un local más grande. Rosario es una cliente muy fiel a MFP, ya tiene muchos préstamos con esta intitución, pero este es su primer crédito individual, fuera de su banco comunal, y promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará una reja para poder agrandar el espacio de su tienda hacia el exterior, poner mesas para que la clientela pueda consumir los productos al aire libre, esto hará que tenga más espacio y mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Rosario is 62 years old and lives with her husband Bernardo in a house that was left to her by her parents. She is a very happy and charismatic woman who runs a small shop in her home. In addition to groceries, Rosario's shop sells clothing that she makes by hand, utilizing a skill she learned as a child. She also gives classes in crocheting and handicrafts to elderly people at the local hospital, helping them feel more useful. Her “old folks,” as she affectionately calls them, love her, as she is always very kind and overflowing with happiness. It is easy to love Rosario, as her magnetic personality has this effect on everyone who knows her. Because of this, she has a very large clientele and that makes for a very profitable business. In the future, Rosario would like to have a large shop where she can sell smoothies, juices, and other items. For this, she will need to expand her storefront.

Rosario is a very loyal client of Microfinanzas PRISMA, and has already received many loans. This is her first loan as an individual, not as a member of a community bank, and she promises to be very punctual in its repayment. With this loan she will purchase a railing to expand her shop outside and will install tables so that her customers can enjoy their purchases in the open air. This will enable her to have more space and more security.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her shop to provide better customer service

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza tiene 33 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su único hijo. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas (gaseosas y jugos) en su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes para que los mismos se sientan a gusto y regresen otro día. Su negocio le es rentable porque por donde ella vive es la única que vende estos productos que gustan a muchos y sobre todo a los niños. Eliza está contenta con su trabajo, y gracias al mismo, está logrando, poco a poco, sus objetivos. Para más adelante quiere ampliar su negocio y ambientarlo mejor para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Con este ya son 11 préstamos que tiene con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son responsables, coordinados y puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora viene solicitando comprará golosinas y bebidas gaseosas a un costo de 1000 soles, lo demás lo invertirá en la construcción de su casa, ya que sus padres le cedieron una parte de su terreno para que construya su vivienda, donde podrá implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Eliza is 33 years old, a single mother, and lives in her parents’ house with her only son. For six years she has dedicated herself to the sale of candies and drinks (sodas and juices) in her house. What she likes about her job is to give good service to her customers so that they like it and come back another day. Her business is profitable because where she lives she is the only person that sells these products that so many enjoy, above all the children. Eliza is happy with her work and, thanks to that, is achieving her objectives little by little. In the future she wants to increase her business and improve the atmosphere in order to give her customers a better reception.

This will be her eleventh loan with MFP, and she enjoys working with her communal bank because all of the members are responsible, coordinated, and punctual in their payments. With the money she is now asking for she will purchase candies and sodas at a cost of 1000 PEN, and the rest will be invested in the construction of her house, now that her parents have given her a part of their land to build her own house, where she will be able to better set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing of merchandise and arrangement of her living quarters

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma C. is a 44-year-old married housewife and mother of one, who lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City, in the Philippines.  For a living, Alma buys and sells coconuts in a neighboring town. She plans to use her requested loan from Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, as additional capital for her buying and selling business. Her personal goal is to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy additional coconuts

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 61 años, está separada, vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de carne de manera ambulante, ofreciendo su producto a sus vecinos y amistades; y de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hacen compra su mercadería. Es importante para ella asegurarse de que la carne que le vende su proveedor sea de buena calidad y con garantía, porque de eso dependen sus próximas ventas. Cada día, Olga se levanta muy temprano para comprar la carne y llevarla a sus clientes, sabe que su ritmo de trabajo es cansado, sin embargo, disfruta de hacerlo, y piensa en continuar con este negocio mientras tenga fuerzas para ello. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de tener un espacio de amistad donde crece personal y económicamente. El dinero que Olga solicita será invertido en la compra de más carne para abastecer los pedidos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olga is 61 years old: she is separated and lives alone in her own house. For the last three years she has sold meat on the street, offering her products to neighbours and friends, in accordance with the the orders they make for her merchandise. It is important for her to be sure that the meat which her provider sells is of guaranteed good quality, because this is what her future sales depend on. Every day, Olga gets up very early in order to buy meat and take it to her customers. She knows that her work routine is tiring, but she enjoys doing it and she thinks that she'll continue in this line of work while she has the strength to do it. This is her first loan from MFP, and she is very happy to have a friendly space where she can grow personally and financially. The money that Olga is asking for will be invested in the purchase of more meat in order to meet her customers' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina E., 55, is from the village of Katipa where she is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a business whose main source of income comes from manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Marcelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be Marcelina's twelfth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to have working capital.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana N. is forty-eight years old, married, and has given birth to seven children: four sons and three daughters. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer.

Susana is a trader and trades in cereals – maize. She has been in business for ten years and supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Sorohon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Сорохон 37 лет. Она замужем и мать 5-х детей. Занимается перепродажей шерсти и шерстяной пряжи. Её муж пастух. Он пасет свое стадо. Сорохон закупает шерсть у других пастухов и делает пряжу. Сорохон хочет закупить побольше козьей и овечьей шерсти, пока они дешевле. На зимний сезон они подорожают. За этим Сорохон просит займ.
texts.en:
Sorohon is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She sells wool and yarn. Her husband is a shepherd and tends to his flocks. Sorohon purchases wool from other shepherds and makes yarn. Sorohon wishes to purchase some goat and sheep wool, as they are cheaper now, and their prices go up during the winter. To do so, Sorohon requests a loan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of wool and yarn

loans.name: Jelina

texts.en:
Jelina A. is from the town of La Libertad. She is 57 years old. Jelina is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Jelina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling soft drinks, beer, and wine in the local community. Jelina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelina is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana P., from the village of Libertad, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur, is a 52-year-old married mother of six adult-aged children. To make a living, Juana owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from selling gasoline in the local community. Juana has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2007, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to expand the business, Juana is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sipaepae

texts.en:
Sipaepae V. is a 72-year-old married woman with nine adult-aged children. She lives in Siumu where she raises crops, primarily breadfruit. She derives approximately 800 tala WST a month from planting, harvesting, then selling her crops. Sipaepae has been engaged in this business for over seven years.

In 2004, Sipaepae joined SPBD to gain access to its financial services. Sipaepae successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 tala WST from SPBD that was used to purchase harvesting equipment (this will be her sixth loan from SPBD). Sipaepae is now requesting a loan of 1000 tala WST, which she will use to buy fertilizers such as manure. Sipaepae plans to use all business profits to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's lending philosophy is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is a 48 year married with 7 children aged between 6 and 17 years.All her children go to school. Hadjah resides and owns a two roomed house where she staying with nine people. There is electricity and no piped water at home. Hadjah takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 20 customers a day. Hadjah owns a retail shop selling home products goods and other soft drinks in Makerere and sells to all categories of people.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are transportation and medication and feeding the family. Hadjah has been with MCDT for 8 years servicing her sixteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda soap salt sugar and other merchandise Hadjah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure and also build a house from the available profits

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her reatil shop

loans.name: Thear

texts.en: Mrs. Thear P. lives in Ro Lous village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Nak Khom, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer, for plowing, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Thear P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is attending the local school and the others are farmers. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, for plowing, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora  ROSA MARIA R. E., tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II . Ella   presenta estudios  hasta 5to de secundaria,  es  casada tiene 3  hijos pequeños quienes  depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de alimentos, tiene una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró productos alimenticios como: leche, gaseosa, cerveza, verduras, etc.
Con este crédito de 500 nuevos soles comprará gaseosas, verduras, leche, arroz ,fideo, golosinas, etc para surtir su bodega. Rosa sueña con ampliar su negocio y así poder obtener más ganancias para los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
ROSA MARIA is 38 years old, lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú and is a member of the ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II communal bank. She finished 11th grade, is married and has 3 small children who depend upon her financially. She buys and sell foodstuffs and has a small grocery store which she runs from her own home. With her first 300 sol loan she bought food items like: milk, soft drinks, beer, vegetables. etc. With this new 500 sol loan she will buy soft drinks, vegetables, milk, rice, pasta, snacks, etc. to stock her store. Rosa dreams with enlarging her store so that she can make better profits to pay for household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, vegetables, milk, rice, pasta, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee M. is 51 years old, married with two children ages 19 and 21. Immaculee lives with her family in Ngoma district, Kibungo province of Rwanda which is 2 hours from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Immaculee has 13 years of experience in her business selling beverages and other grocery-type items such as Fanta, milk, snacks, and breads. Her shop is open every day from 6 AM to 9PM and employs two people who work as helpers to keep her business running well.

Immaculee is applying for this loan to help grow her business by purchasing additional inventory and supplies which she believes her current customers will want and which will also attract new customers to her store. If successful, this strategy will allow her to earn more profit, which will allow her to grow her business and save money for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase milk, Fanta, bread and other inventory/supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Lucia Z. le está haciendo falta terminar un cuarto, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que su esposo se encargar de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder terminar la recamara que será para sus tres hijos ya que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
Doña Lucia tiene ya más de tres años de dedicándose a su negocio la venta de abarrotes 
con las ganancias del  negocio planea pagar el préstamo, ya que su esposo el señor José Concepción Ramírez se encargara de los gastos familiares, con su sueldo que obtiene como empleado de una fabrica en el departamento de producción.
texts.en:
A room in Lucia Z.’s house needs to be finished. At this time she does not have the money that is needed to be able to buy the material. Her husband will be responsible for making the improvement by working extra hours. She is asking for the loan to be able to finish a bedroom, which her three children will use. Now that they are growing, they need their own space in the house. Lucia has been in the business of selling groceries for over three years. She plans to repay the loan with earnings from this business. Her husband, José Conceptión Ramírez, pays for the family expenses with the salary he gets as an employee in the production department of a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish a room

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de ocho años tiene una bodega en su casa en la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes a sus clientes. Este negocio constituye una importante ayuda para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio ha dido creciendo con el tiempo y goza de buena aceptación por parte de sus clientes debido a la calidad del trato que brinda. Katia se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes para surtir y ampliar su bodega.

Ella es una madre responsable que siempre trabaja por el bienestar de su familia. Su más grande anhelo es ver a sus dos hijos convertidos en profesionales. Este es su segundo crédito con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus cuotas por lo que es considerada una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Katia is 39 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the district of Cayaltí, which is located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than eight years, Katia has managed a store in her home where she offers basic necessities and groceries to her customers. This business is important in helping her meet her family’s expenses.

Her business has grown over time and is widely accepted by her customers because of the quality service provided. Katia has come to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan of 1000 soles to purchase groceries to restock and expand her store.

She is a responsible mother who always works for the welfare of her family. Her greatest desire is to see her two children become professionals. This is her second loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments and is therefore considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ISABEL tiene 47 años, vive en el distrito D. LAREDO, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LAREDO. La socia presenta estudios hasta 6to D. primaria , es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales 2 dependen económicamente D. ella. La socia se dedica a la  venta D. cosméticos. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar cosméticos como: cremas, labiales, colonias, perfumes, shampoo, delineadores, etc. 
Con este crédito D. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará más cosméticos como: labiales, talcos, gel, cremas, polvos, colonias, perfumes, etc . Ella sueña con tener su restaurante y así poder generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 47 and lives in the Laredo District, Trujillo Province, Department of Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Laredo Village Bank, and is educated through the sixth year of primary school. She has a common law husband and three children, two of whom are dependent on her. She earns her living selling cosmetics. With her first loan, for 300 soles, she was able to buy cosmetics, including creams, lipsticks, colognes, perfumes, shampoo, eyeliners, etc. She plans to use this loan for 2,500 soles, to buy more cosmetics, like lipsticks, talcum powder, hair gels, creams, powders, colognes, perfumes, etc. Maria Isabel dreams of having her own restaurant so she can generate greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lipsticks, talcum powder, hair gels, creams, powders, colognes, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Bertha Janet

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas Solitarias” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, ambos menores de edad. Ella estudió superior (incompleta), se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.

Bertha nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar carne de cordero, alpaca, res y chancho.

Su sueño para el futuro es trabajar mejor y hacer crecer su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son reuniones con las socias con las que puede bromear y así puede distraerse.
texts.en:
Bertha, 28, has been a member of the "Las Estrellas Solitarias" communal bank for 3 years. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and has two, minor children. She did not finish college and she is a meat retailer. She tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her working capital. She now will ask for 3000 new soles to buy lamb, alpaca, beef, and pork. Her dream for the future is to work better and help her business grow. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members where she can joke around and entertain herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, alpaca, lamb, and pork.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, el señor Juan José A. se dedica a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras ofrecidas por él mismo en su propio local donde a diario inicia sus ventas desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de las frutas y verduras para continuar laborando y para ello solicita un crédito para adquirir de inmediato dichos perecederos. Entre los que vende se encuentran papas, cebollas, zanahorias, tomates, chayotes, yuca, entre otros.
texts.en:
In the market of Mayoreo, Mr. Juan José A. has a business selling fruits and vegetables. Selling is done by him personally at his own stall, where daily he begins selling early in the morning and works until sunset. He is experiencing the need to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables to continue working, and for this, he is asking for a loan to purchase the said perishable items right away. Among those which he sells are potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes, chayotes (in the squash family), and yucca, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Kurten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Domingo Javier

texts.es:
Domingo E. Bermúdez, Labora como Vigilante en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra  para la  construcción de tres pilares de concreto para  su casa y 5 pliegos de zinc, para el techo de su casa de habitación.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Domingo E. Bermúdez works as a security guard for the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. He is married and has 2 children in his care; they are both school-aged. He has worked with CEPRODEL for a year. Thanks a previous loan granted by CEPRODEL he was able to improve the house that he lives in. He is an excellent client. The loan he requests now will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and stone to build three pillars of concrete for his house, and 5 sheets of corrugated metal for the roof of his home. His aim is to provide better security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Oneyda De Jesús

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, la señora Oneyda E. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a la venta de cosméticos tales como perfumes, cremas, colonias, shampoo, desodorante, entre otros. También ella vende ropa en menores cantidades.
Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los cosméticos para damas, caballeros y niños y también para la compra de la ropa con el único propósito de continuar comercializándolo y de esta forma percibir los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Oneyda E., with great care and dedication, sells cosmetics in El Sauce, León. She sells such items as: perfume, creams, colognes, shampoo, deodorant, among others. She also sells clothing in smaller quantities. She is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics for women, men and children. She wants to buy clothing also with the sole purpose of selling it in order to earn income to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 32-year-old man who is married and lives in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Salam is a National Palestinian Authority employee and owns a computer selling and maintenance store which is considered to be his main source of income.

Salam requested a loan from FATEN to purchase more computers which will increase his number of customers, whether for buying or coming back for maintenance. Islam has a good number of customers and covers a large area of his city.

Salam is the one behind the desk in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchasing more computers

loans.name: Patricia Beatriz

texts.es:
Patricia es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hija en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, considerado el distrito más poblado de la región, pero también el que tiene más altos índices de pobreza, la mayoría de su población se encuentra agrupada en zonas urbano – marginales, es aledaño a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de comida en su domicilio, ella ofrece diariamente menú y cebiche (plato típico del país hecho a base de pescado fresco) a los mecánicos que trabajan por la zona y a los mototaxistas que frecuentan el lugar. Este negocio le provee de ingresos necesarios para ayudar en el mantenimiento de su hogar, ya que los ingresos que percibe su esposo como trabajador de un pequeño hotel no bastan para salir adelante.

Hace dos años Patricia y su esposo adquirieron una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con unos ahorros que habían estado reuniendo, con este vehículo se vienen generando algunos ingresos adicionales, el vehículo es manejado por un chofer particular y brinda servicios dentro del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz y la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El continuo uso brindado a la unidad movil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para que pueda funcionar correctamente. Por ello Patricia se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo así como en la renovación de las licencias necesarias que permitan brindar su servicio dentro de la legalidad correspondiente.

Patricia es una mujer emprendedora y una madre muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la imagen aparece en su vehículo junto al chofer encargado de manejarlo.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 38 year old mother who lives with her husband and daughter in the José Leonardo Ortiz district. It is considered the most populated district in the region and it also has one of the highest indices of poverty. The majority of the population is in urban areas and is marginalized; she lives next to the city of Chiclayo.

Patricia has sold food in her home for many years, she has a menu and cebiche (typical dish made from fresh fish) sold to mechanics that work in the area and to the mototaxistas who frequent the place. This business gives her the necessary income to help the household since the income that her husband receives as a worker in a small hotel is not enough to get ahead.

Two years ago, Patricia and her husband got a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers) with some savings that they collected. They have gotten some extra income from this vehicle. It is driven by a hired driver and the mototaxi runs in the José Leonardo Ortiz district and in the city of Chiclayo.

The continual use of the vehicle has meant that it has had some problems and it is important to repair it so that it can work properly. Patricia is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) that she will use to repair and maintain and to renew the necessary licenses to operate the mototaxi legally.

Patricia is a very enterprising woman and a very dedicated mother. Her biggest with is to give her daughter a better quality of life. She has worked with our institution before and has shown to be punctual and responsible when making her payments. In the picture she is shown with her mototaxi and the driver in charge of driving it.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair, maintain, and renew the operational licenses of a mototaxi.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married to a driver and they have three children. Only one of her children is at the university. Deborah owns the house where the family resides and she takes care of additional family members. Deborah stays in Makerere and moves door-to-door selling second hand clothes. She has been doing this business for quite a long time. Besides this clothing business, she also works as a health worker with MAWDA (Makerere Women Development Association) and works six days a week. She pays for transportation from town to her home. She buys from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. The family has access to electricity and piped water and her monthly expenses include feeding the family, medication and school fees.   She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Deborah aspires to see her business grow big and to build a house on the plot of land she bought with previous loans. She joined MCDT because it was charging low interest compared to other MFIs in the region.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Malani

texts.en:
Malani is a 49-year-old married woman living in the Telijjawila area of Matara, Sri Lanka. She has two sons and two daughters. Malani sells vegetables from home.

Malani’s husband makes a living selling firewood and she helps him with the business. She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help with her husband's business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy firewood for her husband's business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben J. is from the town of Banga. He is 47 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ruben owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years already. In 2009, Ruben joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ruben is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be his second from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mirian Luzmila

texts.es:
Mirian Luzmila P. P. tiene 18 años, y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Mirian es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Mirian trabaja desde pequeña en la agricultura y pecuaria, cultivando papas y habas, y cuidando ganado. Hace las compras y ventas de sus productos en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para mejorar su situación económica, comprando semillas. Sus sueños es cumplir con las actividades que realiza en el campo, seguir con sus estudios adelante, y realizar su propia empresa con más crédito. 

Le gusta escuchar música y la costumbre del carnaval que se celebra con toda la familia. Su familia es unida y siempre trabajan para mejorar su actividad económica
texts.en:
Mirian Luzmila P. P. is 18 years old and lives with her parents in the district of Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Mirian is a partner of the rural "ventanilla Mushuc Yuyai (New Thinking), located half-an-hour from Guaranda. There are a total of 12 young partners who are studying and working in farming at the same time.

Mirian has worked since very young in farming and livestock, planting potatoes and broad beans as well as taking care of livestock. She buys and sells her products in Guaranda.

He requests the loan to improve his economic situation buying seeds. It is her dream to carry out the activities in the field, continue her studies, and set up her own business with more loans.

She likes to listen to music and the tradition of the carnival which she enjoys with the entire family. Her family is united and always works to improve their economic activity.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: G.s. Chavarria Group

texts.es: La Señora Paula C. y Juana del Carmen pertenecen al grupo solidario Chavarría, ella siempre están buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, pues saben que los financiamientos le han brindado ayuda en sus negocios. La Señora Juana del Carmen tiene 45 años es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a una pulpería tiene más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, en el caso de Paula Emilia tiene 54 años, su actividad es una pulpería y venta de mercadería en general, pues siempre está en aumentar su inventario fue así que se unió a su amiga. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula C. and Juana del Carmen are members of the Chavarría solidarity group. They are always looking for a way to improve their income, knowing that these microloans have helped their businesses. Ms. Juana del Carmen is a 45-year-old single mother with 2 children. She has been running a general store for over 7 years. As for Paula Emilia, she is 54 years old and runs a general store. Since she is all about increasing her inventory, she joined her friend. The loan that they are requesting will be used to purchase raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is from the city of Rizal Santiago. She is 40 years old. Josephine is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been in business for more than two years and earns approximately 1,300 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Beugueu Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BEUGUEU JAM  est créé depuis plus de 08 ans. Il est composé de 08 femmes issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA.

Madame Adama P. deuxième à partir de la droite de la photo (mise en médaillon) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. 

Elle vend des céréales locales (mil et maïs) elle vend également des arachides. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et générer plus de bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group BEUGUEU JAM was formed more than 8 years ago. It is composed of 8 women from the same village. They formed their group by neighborhood and kinship. The group is affiliated with the SANGHE DOUKA village bank. Mrs. Adama P., second on the right in the photo (seen in the medaillon), is the leader of the group. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She sells local grains (millet and corn) and also sells peanuts. She has operated this business for more than 10 years. With her loan she is going to increase her stock of merchandise so that she can better satisfy her customers and generate more profit. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family’s financial needs.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local grains

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat has been operating his mixed farm in Nkubu town, Eastern Kenya for the last 7 years. He has employed two people from his community on a temporary basis. His farm produces bananas and milk which he sells to middlemen. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Josphat has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase pipes for irrigation. He says that this loan will increase the productivity of his farm and this means increased income to help in educating his children. His major challenges have been insufficient water supply and inadequate land to expand his farming.

Josphat is 44 years old. He is married and has 4 children whose ages are between 9 and 18. All the children attend school.

He plans to buy another plot of land in the future to increase his productivity and income. He comments that Juhudi Kilimo staff are friendly and the products are farmer friendly.

loans.use: To purchase pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, D. 60 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fortunato D. 64 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Trabajando arduamente Marcela ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos D. papa, espinaca y arveja, productos que llevará a comercializarlas en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos, lleva 37 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar la mayoría D. sus tierras para el sembrado D. arveja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se venD.. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la calidad D. sus tierras.
texts.en:
Marcela is 60 years old. She is a very loving mother and a hard working woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Fortunato, 64 years old, and their 3 beloved children. She hopes to proviD. them all with a better quality of life. Working arduously Marcela has managed her plantations. Every morning she starts her work very early, providing the needed care to her fields of potatoes, spinach, and peas. She takes her products to sell in the city of Tarma, location where she gets the best prices. Her favorite part of her work is the freedom she enjoys when she works in her fields. She has 37 years' experience in the business. The most difficult part of her work is preparing the fields for seeding. In time she hopes to prepare most of her fields to cultivate peas, during this time of year it is the harvest that sells the best. This is her first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She sees this loan as a great help in the advancement and development of her business. She is committed to the responsibilities of the loan. In the community bank she is known as a very responsible and much liked member. The one thousand nuevos soles requested will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers to improve the quality of her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace A. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Mary Grace is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Mary Grace sells personal products such as glasses, toys, silver-plated jewelries and watches in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Verónica Yasmina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Cristo Rey, esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Verónica tiene 39 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad y una linda jovencita de 14 años que aun estudia en el colegio,  su marido es agricultor.
 
Ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura tienen sembríos de maíz y maní así como también habas y habichuelas las cuales las venden en su casa o las entregan a comerciantes de la zona, el maíz lo venden una  parte en choclos (maíz tierno) a comerciantes que lo compran en su sembrío, los cuales los llevan a los mercados de la capital manabita. Trabaja en su sembrío de lunes a viernes desde las 6h30 hasta las 13h00 y los sábados y domingos se dedican  a la venta de pescado ya que como dice la vida esta muy dura y hay que ayudarse con algo más  para salir adelante.
 
Este crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas, abonos y fertilizantes para tener una mejor producción. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta porque no hay que hacer tantos trámites para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que su hija termine sus estudios y tenga un titulo profesional.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, every fifteen days the Cristo Rey Communal Bank meets, this place is known for its traditions and for being a few minutes away from the two best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Mrs. Verónica is 39 years old, she has a common law marriage where she has had 3 children, two are grown up and she has a lovely 14 year old daughter who is attending high school, Verónica’s husband is in agriculture.

Verónica and her husband work in agriculture and they have corn and peanut crops as well as haba beans and kidney beans which they sell in their home or to merchants in the area. The corn they sell in part as choclos (tender corn) to merchants that buy it in their land and who then sell it to markets in the capital Manabita. Verónica works in the fields Monday through Friday from 6:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. and Saturdays and Sundays they work selling fish since life is tough and they have to help themselves with other modes of income to get ahead in life.

This loan is to buy agricultural supplies, manure and fertilizers to have better crop production. Verónica has been in the communal bank for two years and she enjoys it because she doesn’t have to go through so many procedures to get loans.

Verónica’s dream is that her daughter finishes her studies and has her degree.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Korng L., 58, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. L. is a housewife while her husband is a traditional doctor, earning an income of USD 12 per day. L. has to spend USD 88 on food, USD 15 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  L. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a cow to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: Buy a cow to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion A. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Sutay, Brgy. Antipolo, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, as an Avon dealer and a land rental business.  Her husband Leonilo, who is 37 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is seven years old. 

Salvacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Salvacion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 17,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 which she intends to use to buy products for her sari-sari (general) store so that she could continue to save up for future improvements of her business. 

Salvacion A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo is thirty-eight years old.  He lives in the village of Cruz del Mediano in the district of Morrope.  It is a rural district in northern Peru, which is primarily populated by small farmers and individuals who raise animals.  Segundo owns the home in which his family lives.  He lives along with his wife and their three dependent children.

Segundo and his family raise animals in the yard behind their home.  They raise pigs, chickens, ducks and turkeys.
